00071 /**
00072  * \addtogroup GeometricRelations Geometric Relations
00073  * 
00074  * \brief  Relationships and values which depend on the coordinates 
00075  *         in space. 
00076  *
00077  * \description
00078  *
00079  *    The geometric functions compute relationships and values which depend
00080  *    on the coordinates of mesh vertices.  For example, computing
00081  *    the distances between vertices, the element and vertex normals of 
00082  *    surfaces, etc.
00083  */

00094 /**
00095  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
00096  * \brief  Compute the distance between two vertices
00097  *
00098  * \description 
00099  *
00100  *    Computes the euclidean distance between the two sets of vertex 
00101  *    coordinates
00102  *
00103  *    It's cheaper to compute the squared euclidean distance than 
00104  *    the euclidean distance. If you want to compare distances, it's
00105  *    faster to compute and compare the squared euclidean distance
00106  *    (see \ref fc_calcSquaredEuclideanDistance()).
00107  *
00108  * \modifications 
00109  *   - 07-AUG-2002 Natalie Rooney Created.
00110  *   - 28-AUG-2002 Natalie Rooney Changing inputs to be Vectors instead 
00111  *   of float arrays.
00112  *   - 2003-AUG-05  W Koegler  Moved from displacement.c to here,
00113  *   made internal calculations use doubles, minor name change.
00114  *   - 6/14/2006 WSD Guts moved to fc_calcSquaredEuclideanDistance().
00115  */
00116 FC_ReturnCode fc_calcEuclideanDistance( 
00117   FC_Coords v1Coords,   /**< input - coordinates of one vertex */
00118   FC_Coords v2Coords,   /**< input - coordinates of the other vertex */
00119   int dim,              /**< input - number of dimensions in the coords */
00120   double* distance      /**< output - distance between the two vertices */
00121 ) {
00122   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00123   double dist2;
00124 
00125   // default output
00126   if (distance)
00127     *distance = -1;
00128 
00129   // check input
00130   if (distance == NULL) {
00131     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00132     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00133   }
00134 
00135   // log message
00136   fc_printfLogMessage("Calculating euclidean distance.");
00137   
00138   // do it
00139   rc = fc_calcSquaredEuclideanDistance(v1Coords, v2Coords, dim, &dist2);
00140   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00141     return rc;
00142   *distance = sqrt(dist2);
00143 
00144   return FC_SUCCESS;
00145 }
00146 
00147 /**
00148  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
00149  * \brief  Compute the squared distance between two vertices
00150  *
00151  * \description 
00152  *
00153  *    Computes the squared euclidean distance between the two sets of vertex
00154  *    coordinates.
00155  *
00156  *    It's cheaper to compute the squared euclidean distance than 
00157  *    the euclidean distance. If you want to compare distances, it's
00158  *    faster to compute and compare the squared euclidean distance.
00159  *
00160  * \modifications 
00161  *   - 6/14/2006 WSD Created. Contains old guts of fc_calcEuclideanDistance.
00162  */
00163 FC_ReturnCode fc_calcSquaredEuclideanDistance( 
00164   FC_Coords v1Coords,   /**< input - coordinates of one vertex */
00165   FC_Coords v2Coords,   /**< input - coordinates of the other vertex */
00166   int dim,              /**< input - number of dimensions in the coords */
00167   double* distance2     /**< output - distance between the two vertices */
00168 ) {
00169   int i;
00170   double sumOfSquares, difference;
00171 
00172   // default output
00173   if (distance2)
00174     *distance2 = -1;
00175   
00176   // check input
00177   if (v1Coords == NULL || v2Coords == NULL || dim < 1 || dim > 3 ||
00178       distance2 == NULL) {
00179     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00180     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00181   }
00182 
00183   // log message
00184   fc_printfLogMessage("Calculating squared euclidean distance.");
00185 
00186   sumOfSquares = 0.;
00187   for (i = 0; i < dim; i++ ) {
00188     difference = v1Coords[i] - v2Coords[i];
00189     sumOfSquares += difference * difference;
00190   }
00191 
00192   *distance2 = sumOfSquares;
00193 
00194   return FC_SUCCESS;
00195 }

00198 /** 
00199  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
00200  * \brief  Determine angle between two vectors. 
00201  *
00202  * \description
00203  *  
00204  *    Determine angle between two vectors. Because of the return val
00205  *    of acos, vals for the angle are limited to 0->180 degrees.
00206  *
00207  * \modifications 
00208  *    - 01/16/06 ACG revised from old surface_grow when switched from
00209  *       old recursive algorithm to new WSK method for getSurfaceSides.
00210  *    - 01/16/06 ACG moved here from shape.
00211  *    - 06/01/06 ACG changing comparison from DBL_EQUIV to VALUE_EQUIV
00212  *                 with a greater epsilon becuase some cases that
00213  *                 should have been rounded off were not.
00214  */
00215 FC_ReturnCode fc_calcAngleBetweenVectors(   
00216   FC_Vector vector1,        /**< input - 1st normal */
00217   FC_Vector vector2,        /**< input - 2nd normal */
00218   double *diff_angle          /**< output - angle for normal comparison */ 
00219 ) {
00220 
00221   double tempA, tempB, magA, magB, dotprod, diffrad;
00222   int j;
00223 
00224 
00225   //default return values
00226   if (diff_angle)
00227     *diff_angle = -1;
00228 
00229   if(vector1 == NULL || vector2 == NULL || !diff_angle){
00230     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00231     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00232   }
00233 
00234   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting angle between two vectors");
00235 
00236   tempA = 0;
00237   tempB = 0;
00238   dotprod = 0;
00239   for (j = 0; j < 3; j++){
00240     tempA+=vector1[j]*vector1[j];
00241     tempB+=vector2[j]*vector2[j];
00242     dotprod+=vector1[j]*vector2[j];
00243   }
00244   magA = sqrt(tempA);
00245   magB = sqrt(tempB);
00246 
00247   if (FC_DBL_EQUIV(magA,0.0) || FC_DBL_EQUIV(magB,0.0) ||
00248       FC_DBL_EQUIV((magA*magB),0.0)){
00249     fc_printfErrorMessage("Zero magitude input vector");
00250     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00251   }
00252 
00253   dotprod/=(magA*magB);
00254 
00255   if (FC_VALUE_EQUIV(dotprod,-1,(1000*DBL_EPSILON),DBL_MIN)){ //round
00256     dotprod = -1;
00257   }else if (FC_VALUE_EQUIV(dotprod,1,(1000*DBL_EPSILON),DBL_MIN)){ //round
00258     dotprod = 1;
00259   }
00260 
00261   if (dotprod < -1 || dotprod > 1){
00262     fc_printfErrorMessage("Invalid val for dot prod arg to acos: %20g\n",dotprod);
00263     fc_printfErrorMessage("magA = %10g magB = %10g vector1 = (%10g,%10g,%10g) vector2 = (%10g,%10g,%10g) dotprod = %10g\n",magA, magB,vector1[0],vector1[1],vector1[2],vector2[0],vector2[1],vector2[2],dotprod);
00264     return FC_ERROR;
00265   }
00266 
00267   diffrad = acos(dotprod); //will go between 0 and pi rad
00268   *diff_angle = diffrad*180./FC_PI;
00269 
00270   return FC_SUCCESS; 
00271 }

00287 /**
00288  * \ingroup GeometricRelations
00289  * \brief Test to see if variable can be used as displacment variable.
00290  *
00291  * \description
00292  *
00293  *   Test a variable to see if it can be used as a displacement variable on the
00294  *   given mesh. The variable does NOT have to be on the given mesh, but has to
00295  *   match enough to be used. The variable must have the same number of as the
00296  *   mesh has vertices and the number of components must equal the
00297  *   dimensionality of the mesh.
00298  *
00299  *   Returns true (1) if the variable can be used as displacements on the
00300  *   mesh, false (0) if the variable is not appropriate to use on the
00301  *   mesh (including the case if either the mesh or variable are not valid).
00302  *
00303  * \todo Should we be more strick. Should the var have to be on verts? 
00304  *       Should the var have the correct math type?
00305  *  
00306  * \modifications
00307  *    - 02/14/2006 WSD, Created.
00308  */
00309 int fc_isValidDisplacementVariable(
00310   FC_Mesh mesh,         /**< input - the mesh that the displacement would be  
00311                   applied to */
00312   FC_Variable variable  /**< input - the variable to check */
00313 ) {
00314   int numDim, numVertex, numDataPoint, numComp;
00315 
00316   // test input
00317   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh) || !fc_isVariableValid(variable)) {
00318     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00319     return 0;
00320   }
00321 
00322   // collect info
00323   fc_getMeshInfo(mesh, NULL, &numDim, &numVertex, NULL, NULL);
00324   fc_getVariableInfo(variable, &numDataPoint, &numComp, NULL, NULL, NULL);
00325 
00326   // testing
00327   if (numDim != numComp || numVertex != numDataPoint)
00328     return 0;
00329 
00330   // passed tests
00331   return 1;
00332 }
00333 
00334 /**
00335  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
00336  * \brief Create displaced vertex coordinates
00337  *
00338  * \description
00339  *  
00340  *   Create vertex coordinates which are the sum of the vertex coordinates
00341  *   and a displacement variable. Unlike the call 'fc_getMeshCoords', the 
00342  *   caller is responsible for freeing the created coordinates.
00343  *
00344  *   The variable to use as displacements must be associated with vertices
00345  *   and have the same dimensionality as the vertices.
00346  *
00347  * \modifications 
00348  *    - 2003-SEP-04  W Koegler  Moved code from getDisplacedSurfaceNormals here
00349  *    - 01/29/04 WSK, Changed to return double array instead of array of
00350  *      _FC_Vertex. Now can be a public function and more generally useful.
00351  */
00352 FC_ReturnCode fc_getDisplacedMeshCoords(
00353   FC_Mesh mesh,               /**< input - mesh */
00354   FC_Variable displ,          /**< input - variable to displace coordinates by */
00355   double **displaced_coords   /**< output - array of coords in XYZXYZ... order */
00356 ) {
00357   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00358   int i;
00359   FC_DataType datatype;
00360   int numData, dataDim;
00361   double* coords;
00362   double* temp_displ_coords;
00363   void* data;
00364   
00365   // default return
00366   if (displaced_coords)
00367     *displaced_coords = NULL;
00368 
00369   // check input
00370   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh) || 
00371       !fc_isValidDisplacementVariable(mesh, displ) ||
00372       displaced_coords == NULL) {
00373     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00374     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00375   }
00376 
00377   // log message
00378   fc_printfLogMessage("Computing displaced vertex coordinates.");
00379 
00380   // get info & big data
00381   rc = fc_getVariableInfo(displ, &numData, &dataDim, NULL, NULL, &datatype);
00382   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00383     return rc;
00384   rc = fc_getMeshCoordsPtr(mesh, &coords);
00385   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00386     return rc;
00387   fc_getVariableDataPtr(displ, &data);
00388   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00389     return rc;
00390 
00391   // make the displacement coords
00392   temp_displ_coords = (double*)malloc(sizeof(double)*numData*dataDim);
00393   if ( temp_displ_coords == NULL) {
00394     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
00395     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
00396   } 
00397   switch (datatype) {
00398   case FC_DT_INT: {
00399     int *cast_data = (int*)data;
00400     for (i = 0; i < numData*dataDim; i++)
00401       temp_displ_coords[i] = coords[i] + cast_data[i];
00402   } break;
00403   case FC_DT_FLOAT: {
00404     float *cast_data = (float*)data;
00405     for (i = 0; i < numData*dataDim; i++)
00406       temp_displ_coords[i] = coords[i] + cast_data[i];
00407   } break;
00408   case FC_DT_DOUBLE: {
00409     double *cast_data = (double*)data;
00410     for (i = 0; i < numData*dataDim; i++)
00411       temp_displ_coords[i] = coords[i] + cast_data[i];
00412   } break;
00413   default:
00414     free(temp_displ_coords);
00415     return FC_ERROR;
00416   }  
00417   *displaced_coords = temp_displ_coords;
00418 
00419   return FC_SUCCESS;
00420 }

00424 /** \name Bounding boxes */
00425 //-------------------------------
00426 //@{
00427 
00428 /**
00429  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
00430  * \brief Determine if a bounding box is valid.
00431  *
00432  * \description
00433  *
00434  *    For a bounding box to be valid, the lowpoint cannot be "higher" in
00435  *    coordinates space than the highpoint. This is determined by a
00436  *    component-wise comparison of coordinates. A zero width bounding
00437  *    box (lowpoint = highpoint) is considered valid.
00438  *
00439  *    Returns 1 (true) for valid, 0 (false) for not valid.
00440  *
00441  * \modifications   
00442  *   - 10/28/04 WSK, created.
00443  */
00444 int fc_isBoundingBoxValid(
00445   int numDim,          /**< input - the number of dimensions of bbox */    
00446   FC_Coords lowpoint,  /**< input - lower left corner of bbox */
00447   FC_Coords highpoint  /**< input - upper right corner of bbox */
00448 ) {
00449   int i;
00450 
00451   if (numDim < 1 || numDim > 3 || !lowpoint || !highpoint)
00452     return 0; // not valid
00453   for (i = 0; i < numDim; i++) {
00454     if (fc_gtd(lowpoint[i], highpoint[i]))
00455       return 0; // not valid
00456   }
00457  
00458   // passed all tests
00459   return 1; // valid
00460 }
00461 
00462 /**
00463  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
00464  * \brief Determine if two bounding boxes overlap in space
00465  *
00466  * \description
00467  *
00468  *    Returns a flag which will be 0 if the bounding boxes do not overlap
00469  *    and greater than 1 if they do. The flag also indicates the type of
00470  *    overlap where 1 = bb1 is inside of bb2, 2 = bb2 is inside of bb1,
00471  *    3 = bb1 is the same as bb2, and 4 = partial overlap.
00472  *
00473  *    Note that a bb can still be inside of another if they share a boundary.
00474  *    If the bounding boxes do intersect, the bounding box of the overlap can
00475  *    be returned.
00476  *
00477  * \modifications   
00478  *   - 10/27/04 WSK, created.
00479  */
00480 FC_ReturnCode fc_getBoundingBoxesOverlap(
00481   int numDim,            /**< input - the number of dimensions of bbox */    
00482   FC_Coords lowpoint1,   /**< input - lower left corner of bbox 1 */
00483   FC_Coords highpoint1,  /**< input - upper right corner of bbox 1 */
00484   FC_Coords lowpoint2,   /**< input - lower left corner of bbox 2 */
00485   FC_Coords highpoint2,  /**< input - upper right corner of bbox 2 */
00486   int* overlap_flag,     /**< output - 0 = no overlap, 1 = they
00487                             do overlap, -1 = error */
00488   FC_Coords *overlap_lowpoint,    /**< output - (optional) lower left 
00489                                        corner of overlap bbox */
00490   FC_Coords *overlap_highpoint    /**< output - (optional) upper right
00491                                        corner of overlap bbox */
00492 ) {
00493   int i;
00494   int oneIsTwo, oneInsideTwo, twoInsideOne;
00495  
00496   // default returns
00497   if (overlap_flag)
00498     *overlap_flag = -1;
00499   if (overlap_lowpoint) 
00500     for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
00501       (*overlap_lowpoint)[i] = -1.;
00502   if (overlap_highpoint) 
00503     for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
00504       (*overlap_highpoint)[i] = -2.; // makes bb invalid
00505 
00506   // check input
00507   if (numDim < 1 || numDim > 3 || !lowpoint1 || !highpoint1 || !lowpoint2 || 
00508       !highpoint2 || !overlap_flag ||
00509       !fc_isBoundingBoxValid(numDim, lowpoint1, highpoint1) ||
00510       !fc_isBoundingBoxValid(numDim, lowpoint2, highpoint2) ) {
00511     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00512     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00513   }
00514   
00515   // log message
00516   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting bounding box overlap");   
00517 
00518   // look for no overlap - if either high1 < low2 or low1 > high2 
00519   *overlap_flag = 1;
00520   for (i = 0; i < numDim; i++) {
00521     if (fc_ltd(highpoint1[i], lowpoint2[i]) ||
00522      fc_gtd(lowpoint1[i], highpoint2[i])) {
00523       *overlap_flag = 0; // has to overlap in all dimensions
00524       break;
00525     }
00526   }
00527 
00528   // if they don't overlap, we're done
00529   if (*overlap_flag == 0)
00530     return FC_SUCCESS;
00531 
00532 
00533   // figure out what kind of overlap
00534   oneIsTwo = 0;
00535   oneInsideTwo = 0;
00536   twoInsideOne = 0;
00537   for (i = 0; i < numDim; i++) {
00538     int lowDblEquiv = FC_DBL_EQUIV(lowpoint1[i], lowpoint2[i]);
00539     int highDblEquiv = FC_DBL_EQUIV(highpoint1[i], highpoint2[i]); 
00540     if (lowDblEquiv && highDblEquiv)
00541       oneIsTwo++;
00542     else if (( lowpoint1[i]  >= lowpoint2[i]  || lowDblEquiv ) && 
00543           ( highpoint1[i] <= highpoint2[i] || highDblEquiv ))
00544       oneInsideTwo++;
00545     else if (( lowpoint2[i]  >= lowpoint1[i]  || lowDblEquiv ) &&
00546              ( highpoint2[i] <= highpoint1[i] || highDblEquiv ))
00547       twoInsideOne++;
00548   }
00549   
00550   // set overlap flag & set overlap bb if requested
00551   if (oneIsTwo == numDim || oneInsideTwo == numDim) {
00552     if (oneIsTwo == numDim)
00553       *overlap_flag = 3;
00554     else
00555       *overlap_flag = 1;
00556     if (overlap_lowpoint) 
00557       for (i = 0; i < numDim; i++) 
00558         (*overlap_lowpoint)[i] = lowpoint1[i];
00559     if (overlap_highpoint)
00560       for (i = 0; i < numDim; i++)
00561         (*overlap_highpoint)[i] = highpoint1[i];
00562   }
00563   else if (twoInsideOne == numDim) {
00564     *overlap_flag = 2;
00565     if (overlap_lowpoint) 
00566       for (i = 0; i < numDim; i++) 
00567         (*overlap_lowpoint)[i] = lowpoint2[i];
00568     if (overlap_highpoint)
00569       for (i = 0; i < numDim; i++)
00570         (*overlap_highpoint)[i] = highpoint2[i];
00571   }
00572   else {
00573     *overlap_flag = 4;
00574     if (overlap_lowpoint) {
00575       for (i = 0; i < numDim; i++) {
00576         if (lowpoint1[i] > lowpoint2[i])
00577           (*overlap_lowpoint)[i] = lowpoint1[i];
00578         else
00579           (*overlap_lowpoint)[i] = lowpoint2[i];
00580       }
00581     }
00582     if (overlap_highpoint) {
00583       for (i = 0; i < numDim; i++) {
00584         if (highpoint1[i] < highpoint2[i])
00585           (*overlap_highpoint)[i] = highpoint1[i];
00586         else
00587           (*overlap_highpoint)[i] = highpoint2[i];
00588       }
00589     }
00590   }
00591 
00592   // if numDim < 3, fill in rest of FC_Coords with zeros
00593   if (overlap_lowpoint) 
00594     for (i = numDim; i < 3; i++)
00595       (*overlap_lowpoint)[i] = 0.;
00596   if (overlap_highpoint)
00597     for (i = numDim; i < 3; i++)
00598       (*overlap_highpoint)[i] = 0.;
00599     
00600   return FC_SUCCESS;
00601 }
00602 
00603 /**
00604  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
00605  * \brief Determine the bounding box of two bounding boxes.
00606  *
00607  * \description
00608  *
00609  *    Returns the bounding box that contains the given bounding boxes.
00610  *
00611  * \modifications   
00612  *   - 10/27/04 WSK, created.
00613  */
00614 FC_ReturnCode fc_combineBoundingBoxes(
00615   int numDim,            /**< input - the number of dimensions of bbox */    
00616   FC_Coords lowpoint1,   /**< input - lower left corner of bbox 1 */
00617   FC_Coords highpoint1,  /**< input - upper right corner of bbox 1 */
00618   FC_Coords lowpoint2,   /**< input - lower left corner of bbox 2 */
00619   FC_Coords highpoint2,  /**< input - upper right corner of bbox 2 */
00620   FC_Coords *combine_lowpoint,    /**< output - (optional) lower left 
00621                                        corner of combined bbox */
00622   FC_Coords *combine_highpoint    /**< output - (optional) upper right
00623                                        corner of combined bbox */
00624 ) {
00625   int i;
00626  
00627   // default returns
00628   if (combine_lowpoint) 
00629     for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
00630       (*combine_lowpoint)[i] = -1.;
00631   if (combine_highpoint) 
00632     for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
00633       (*combine_highpoint)[i] = -2.; // makes bb invalid
00634 
00635   // check input
00636   if (!fc_isBoundingBoxValid(numDim, lowpoint1, highpoint1) ||
00637       !fc_isBoundingBoxValid(numDim, lowpoint2, highpoint2) ||
00638       !combine_lowpoint || !combine_highpoint) {
00639     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00640     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00641   }
00642   
00643   // log message
00644   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting bounding box of bounding boxes");   
00645 
00646   // return the bb if asked for
00647   for (i = 0; i < numDim; i++) {
00648     if (lowpoint1[i] < lowpoint2[i])
00649       (*combine_lowpoint)[i] = lowpoint1[i];
00650     else
00651       (*combine_lowpoint)[i] = lowpoint2[i];
00652     if (highpoint1[i] > highpoint2[i])
00653       (*combine_highpoint)[i] = highpoint1[i];
00654     else
00655       (*combine_highpoint)[i] = highpoint2[i];
00656   }
00657   for (i = numDim; i < 3; i++) {
00658     (*combine_lowpoint)[i] = 0.;
00659     (*combine_highpoint)[i] = 0.;
00660   }
00661   
00662   return FC_SUCCESS;
00663 }
00664 
00665 /**
00666  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
00667  * \brief Compute mesh bounding box
00668  *
00669  * \description
00670  *
00671  *    The smallest bounding box (sides parallel to the coordinate
00672  *    axes) that fits around the entire mesh. It is described by two points:
00673  *    lowpoint is the smallest coordinates of the box, and highpoint is
00674  *    the largest coordinates of the box.
00675  *
00676  *    Mesh entities may lie (some will by definition) on the boundary of 
00677  *    the bounding box.
00678  *
00679  * \modifications   
00680  *   - Nancy Collins  Created.
00681  *   - July 3, 2002  W Koegler  Adapted to modified _FC_Vertex\
00682  *   - July 9, 2002  W Koegler  Adapted to modified struct Vector
00683  *   - 2003-AUG-05  W Koegler  changed to use doubles internally
00684  *   - 04/19/04 WSK, Added return argument for number of dimensions
00685  */
00686 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshBoundingBox(
00687   FC_Mesh mesh,            /**< input - mesh handle */
00688   int *numDim,             /**< output - the number of dimensions of bbox */
00689   FC_Coords *lowpoint,     /**< output - lower left corner of bbox */
00690   FC_Coords *highpoint     /**< output - upper right corner of bbox */
00691 ) {
00692   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00693   int i, j;
00694   int numVertex;
00695   double *coords_p, temp;
00696   // must initalize all entries of coords to 0 in case numDim < 3
00697   FC_Coords low = { 0., 0., 0. }, high = { 0., 0., 0. };
00698 
00699   // set default output
00700   if (numDim)
00701     *numDim = -1;
00702   if (lowpoint) 
00703     for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
00704       (*lowpoint)[i] = -1.;
00705   if (highpoint) 
00706     for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
00707       (*highpoint)[i] = -2.; // makes bb invalid
00708 
00709   // check input
00710   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh) || !numDim || !lowpoint || !highpoint) {
00711     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00712     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00713   }
00714 
00715   // log message
00716   fc_printfLogMessage("Computing mesh bounding box.");  
00717 
00718   // setup
00719   rc = fc_getMeshInfo(mesh, NULL, numDim, &numVertex, NULL, NULL);
00720   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00721     return rc;
00722   rc = fc_getMeshCoordsPtr(mesh, &coords_p);
00723   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00724     return rc;
00725   
00726   // initialize  - start with 1st point
00727   for (i = 0; i < *numDim; i++) 
00728     low[i] = high[i] = coords_p[i];
00729   
00730   // find min & max in each dim
00731   for (i = 1; i < numVertex; i++) {
00732     for (j = 0; j < *numDim; j++) {
00733       temp = coords_p[i*(*numDim)+j];
00734       if (temp < low[j])
00735         low[j] = temp;
00736       if (temp > high[j])
00737         high[j] = temp;
00738     }
00739   }
00740 
00741   for (i = 0; i < *numDim; i++) {
00742     (*lowpoint)[i] = low[i];
00743     (*highpoint)[i] = high[i];
00744   }
00745 
00746   return FC_SUCCESS;
00747 }
00748 
00749 /**
00750  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
00751  * \brief Compute displaced mesh bounding box
00752  *
00753  * \description
00754  *
00755  *    See fc_getMeshBoundingBox() for a description of bounding boxes.
00756  *
00757  *    Gets the bounding box of the mesh after displacing the coordinates
00758  *    with the given variable.
00759  *
00760  * \modifications   
00761  *   - 10/27/04 WSK, Created.
00762  */
00763 FC_ReturnCode fc_getDisplacedMeshBoundingBox(
00764   FC_Mesh mesh,            /**< input - mesh handle */
00765   FC_Variable coord_displ, /**< input - coord displacements */
00766   int *numDim,             /**< output - the number of dimensions of bbox */
00767   FC_Coords *lowpoint,     /**< output - lower left corner of bbox */
00768   FC_Coords *highpoint     /**< output - upper right corner of bbox */
00769 ) {
00770   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00771   int i, j;
00772   int numVertex;
00773   double *coords, temp;
00774   // must initalize all entries of coords to 0 in case numDim < 3
00775   FC_Coords low = { 0., 0., 0. }, high = { 0., 0., 0. };
00776 
00777   // set default output
00778   if (numDim)
00779     *numDim = -1;
00780   if (lowpoint) 
00781     for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
00782       (*lowpoint)[i] = -1.;
00783   if (highpoint) 
00784     for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
00785       (*highpoint)[i] = -2.; // makes bb invalid
00786 
00787   // check input
00788   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh) || 
00789       !fc_isValidDisplacementVariable(mesh, coord_displ) || 
00790       !numDim || !lowpoint || !highpoint) {
00791     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00792     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00793   }
00794 
00795   // log message
00796   fc_printfLogMessage("Computing displaced mesh bounding box.");  
00797 
00798   // setup
00799   rc = fc_getMeshInfo(mesh, NULL, numDim, &numVertex, NULL, NULL);
00800   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00801     return rc;
00802   rc = fc_getDisplacedMeshCoords(mesh, coord_displ, &coords);
00803   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00804     return rc;
00805   
00806   // initialize  - start with 1st point
00807   for (i = 0; i < *numDim; i++) 
00808     low[i] = high[i] = coords[i];
00809   
00810   // find min & max in each dim
00811   for (i = 1; i < numVertex; i++) {
00812     for (j = 0; j < *numDim; j++) {
00813       temp = coords[i*(*numDim)+j];
00814       if (temp < low[j])
00815         low[j] = temp;
00816       if (temp > high[j])
00817         high[j] = temp;
00818     }
00819   }
00820   free(coords);
00821 
00822   // set return values
00823   for (i = 0; i < *numDim; i++) {
00824     (*lowpoint)[i] = low[i];
00825     (*highpoint)[i] = high[i];
00826   }
00827 
00828   return FC_SUCCESS;
00829 }
00830 
00831 /**
00832  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
00833  * \brief Compute bounding box of subset.
00834  *
00835  * \description
00836  *
00837  *    See fc_getMeshBoundingBox() for a description of bounding boxes.
00838  *
00839  *    Returns with an error if nothing is marked.
00840  *
00841  * \modifications   
00842  *   - 02/05/04 WSK, created.
00843  *   - 04/19/04 WSK, Added return argument for number of dimensions
00844  *   - 06/15/04 RM, marked list changed to subset
00845  *                  added return FC_ERROR in switch statement if wrong assoc 
00846  */
00847 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSubsetBoundingBox(
00848  FC_Subset subset,        /**< input - subset handle   */  
00849  int *numDim,             /**< output - the number of dimensions of bbox */    
00850  FC_Coords *lowpoint,     /**< output - lower left corner of bbox */
00851  FC_Coords *highpoint     /**< output - upper right corner of bbox */
00852 )
00853 {
00854   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00855   int i, j;
00856   int numVertex, *vertexIDs, numMember, *memberIDs;
00857   double *coords_p, temp;
00858   // must initialize all entries of coords to 0 in case numDim < 3
00859   FC_Coords low = { 0., 0., 0. }, high = { 0., 0., 0. };
00860   FC_Mesh mesh;
00861   FC_AssociationType assoc;
00862 
00863   // default output
00864   if (numDim)
00865     *numDim = -1;
00866   if (lowpoint) 
00867     for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
00868       (*lowpoint)[i] = -1.;
00869   if (highpoint) 
00870     for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
00871       (*highpoint)[i] = -2.; // makes bb invalid
00872 
00873   // check input 
00874   if (!fc_isSubsetValid(subset) || !numDim || !lowpoint || !highpoint) {
00875     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00876     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00877   }  
00878   
00879   // log message
00880   fc_printfLogMessage("Computing subset bounding box");    
00881   
00882   // setup I
00883   rc = fc_getMeshFromSubset(subset, &mesh);
00884   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00885     return rc;
00886   rc = fc_getSubsetInfo(subset, &numMember, NULL, &assoc);
00887   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00888     return rc;
00889 
00890   // Error case: if subset has zero members - return error
00891   if (numMember == 0 ) {
00892     fc_printfErrorMessage("Subset has 0 members");
00893     return FC_ERROR;
00894   }
00895   
00896   // special case -- whole association
00897   if (assoc == FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH) 
00898     return fc_getMeshBoundingBox(mesh, numDim, lowpoint, highpoint);
00899 
00900   // get vertices of the members
00901   rc = fc_getSubsetMembersAsArray(subset, &numMember, &memberIDs);
00902   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00903     return rc;
00904   rc = fc_changeMeshEntityType(mesh, assoc, numMember, memberIDs, 
00905                                FC_AT_VERTEX, 1, &numVertex, &vertexIDs);
00906   free(memberIDs);
00907 
00908   // setup II
00909   rc = fc_getMeshDim(mesh, numDim);
00910   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00911     return rc;
00912   rc = fc_getMeshCoordsPtr(mesh, &coords_p);
00913   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00914     return rc;
00915 
00916   // initialize - start with 1st point
00917   for (i = 0; i < *numDim; i++)
00918     low[i] = high[i] = coords_p[vertexIDs[0]*(*numDim)+i];
00919 
00920   // find min & max in each dim
00921   for (i = 1; i < numVertex; i++) {
00922     for (j = 0; j < *numDim; j++) {
00923       temp = coords_p[vertexIDs[i]*(*numDim)+j];
00924       if (temp < low[j])
00925         low[j] = temp;
00926       if (temp > high[j])
00927         high[j] = temp;
00928     }
00929   }
00930   free(vertexIDs);
00931 
00932   for (i = 0; i < *numDim; i++) {
00933     (*lowpoint)[i] = low[i];
00934     (*highpoint)[i] = high[i];
00935   }
00936 
00937   return FC_SUCCESS;
00938 }
00939 
00940 /**
00941  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
00942  * \brief Compute bounding box of subset of a displaced mesh.
00943  *
00944  * \description
00945  *
00946  *    See fc_getMeshBoundingBox() for a description of bounding boxes.
00947  *
00948  *    Gets the bounding box of the subset after displacing the coordinates of
00949  *    the parent mesh with the given variable.
00950  *
00951  *    Returns with an error if nothing is marked.
00952  *
00953  * \modifications   
00954  *   - 10/27/04 WSK, Created.
00955  */
00956 FC_ReturnCode fc_getDisplacedSubsetBoundingBox(
00957   FC_Subset subset,        /**< input - subset handle   */  
00958   FC_Variable coord_displ, /**< input - coord displacements */
00959   int *numDim,             /**< output - the number of dimensions of bbox */    
00960   FC_Coords *lowpoint,     /**< output - lower left corner of bbox */
00961   FC_Coords *highpoint     /**< output - upper right corner of bbox */
00962 )
00963 {
00964   FC_ReturnCode rc;
00965   FC_Mesh mesh;
00966   int i, j;
00967   int numVertex, *vertexIDs, numMember, *memberIDs;
00968   double *coords, temp;
00969   // must initalize all entries of coords to 0 in case numDim < 3
00970   FC_Coords low = { 0., 0., 0. }, high = { 0., 0., 0. };
00971   FC_AssociationType assoc;
00972 
00973   // default output
00974   if (numDim)
00975     *numDim = -1;
00976   if (lowpoint) 
00977     for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
00978       (*lowpoint)[i] = -1.;
00979   if (highpoint) 
00980     for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
00981       (*highpoint)[i] = -2.; // makes bb invalid
00982 
00983   // check input 
00984   if (!fc_isSubsetValid(subset) || !numDim || !lowpoint || !highpoint) {
00985     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00986     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00987   }  
00988   rc = fc_getMeshFromSubset(subset, &mesh);
00989   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
00990     return rc;
00991   if (!fc_isValidDisplacementVariable(mesh, coord_displ)) {
00992     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
00993     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
00994   }  
00995 
00996   // log message
00997   fc_printfLogMessage("Computing displaced subset bounding box");    
00998   
00999   // setup I
01000   rc = fc_getSubsetInfo(subset, &numMember, NULL, &assoc);
01001   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01002     return rc;
01003 
01004   // Error case: if subset has zero members - return error
01005   if (numMember == 0 ) {
01006     fc_printfErrorMessage("Subset has 0 members");
01007     return FC_ERROR;
01008   }
01009   
01010   // --- special case -- whole association
01011   if (assoc == FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH) 
01012     return fc_getDisplacedMeshBoundingBox(mesh, coord_displ, numDim, lowpoint, 
01013                                           highpoint);
01014 
01015   // get vertices of the members
01016   rc = fc_getSubsetMembersAsArray(subset, &numMember, &memberIDs);
01017   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01018     return rc;
01019   rc = fc_changeMeshEntityType(mesh, assoc, numMember, memberIDs, 
01020                                FC_AT_VERTEX, 1, &numVertex, &vertexIDs);
01021   free(memberIDs);
01022 
01023   // setup II
01024   rc = fc_getMeshDim(mesh, numDim);
01025   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01026     return rc;
01027   rc = fc_getDisplacedMeshCoords(mesh, coord_displ, &coords);
01028   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01029     return rc;
01030 
01031   // initialize - start with 1st point
01032   for (i = 0; i < *numDim; i++)
01033     low[i] = high[i] = coords[vertexIDs[0]*(*numDim)+i];
01034 
01035   // find min & max in each dim
01036   for (i = 1; i < numVertex; i++) {
01037     for (j = 0; j < *numDim; j++) {
01038       temp = coords[vertexIDs[i]*(*numDim)+j];
01039       if (temp < low[j])
01040         low[j] = temp;
01041       if (temp > high[j])
01042         high[j] = temp;
01043     }
01044   }
01045   free(vertexIDs);
01046   free(coords);
01047 
01048   // set return values
01049   for (i = 0; i < *numDim; i++) {
01050     (*lowpoint)[i] = low[i];
01051     (*highpoint)[i] = high[i];
01052   }
01053 
01054   return FC_SUCCESS;
01055 }
01056 
01057 /**
01058  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
01059  * \brief Create a mesh that represents a bounding box.
01060  *
01061  * \description
01062  *
01063  *    Returns a mesh, made of line elements, that represents
01064  *    a bounding box. This is useful for visualizing bounding boxes.
01065  *
01066  * \modifications   
01067  *   - 02/19/04 WSK, created.
01068  */
01069 FC_ReturnCode fc_createBoundingBoxMesh(
01070   FC_Dataset dest_ds,     /* input - the dataset to add mesh to */
01071   char* bb_name,          /* input - the name of the new mesh */
01072   int dim,                /* input - the dimensionality of the bounding box */
01073   FC_Coords lowerCoords,  /* input - the lower coords of the bounding box */
01074   FC_Coords upperCoords,  /* input - the upper coords of the bounding box */
01075   FC_Mesh* bb_mesh        /* output - the new mesh */
01076 ) {
01077   FC_ReturnCode rc;
01078   int i;
01079   int numVertex[3] = { 2, 4, 8 }; 
01080   int numElement[3] = { 1, 4, 12 };
01081   int conns[3][12*2] = { { 0, 1 },
01082                 { 0, 1,
01083                   1, 2,
01084                   2, 3,
01085                   3, 0 },
01086                 { 0, 1,
01087                   1, 2,
01088                   2, 3,
01089                   3, 0,
01090                   4, 5,
01091                   5, 6,
01092                   6, 7,
01093                   7, 4,
01094                   0, 4,
01095                   1, 5,
01096                   2, 6,
01097                   3, 7 } };
01098   double coords[8*3];
01099 
01100   // default return
01101   if (bb_mesh)
01102     *bb_mesh = FC_NULL_MESH;
01103 
01104   // check input
01105   if (!fc_isDatasetValid(dest_ds) || !bb_name || dim < 1 || dim > 3 ||
01106       !lowerCoords || !upperCoords || !bb_mesh) {
01107     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01108     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01109   }
01110 
01111   // log message
01112   fc_printfLogMessage("Creating a mesh representing bounding box.");   
01113 
01114   rc = fc_createMesh(dest_ds, bb_name, bb_mesh);
01115   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01116     return rc;
01117 
01118   if (dim == 1) {
01119     coords[0] = lowerCoords[0];
01120     coords[1] = upperCoords[0];
01121   }
01122   else if (dim == 2) {
01123     // x coords
01124     coords[0] =   lowerCoords[0];
01125     coords[1*2] = upperCoords[0];
01126     coords[2*2] = upperCoords[0];
01127     coords[3*2] = lowerCoords[0];
01128     // y coords
01129     coords[1] =     lowerCoords[1];
01130     coords[1*2+1] = lowerCoords[1];
01131     coords[2*2+1] = upperCoords[1];
01132     coords[3*2+1] = upperCoords[1];
01133   }
01134   else if (dim == 3) {
01135     // x coords
01136     coords[0] =   lowerCoords[0];
01137     coords[1*3] = upperCoords[0];
01138     coords[2*3] = upperCoords[0];
01139     coords[3*3] = lowerCoords[0];
01140     coords[4*3] = lowerCoords[0];
01141     coords[5*3] = upperCoords[0];
01142     coords[6*3] = upperCoords[0];
01143     coords[7*3] = lowerCoords[0];
01144     // y coords
01145     coords[1] =     lowerCoords[1];
01146     coords[1*3+1] = lowerCoords[1];
01147     coords[2*3+1] = upperCoords[1];
01148     coords[3*3+1] = upperCoords[1];
01149     coords[4*3+1] = lowerCoords[1];
01150     coords[5*3+1] = lowerCoords[1];
01151     coords[6*3+1] = upperCoords[1];
01152     coords[7*3+1] = upperCoords[1];
01153     // z coords
01154     for (i = 0; i < 4; i++)
01155       coords[i*3+2] = lowerCoords[2];
01156     for (i = 4; i < 8; i++)
01157       coords[i*3+2] = upperCoords[2];
01158   }
01159 
01160   rc = fc_setMeshCoords(*bb_mesh, dim, numVertex[dim-1], coords);
01161   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01162     return rc;
01163   rc = fc_setMeshElementConns(*bb_mesh, FC_ET_LINE, numElement[dim-1], 
01164                      conns[dim-1]);
01165   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01166     return rc;
01167   
01168   return FC_SUCCESS;
01169 }
01170 
01171 //@}
01172 
01173 /** \name Projected bounding boxes */
01174 //-------------------------------
01175 //@{
01176 
01177 /**
01178  * \ingroup GeometricRelations
01179  * \brief Returns indication if the bounding boxes of 2 elements, when projected
01180  *  onto the same planar surface (given a projection direction) haven
01181  *  any intersection.
01182  *
01183  * \description
01184  * 
01185  *  Returns indication if the bounding boxes of 2 elements, when projected
01186  *  onto the same planar surface (given a projection direction) have
01187  *  any intersection.
01188  *
01189  *  The intent of this method is to find overlap of projections of elements,
01190  *  but the mathematics of that can be very complex for general cases. Instead
01191  *  we are going with the more trivial bounding box approach and hoping
01192  *  that gives us enough information.
01193  *
01194  *  Returns 1 if there is any overlap and 0 if there is none. Single point
01195  *  or single edge overlap is considered not to be overlap, since that
01196  *  is only boundary overlap, except for cases where an element projects into
01197  *  a line or point. Returns -1 in case of error.
01198  *
01199  *  Note: I have the proj normal as FC_Coords rather than a vector. I have
01200  *  debated chanign this to a FC_Vector instead.
01201  *
01202  * \todo
01203  *   - see if the BB version gives the resolution necessary
01204  *   - see if the exceptions for the cases of points and lines
01205  *     are really the exceptions we want to make.
01206  *   - check results for 2 dimensions -- SHOULD THIS EVEN WORK FOR 2D elems ?
01207  *   - can reduce the allocation of intermediate results if turns
01208  *     out we wont actaully need to keep them (some intermediates
01209  *     im keeping while i decide on the algorithm)
01210  *
01211  *
01212  * \modifications 
01213  *   - 10/21/05 ACG created (but not put into production)
01214  *   - 10/24/05 ACG changed from face occlusion to projected element
01215  *     bounding box overlap to simplify algorithmic necessity of handling
01216  *     possibly concave simple polygon intersection.
01217  *   - 11/21/05 ACG putting into production now that lower level
01218  *      type changes are completed
01219  *   - 03/15/06 ACG changed projnormal type from double* to FC_Coords
01220  *   - 03/28/06 ACG fixed bug in proj matrix - i had it antisymmetirc
01221  *                  rather than symmetric
01222  */
01223 FC_ReturnCode fc_projectedElementBoundingBoxIntersection(
01224   FC_Mesh mesh,          /**< input - mesh */
01225   int elemID_1,       /**< input -  elementID 1 */
01226   int elemID_2,      /**< input -  elementID 2 */  
01227   FC_Coords proj_normal,  /**< input - the proj normal */
01228   int* intersectval   /**< output - result 1 or 0 */
01229 ){
01230   FC_ReturnCode rc;
01231   int *elem_id_array;
01232   FC_ElementType elemtype;
01233   FC_Coords *refcoords, *projrefcoords, *compcoords, *projcompcoords; 
01234   double *mesh_coords;
01235   double minmax[2][6];
01236   double projmatrix[3][3];
01237   double tempval, val;
01238 
01239   //  FC_Vector temp_normal;
01240   int topodim,numDim;
01241   int line[2][3];
01242   int numelem, numvertex,e_vertex;
01243   int i,j,k;
01244 
01245   if (intersectval)
01246     *intersectval = -1;
01247 
01248   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh) || !intersectval){
01249     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01250     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01251   }
01252   
01253 
01254   // log message
01255   fc_printfLogMessage("calc elem bounding box intersection.");   
01256 
01257   rc = fc_getMeshInfo (mesh,&topodim,&numDim,&numvertex,&numelem,&elemtype);
01258   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01259     return rc;
01260  //Note: verify that ID is same as array index
01261   if (elemID_1 < 0 || elemID_1 > numelem ||
01262       elemID_2 < 0 || elemID_2 > numelem){
01263     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01264     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01265   }
01266 
01267   tempval = 0.;
01268   for (i = 0; i < 3; i++){
01269     tempval+=proj_normal[i]*proj_normal[i];
01270   }
01271 
01272   if (tempval < 0){
01273     fc_printfErrorMessage("bad val for normal");
01274     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01275   }
01276   val = sqrt(fabs(tempval));
01277 
01278   //make sure normal has mag 1
01279   if (!(FC_FLT_EQUIV(val,1.0))){
01280     fc_printfErrorMessage("normal does not have magnitude 1");
01281     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01282   }
01283 
01284   //get numverticies for the elem
01285   e_vertex = fc_getElementTypeNumVertex(elemtype);
01286   if (e_vertex < 1){
01287     fc_printfErrorMessage("bad number of verticies for these elements");
01288     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01289   }
01290 
01291   rc = fc_getMeshElementConnsPtr(mesh,&elem_id_array);
01292   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01293     return FC_ERROR;
01294 
01295   rc = fc_getMeshCoordsPtr(mesh,&mesh_coords);
01296   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01297     return FC_ERROR;
01298 
01299 
01300   refcoords = (FC_Coords*)malloc(e_vertex*sizeof(FC_Coords));
01301   compcoords = (FC_Coords*)malloc(e_vertex*sizeof(FC_Coords));
01302   projrefcoords = (FC_Coords*)malloc(e_vertex*sizeof(FC_Coords));
01303   projcompcoords = (FC_Coords*)malloc(e_vertex*sizeof(FC_Coords));
01304 
01305   if (!refcoords || !compcoords || !projrefcoords || !projcompcoords){
01306     if (refcoords) free(refcoords);
01307     if (projrefcoords) free(projrefcoords);
01308     if (compcoords) free(compcoords);
01309     if (compcoords) free(projcompcoords);
01310     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01311     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;               
01312   }
01313 
01314   //  printf("\n");
01315   for (j = 0; j < e_vertex; j++){
01316     for (k = 0; k < numDim; k++)
01317       //       refcoords[j][k] = mesh_coords[conns[elemID_1*e_vertex+j]*numDim+k];
01318       refcoords[j][k] = mesh_coords[elem_id_array[elemID_1*e_vertex +j]*numDim+k];
01319     if (numDim < 3) refcoords[j][2] = 0;
01320   }
01321 
01322   for (j = 0; j < e_vertex; j++){
01323     for (k = 0; k < numDim; k++)
01324       compcoords[j][k] = mesh_coords[elem_id_array[elemID_2*e_vertex+j]*numDim+k];
01325     if (numDim < 3) compcoords[j][2] = 0;
01326   }
01327 
01328 
01329   // project each of the points onto the plane defined by the proj normal
01330   // its is ax+by+cz = 0 for the plane that intersects the origin where
01331   // a,b,and c are the components of the proj normal
01332   projmatrix[0][0] = proj_normal[1]*proj_normal[1]+
01333     proj_normal[2]*proj_normal[2];
01334   projmatrix[1][1] = proj_normal[0]*proj_normal[0]+
01335     proj_normal[2]*proj_normal[2];
01336   projmatrix[2][2] = proj_normal[0]*proj_normal[0]+
01337     proj_normal[1]*proj_normal[1];
01338   projmatrix[0][1] = -proj_normal[0]*proj_normal[1];
01339   projmatrix[0][2] = -proj_normal[0]*proj_normal[2];
01340   projmatrix[1][0] = projmatrix[0][1];
01341   projmatrix[2][0] = projmatrix[0][2];
01342   projmatrix[1][2] = -proj_normal[1]*proj_normal[2];
01343   projmatrix[2][1] = projmatrix[1][2];
01344 
01345 
01346   //proj each point of the elems onto the projection plane. dont
01347   //actaully need to keep these, but holding on to them
01348   //for now in case i change the algorithm
01349   //and get the bounding boxes for the resulting elements
01350   for (i = 0; i < 2; i++){
01351     for (j = 0; j <3; j++){
01352       minmax[i][2*j] = DBL_MAX;
01353       minmax[i][2*j+1] = -1*DBL_MAX;
01354     }
01355   }
01356 
01357 
01358   for (i = 0; i < e_vertex; i++){ //for each vertex
01359     for (j = 0; j < 3; j++){ //for each component
01360       projrefcoords[i][j] = 
01361      projmatrix[j][0] * refcoords[i][0]+
01362      projmatrix[j][1] * refcoords[i][1]+
01363      projmatrix[j][2] * refcoords[i][2];
01364       projcompcoords[i][j] = 
01365      projmatrix[j][0] * compcoords[i][0]+
01366      projmatrix[j][1] * compcoords[i][1]+
01367      projmatrix[j][2] * compcoords[i][2];
01368       minmax[0][2*j] = (projrefcoords[i][j] < minmax[0][2*j] ?
01369                projrefcoords[i][j] : minmax[0][2*j]);
01370       minmax[0][2*j+1] = (projrefcoords[i][j] > minmax[0][2*j+1] ?
01371                projrefcoords[i][j] : minmax[0][2*j+1]);
01372       minmax[1][2*j] = (projcompcoords[i][j] < minmax[1][2*j] ?
01373                projcompcoords[i][j] : minmax[1][2*j]);
01374       minmax[1][2*j+1] = (projcompcoords[i][j] > minmax[1][2*j+1] ?
01375                projcompcoords[i][j] : minmax[1][2*j+1]);
01376     }
01377   }
01378 
01379 
01380   // can we capitalize on having projected them into the same plane ?
01381   //    (these are really flat elements now)
01382   //    rot the plane or something and then not have to consider "z" ???
01383   //    is it ok to check only one way ??
01384 
01385   //first check if it reduces to a line or point case
01386   for (i =0; i < 2; i++){
01387     for (j = 0; j < 3; j++){
01388       line[i][j] = (FC_DBL_EQUIV(minmax[i][2*j],minmax[i][2*j+1])? 1: 0);
01389     }
01390   }
01391   //if its a line in a direction, then we will consider it
01392   //as overlapping, if the edge aligns, otherwise need more
01393   //than just edge overlap
01394   k = 1;
01395   for (i = 0; i < 3; i++){
01396     if (line[0][i] || line [1][i]){ //allow edge overlap
01397       if ((minmax[0][2*i] > minmax[1][2*i+1]) ||
01398        (minmax[0][2*i+1] < minmax[1][2*i])){
01399      k = 0;
01400      break;
01401       }
01402     }else {
01403       if (!(minmax[0][2*i] < minmax[1][2*i+1] &&
01404        minmax[0][2*i+1] > minmax[1][2*i])){
01405      k = 0;
01406      break;
01407       }
01408     }
01409   }
01410 
01411   *intersectval = k;
01412   free(refcoords);
01413   free(projrefcoords);
01414   free(compcoords);
01415   free(projcompcoords);
01416   return FC_SUCCESS;
01417 }
01418 
01419 /**
01420  * \ingroup GeometricRelations
01421  * \brief Given a subset of elements ids and a reference subset of element ids,
01422  *  projects those elements onto the same plane and calculates which elements of
01423  *  the reference subset have bounding boxes in the projected plane that are
01424  *  intersected by the bounding boxes of the comparison elements in the 
01425  *  projected plane.
01426  *
01427  * \description
01428  * 
01429  *  Given a subset of elements ids and a reference subset of element ids,
01430  *  projects those elements onto the same plane and calculates which elements of
01431  *  the reference subset have bounding boxes in the projected plane that are
01432  *  intersected by the bounding boxes of the comparison elements in the 
01433  *  projected plane. 
01434  *
01435  *  This is intended for getting an estimate of amount of the tie surface
01436  *  that has dead elements above it, in some direction. Neither subset
01437  *  can be NULL. The reference subset cannot be empty. The comp
01438  *  subset can be empty.
01439  *
01440  *  Name of output subset is that of the input ref subset, postpended with
01441  *  "_Intersect"
01442  *
01443  *  Uses fc_projectedElementBoundingBoxIntersection.
01444  *
01445  * \modifications 
01446  *   - 10/25/05 ACG created (but not put into production)
01447  *   - 11/21/05 ACG putting into production now that lower level type changes are completed
01448  *   - 03/15/06 ACG changed projnormal type from double* to FC_Coords
01449  *   - 08/07/06 WSD changed orig linked lists to arrays, and the out linked
01450  *          list to a sorted int array.
01451  *   - 10/10/06 ACG changed so once an item satisfies overlap it is removed 
01452  *          from comparison
01453  *   - 10/16/06 removed mesh from arg list to make more consistent with other
01454  *          subset calls
01455  */
01456 FC_ReturnCode fc_projectedSubsetElementBoundingBoxIntersection(
01457   FC_Subset compelemIDs, /**< input - subset of comp elem ids */
01458   FC_Subset refelemIDs, /**< input - subset of reference elem ids */
01459   FC_Coords proj_normal,  /**< input - proj normal */
01460   FC_Subset* intersectingrefIDs /**< output - subset of ref elem ids
01461                         satisfying the calculation */
01462 ){
01463   FC_ReturnCode rc;
01464   FC_Mesh mesh1, mesh2;
01465   int *orig1, *orig2;
01466   FC_SortedIntArray ref2, out2;
01467   FC_AssociationType assoc;
01468   int count1, count2;
01469   int i, j;
01470 
01471   if (intersectingrefIDs)
01472     *intersectingrefIDs = FC_NULL_SUBSET;
01473 
01474   if (!fc_isSubsetValid(compelemIDs) ||!fc_isSubsetValid(refelemIDs) ||
01475       !intersectingrefIDs){
01476     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01477     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01478   }
01479 
01480   for (i = 0; i < 2; i++){
01481     FC_Subset temp;
01482     temp = i? compelemIDs: refelemIDs;
01483     rc = fc_getSubsetAssociationType(temp, &assoc);
01484     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01485       return rc;
01486     
01487     if (assoc != FC_AT_ELEMENT){
01488       fc_printfErrorMessage("Wrong association type");
01489       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01490     }
01491   }
01492   //normal is checked in inner method since its just passed through
01493 
01494   rc = fc_getMeshFromSubset(compelemIDs,&mesh1);
01495   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01496     fc_printfErrorMessage("Can't get mesh from subset");
01497     return rc;
01498   }
01499 
01500   rc = fc_getMeshFromSubset(refelemIDs,&mesh2);
01501   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01502     fc_printfErrorMessage("Can't get mesh from subset");
01503     return rc;
01504   }
01505 
01506   if (!FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(mesh1,mesh2)){
01507     fc_printfErrorMessage("Subsets must be on same mesh");
01508     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01509   }
01510 
01511   rc = fc_getSubsetMembersAsArray(compelemIDs,&count1,&orig1);
01512   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01513     fc_printfErrorMessage("Can't get subset memebers");
01514     return rc;
01515   }
01516 
01517   rc = fc_getSubsetMembersAsArray(refelemIDs,&count2,&orig2);
01518   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01519     fc_printfErrorMessage("Can't get subset memebers");
01520     return rc;
01521   }
01522 
01523   if (count2 == 0){
01524     fc_printfErrorMessage("refsubset cannot be empty");
01525     free(orig1);
01526     free(orig2);
01527     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01528   }
01529 
01530   rc = fc_convertIntArrayToSortedIntArray(count2,orig2,1,&ref2);
01531   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01532     fc_printfErrorMessage("Can't convert ref array");
01533     free(orig1);
01534     free(orig2);
01535   }
01536 
01537   //compare each item in the orig1 list to all (remaining) items in the ref2 list
01538   fc_initSortedIntArray(&out2);
01539   for (i = 0; i < count1 && ref2.numVal; i++) {
01540     int elem1 = orig1[i];
01541     FC_SortedIntArray rem; 
01542     fc_initSortedIntArray(&rem);
01543     for (j = 0; j < ref2.numVal; j++) {
01544       int elem2 = ref2.vals[j];
01545       int intersectval;
01546       //      printf("\t(%d) and elem %d\n",count2++,elem2);
01547       rc = fc_projectedElementBoundingBoxIntersection(mesh1,elem1,elem2,
01548                                     proj_normal,&intersectval);
01549       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01550      fc_printfErrorMessage("Can't determine intersection");
01551      free(orig1);
01552      fc_freeSortedIntArray(&out2);
01553      fc_freeSortedIntArray(&ref2);
01554      fc_freeSortedIntArray(&rem);
01555      return rc;
01556       }
01557       if (intersectval == 1){
01558      int ret = fc_addIntToSortedIntArray(&out2, elem2);
01559      if (ret < 0 ){
01560        fc_printfErrorMessage("Can't add id to sorted int array");
01561        free(orig1);
01562        fc_freeSortedIntArray(&out2);
01563        fc_freeSortedIntArray(&ref2);
01564        fc_freeSortedIntArray(&rem);
01565        return ret; //its an error code
01566      }
01567      ret = fc_addIntToSortedIntArray(&rem, elem2);
01568      if (ret < 0 ){
01569        fc_printfErrorMessage("Can't add id to sorted int array");
01570        free(orig1);
01571        fc_freeSortedIntArray(&out2);
01572        fc_freeSortedIntArray(&ref2);
01573        fc_freeSortedIntArray(&rem);
01574        return ret; //its an error code
01575      }
01576       }
01577     } //j
01578     for (j = 0; j < rem.numVal; j++){
01579       int ret = fc_deleteIntFromSortedIntArray(&ref2,rem.vals[j]);
01580       if (ret != 1){
01581      fc_printfErrorMessage("Can't delete id from sorted int array");
01582      free(orig1);
01583      fc_freeSortedIntArray(&out2);
01584      fc_freeSortedIntArray(&ref2);
01585      fc_freeSortedIntArray(&rem);
01586      return FC_ERROR;
01587       }
01588     }
01589     fc_freeSortedIntArray(&rem);
01590   } //i
01591   free(orig1);
01592   fc_freeSortedIntArray(&ref2);
01593   //rem is freed
01594 
01595   {// allowed to send back empty subsets
01596     _FC_SubSlot *subSlot;
01597     char *subsetName, *tempName;
01598     subSlot = _fc_getSubSlot(refelemIDs);
01599     subsetName = subSlot->header.name;
01600     tempName = malloc((strlen(subsetName)+20)*sizeof(char));
01601     if (tempName == NULL){
01602        fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01603        fc_freeSortedIntArray(&out2);
01604        return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01605     }
01606     sprintf(tempName,"%s_Intersect",subsetName);
01607     rc = fc_createSubset(mesh1,tempName,FC_AT_ELEMENT,intersectingrefIDs);
01608     free(tempName);
01609     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01610       fc_printfErrorMessage("cannot create new element subset");
01611       fc_freeSortedIntArray(&out2);
01612       return rc;
01613     }
01614     rc = fc_addArrayMembersToSubset(*intersectingrefIDs,out2.numVal,
01615                            out2.vals);
01616     fc_freeSortedIntArray(&out2);
01617     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
01618       fc_printfErrorMessage("cannot add items to subset");
01619       return rc;
01620     }
01621   }
01622 
01623   return FC_SUCCESS;
01624 }
01625 
01626 //@}
01627 
01628 /** \name Diameter (max distance between any points in a point set) */
01629 //-------------------------------
01630 //@{
01631 
01632 /**
01633  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
01634  * \brief Get the diameter of a mesh.
01635  * 
01636  * The diameter of a set of points is the maximum distance between any two
01637  * points in the set. (It is also the diameter of the mimimum area circle
01638  * circumscribing the set of points). This routine returns the diameter
01639  * of the set of vertices that make up the mesh.
01640  *
01641  * If requested, this routine will also return the IDs of the vertices
01642  * that determined the diameter. There may be multiple point pairs
01643  * that have the same distance, so the number of pairs is returned
01644  * and an array which lists the first pair, then the next, etc.
01645  *
01646  * \modifications
01647  *    - 6/27/05 WSD Created.
01648  */
01649 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshDiameter(
01650   FC_Mesh mesh,  /**< input - A mesh */
01651   double* diameter,  /**< ouput - diameter of the vertex set */
01652   int* numPair,      /**< output - number of pairs of vertices that are
01653                              diameter distance from each other */
01654   int** pairIDs      /**< output - IDs of the vertex pairs */
01655 ) {
01656   FC_ReturnCode rc;
01657   FC_Subset subset;
01658 
01659   // log message
01660   fc_printfLogMessage("Computing mesh diameter.");
01661 
01662   // set default returns & test output args
01663   rc = _fc_getDiameterOutputArgsTest(diameter, numPair, pairIDs);
01664   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01665     return rc;
01666 
01667   // test input
01668   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh)) {
01669     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01670     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01671   }
01672 
01673   // Create subset that is whole
01674   rc = fc_createSubset(mesh, "temp", FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH, &subset);
01675   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01676     return rc;
01677   rc = fc_addMemberToSubset(subset, 0);
01678   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01679     return rc;
01680 
01681   // Send to core getSubsetDiameter code
01682   rc = _fc_getSubsetDiameterCore(subset, NULL, diameter, numPair, pairIDs);
01683 
01684   // Cleanup & return
01685   fc_deleteSubset(subset);
01686   return rc;
01687 }
01688 
01689 /**
01690  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
01691  * \brief Get the diameter of a displaced mesh.
01692  * 
01693  * This routine returns the diameter of the set of displaced vertices that make
01694  * up the mesh. For more details see fc_getMeshDiameter().
01695  *
01696  * \modifications
01697  *    - 6/27/05 WSD Created.
01698  */
01699 FC_ReturnCode fc_getDisplacedMeshDiameter(
01700   FC_Mesh mesh,       /**< input - A mesh */
01701   FC_Variable coord_displ,  /**< input - the coordinate displacements */ 
01702   double* diameter,   /**< ouput - diameter of the vertex set */
01703   int* numPair,       /**< output - number of pairs of vertices that are
01704                               diameter distance from each other */
01705   int** pairIDs       /**< output - IDs of the vertex pairs */
01706 ) {
01707   FC_ReturnCode rc;
01708   FC_Subset subset;
01709 
01710   // log message
01711   fc_printfLogMessage("Computing displaced mesh diameter.");
01712 
01713   // set default returns & test output args
01714   rc = _fc_getDiameterOutputArgsTest(diameter, numPair, pairIDs);
01715   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01716     return rc;
01717 
01718   // test input
01719   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh) || 
01720       !fc_isValidDisplacementVariable(mesh, coord_displ)) {
01721     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01722     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01723   }
01724 
01725   // Create subset that is whole
01726   rc = fc_createSubset(mesh, "temp", FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH, &subset);
01727   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01728     return rc;
01729   rc = fc_addMemberToSubset(subset, 0);
01730   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01731     return rc;
01732 
01733   // Send to core getSubsetDiameter code
01734   rc = _fc_getSubsetDiameterCore(subset, &coord_displ, diameter, numPair, pairIDs);
01735 
01736   // Cleanup & return
01737   fc_deleteSubset(subset);
01738   return rc;
01739 }
01740 
01741 /**
01742  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
01743  * \brief Get the diameter of a subset.
01744  * 
01745  * This routine returns the diameter of the set of vertices that make up the
01746  * members of the subset. For more details see fc_getMeshDiameter().
01747  *
01748  * The function will return with an error if the subset is empty.
01749  *
01750  * \modifications
01751  *    - 6/24/05 WSD Created.
01752  */
01753 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSubsetDiameter(
01754   FC_Subset subset,  /**< input - A subset */
01755   double* diameter,  /**< ouput - diameter of the vertex set */
01756   int* numPair,      /**< output - number of pairs of vertices that are
01757                              diameter distance from each other */
01758   int** pairIDs      /**< output - IDs of the vertex pairs */
01759 ) {
01760   FC_ReturnCode rc;
01761  
01762   // log message
01763   fc_printfLogMessage("Computing subset diameter.");
01764 
01765   // set default returns & test output args
01766   rc = _fc_getDiameterOutputArgsTest(diameter, numPair, pairIDs);
01767   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01768     return rc;
01769 
01770   // test input
01771   if (!fc_isSubsetValid(subset)) {
01772     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01773     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01774   }
01775 
01776   // do it
01777   return _fc_getSubsetDiameterCore(subset, NULL, diameter, numPair, pairIDs);
01778 }
01779 
01780 /**
01781  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
01782  * \brief Get the diameter of a displaced subset.
01783  * 
01784  * This routine returns the diameter of the set of displaced vertices that make
01785  * up the members of the subset.  For more details see fc_getMeshDiameter().
01786  *
01787  * \modifications
01788  *    - 6/24/05 WSD Created.
01789  */
01790 FC_ReturnCode fc_getDisplacedSubsetDiameter(
01791   FC_Subset subset,  /**< input - A subset */
01792   FC_Variable coord_displ,  /**< input - the owning mesh's coordinate 
01793                                 displacements */ 
01794   double* diameter,  /**< ouput - diameter of the vertex set */
01795   int* numPair,      /**< output - number of pairs of vertices that are
01796                              diameter distance from each other */
01797   int** pairIDs      /**< output - IDs of the vertex pairs */
01798 ) {
01799   FC_ReturnCode rc;
01800   FC_Mesh mesh;
01801  
01802   // log message
01803   fc_printfLogMessage("Computing displaced subset diameter.");
01804 
01805   // set default returns & test output args
01806   rc = _fc_getDiameterOutputArgsTest(diameter, numPair, pairIDs);
01807   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01808     return rc;
01809 
01810   // test input
01811   fc_getMeshFromSubset(subset, &mesh);
01812   if (!fc_isSubsetValid(subset) || 
01813       !fc_isValidDisplacementVariable(mesh, coord_displ)) {
01814     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01815     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01816   }
01817 
01818   // do it
01819   return _fc_getSubsetDiameterCore(subset, &coord_displ, diameter, numPair, pairIDs);
01820 }
01821 
01822 /**
01823  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
01824  * \brief Get the diameter of a group of meshes.
01825  * 
01826  * The diameter of a set of points is the maximum distance between any two
01827  * points in the set. (It is also the diameter of the mimimum area circle
01828  * circumscribing the set of points). This routine returns the diameter
01829  * of the set of vertices that make up a group of meshes.
01830  *
01831  * If requested, this routine will also return the IDs of the vertices
01832  * that determined the diameter. There may be multiple point pairs
01833  * that have the same distance, so the number of pairs is returned
01834  * and two arrays which identify the pairs. The pairIDs list the vertex
01835  * IDs (local to a mesh) for the first pair, then the next pair.
01836  * The pairMeshes is the originating mesh for each vertex in pairIDs.
01837  *
01838  * \modifications
01839  *    - 3/9/06 WSD Created.
01840  */
01841 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshesDiameter(
01842   int numMesh, /**< input - number of meshes */
01843   FC_Mesh* meshes,  /**< input - Array of meshes */
01844   double* diameter,  /**< ouput - diameter of the vertex set */
01845   int* numPair,      /**< output - number of pairs of vertices that are
01846                              diameter distance from each other */
01847   int** pairIDs,     /**< output - IDs of the vertex pairs */
01848   FC_Mesh** pairMeshes  /**< output - the meshes of the pairs */
01849 ) {
01850   FC_ReturnCode rc;
01851   int i;
01852   FC_Subset* subsets, *pairSubs;
01853 
01854   // log message
01855   fc_printfLogMessage("Computing meshes diameter.");
01856 
01857   // set default returns & test output args
01858   rc = _fc_getDiameterOutputArgsTestMeshes(diameter, numPair, pairIDs,
01859                             pairMeshes);
01860   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01861     return rc;
01862 
01863   // test input
01864   if (numMesh < 1 || !meshes) {
01865     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01866     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01867   }
01868   for (i = 0; i < numMesh; i++) {
01869     if (!fc_isMeshValid(meshes[i])) {
01870       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01871       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01872     }
01873   }
01874 
01875   // Create subsets that are whole
01876   subsets = (FC_Subset*)malloc(numMesh*sizeof(FC_Subset));
01877   if (!subsets) {
01878     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01879     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01880   }
01881   for (i = 0; i < numMesh; i++) {
01882     rc = fc_createSubset(meshes[i], "temp", FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH, &subsets[i]);
01883     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01884       return rc;
01885     rc = fc_addMemberToSubset(subsets[i], 0);
01886     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01887       return rc;
01888   }
01889 
01890   // Send to core getSubsetsDiameter code
01891   rc = _fc_getSubsetsDiameterCore(numMesh, subsets, NULL, diameter, numPair, 
01892                       pairIDs, &pairSubs);
01893 
01894   // convert pairSubs to pairMeshes
01895   if (rc == FC_SUCCESS && numPair && *numPair > 0) {
01896     FC_Mesh *subMeshes;
01897     subMeshes = (FC_Mesh*)malloc(2*(*numPair)*sizeof(FC_Mesh));
01898     if (!meshes) {
01899       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01900       return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01901     }
01902     for (i = 0; i < 2*(*numPair); i++) {
01903       rc = fc_getMeshFromSubset(pairSubs[i], &subMeshes[i]);
01904       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01905       return rc;
01906     }
01907     *pairMeshes = subMeshes;
01908     free(pairSubs);
01909   }
01910 
01911   // Cleanup & return
01912   for (i = 0; i < numMesh; i++)
01913     fc_deleteSubset(subsets[i]);
01914   free(subsets);
01915 
01916   return rc;
01917 }
01918 
01919 /**
01920  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
01921  * \brief Get the diameter of a group of displaced meshes.
01922  * 
01923  * This routine returns the diameter of the set of displaced vertices that make
01924  * up a group of meshes. For more details see fc_getMeshesDiameter().
01925  *
01926  * \modifications
01927  *    - 3/9/06 WSD Created.
01928  */
01929 FC_ReturnCode fc_getDisplacedMeshesDiameter(
01930   int numMesh, /**< input - number of meshes */
01931   FC_Mesh* meshes,      /**< input - Array of meshes*/
01932   FC_Variable* displs,  /**< input - the coordinate displacements */ 
01933   double* diameter,   /**< ouput - diameter of the vertex set */
01934   int* numPair,       /**< output - number of pairs of vertices that are
01935                               diameter distance from each other */
01936   int** pairIDs,      /**< output - IDs of the vertex pairs */
01937   FC_Mesh** pairMeshes  /**< output - the meshes of the pairs */
01938 ) {
01939   FC_ReturnCode rc;
01940   int i;
01941   FC_Subset* subsets, *pairSubs;
01942 
01943   // log message
01944   fc_printfLogMessage("Computing displaced meshes diameter.");
01945 
01946   // set default returns & test output args
01947   rc = _fc_getDiameterOutputArgsTestMeshes(diameter, numPair, pairIDs,
01948                             pairMeshes);
01949   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01950     return rc;
01951 
01952   // test input
01953   if (numMesh < 1 || !meshes || !displs) {
01954     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01955     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01956   }
01957   for (i = 0; i < numMesh; i++) {
01958     if (!fc_isMeshValid(meshes[i]) || 
01959      !fc_isValidDisplacementVariable(meshes[i], displs[i])) {
01960       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
01961       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
01962     }
01963   }
01964 
01965   // Create subsets that are whole
01966   subsets = (FC_Subset*)malloc(numMesh*sizeof(FC_Subset));
01967   if (!subsets) {
01968     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01969     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01970   }
01971   for (i = 0; i < numMesh; i++) {
01972     rc = fc_createSubset(meshes[i], "temp", FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH, &subsets[i]);
01973     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01974       return rc;
01975     rc = fc_addMemberToSubset(subsets[i], 0);
01976     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01977       return rc;
01978   }
01979 
01980   // Send to core getSubsetDiameter code
01981   rc = _fc_getSubsetsDiameterCore(numMesh, subsets, displs, diameter, 
01982                       numPair, pairIDs, &pairSubs);
01983 
01984   // convert pairSubs to pairMeshes
01985   if (rc == FC_SUCCESS && numPair && *numPair > 0) {
01986     FC_Mesh* subMeshes;
01987     subMeshes = (FC_Mesh*)malloc(2*(*numPair)*sizeof(FC_Mesh));
01988     if (!subMeshes) {
01989       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
01990       return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
01991     }
01992     for (i = 0; i < 2*(*numPair); i++) {
01993       rc = fc_getMeshFromSubset(pairSubs[i], &subMeshes[i]);
01994       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
01995       return rc;
01996     }
01997     *pairMeshes = subMeshes;
01998     free(pairSubs);
01999   }
02000 
02001   // Cleanup & return
02002   for (i = 0; i < numMesh; i++)
02003     fc_deleteSubset(subsets[i]);
02004   free(subsets);
02005 
02006   return rc;
02007 }

02117 /** 
02118  * \ingroup  PrivateGeometricRelations
02119  * \brief Helper for 'getDiameter' routines.
02120  *
02121  * Sets the default return values of output args and tests that output
02122  * arg values are sane.
02123  *
02124  * \modifications
02125  *    - 6/27/05 WSD Created.
02126  */
02127 FC_ReturnCode _fc_getDiameterOutputArgsTest(
02128   double* diameter,  /**< ouput - diameter of the vertex set */
02129   int* numPair,      /**< output - number of pairs of vertices that are
02130                              diameter distance from each other */
02131   int** pairIDs      /**< output - IDs of the vertex pairs */
02132 ) {
02133   // default return
02134   if (diameter)
02135     *diameter = -1;
02136   if (numPair)
02137     *numPair = -1;
02138   if (pairIDs)
02139     *pairIDs = NULL;
02140   
02141   // test output args
02142   if (!diameter) {
02143     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
02144     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02145   }
02146   if ((numPair && !pairIDs) || (!numPair && pairIDs)) {
02147     fc_printfErrorMessage("Did not provide both numPair & pairIDs for "
02148                  "returned vertex IDs");
02149     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02150   }
02151   
02152   return FC_SUCCESS;
02153 }
02154 
02155 /** 
02156  * \ingroup  PrivateGeometricRelations
02157  * \brief Helper for 'getDiameter' routines.
02158  *
02159  * Sets the default return values of output args and tests that output
02160  * arg values are sane.
02161  *
02162  * \modifications
02163  *    - 3/13/06 WSD Created.
02164  */
02165 FC_ReturnCode _fc_getDiameterOutputArgsTestMeshes(
02166   double* diameter,  /**< ouput - diameter of the vertex set */
02167   int* numPair,      /**< output - number of pairs of vertices that are
02168                              diameter distance from each other */
02169   int** pairIDs,     /**< output - IDs of the vertex pairs */
02170   FC_Mesh** pairMeshes /**< output - owning meshes for the verts */
02171 ) {

02174     *diameter = -1;

02176     *numPair = -1;
02177   if (pairIDs)
02178     *pairIDs = NULL;
02179   if (pairMeshes)
02180     *pairMeshes = NULL;
02181   
02182   // test output args
02183   if (!diameter) {
02184     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
02185     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02186   }
02187   if ( (numPair && (!pairIDs || !pairMeshes)) || 
02188        (!numPair && (pairIDs || pairMeshes)) ) {
02189     fc_printfErrorMessage("Did not provide both numPair & pairIDs for "
02190                  "returned vertex IDs");
02191     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;

02193

02195 }
