02197 /** 
02198  * \ingroup  PrivateGeometricRelations
02199  * \brief Helper for 'getDiameter' routines.
02200  *
02201  * Sets the default return values of output args and tests that output
02202  * arg values are sane.
02203  *
02204  * \modifications
02205  *    - 3/13/06 WSD Created.
02206  */
02207 FC_ReturnCode _fc_getDiameterOutputArgsTestSubsets(
02208   double* diameter,  /**< ouput - diameter of the vertex set */
02209   int* numPair,      /**< output - number of pairs of vertices that are
02210                              diameter distance from each other */
02211   int** pairIDs,     /**< output - IDs of the vertex pairs */
02212   FC_Subset** pairSubsets /**< output - owning subsets for the verts */
02213 ) {
02214   // default return
02215   if (diameter)
02216     *diameter = -1;
02217   if (numPair)
02218     *numPair = -1;
02219   if (pairIDs)
02220     *pairIDs = NULL;
02221   if (pairSubsets)
02222     *pairSubsets = NULL;
02223   
02224   // test output args
02225   if (!diameter) {
02226     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
02227     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02228   }
02229   if ( (numPair && (!pairIDs || !pairSubsets)) || 
02230        (!numPair && (pairIDs || pairSubsets)) ) {
02231     fc_printfErrorMessage("Did not provide both numPair & pairIDs for "
02232                  "returned vertex IDs");
02233     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02234   }
02235   
02236   return FC_SUCCESS;
02237 }
02238 
02239 /** 
02240  * \ingroup  PrivateGeometricRelations
02241  * \brief Core code of 'getDiameter' routines.
02242  *
02243  * Implements brute force comparison of all vertices.
02244  *
02245  * \todo This routine will be very slow for point sets. The best optimization
02246  * is to find the convex hull of the set and then brute force search only the
02247  * points of the hull polygon. However, the 3D convex hull algorithm
02248  * is not easy to implement so I punted -WSD.
02249  *
02250  * \todo This routine should probably be replaced by
02251  *    _fc_getSubsetsDiameterCore() so that the core code isn't duplicated.
02252  *
02253  * \modifications
02254  *    - 6/27/05 WSD Created.
02255  */
02256 FC_ReturnCode _fc_getSubsetDiameterCore(
02257   FC_Subset subset,    /**< input - a subset */
02258   FC_Variable* displ,  /**< input - pointer to displ (NULL = no displ) */
02259   double* diameter,    /**< ouput - diameter of the vertex set */
02260   int* numPair,        /**< output - number of pairs of vertices that are
02261                                diameter distance from each other */
02262   int** pairIDs        /**< output - IDs of the vertex pairs */
02263 ) {
02264   FC_ReturnCode rc;
02265   int i, j;
02266   int numDim, numVertex, *vertexIDs, numMember, *memberIDs;
02267   double *coords_p, temp;
02268   FC_Mesh mesh;
02269   FC_AssociationType assoc;
02270   int doPairs = 0, num = 0, maxNum = 0, *ids;
02271   double diameter2 = -1; // squared diameter;
02272   
02273   // setup I
02274   if (numPair && pairIDs)
02275     doPairs = 1;
02276   rc = fc_getMeshFromSubset(subset, &mesh);
02277   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02278     return rc;
02279   rc = fc_getSubsetInfo(subset, &numMember, NULL, &assoc);
02280   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02281     return rc;
02282   
02283   // get vertices of the members
02284   rc = fc_getSubsetMembersAsArray(subset, &numMember, &memberIDs);
02285   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02286     return rc;
02287   rc = fc_changeMeshEntityType(mesh, assoc, numMember, memberIDs, 
02288                                FC_AT_VERTEX, 1, &numVertex, &vertexIDs);
02289   free(memberIDs);
02290 
02291   // Special case: if 0 vertex - return error!
02292   if (numVertex == 0) {
02293     fc_printfErrorMessage("Subset has 0 members, diameter is undefined.");
02294     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02295   }
02296   // Special case: if 1 vertex - return 0
02297   if (numVertex == 1) {
02298     free(vertexIDs);
02299     *diameter = 0.;
02300     if (doPairs)
02301       *numPair = 0;
02302     return FC_SUCCESS;
02303   }
02304 
02305   // setup II
02306   rc = fc_getMeshDim(mesh, &numDim);
02307   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02308     return rc;
02309   if (displ) {
02310     rc = fc_getDisplacedMeshCoords(mesh, *displ, &coords_p);
02311     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02312       return rc;
02313   } 
02314   else {
02315     rc = fc_getMeshCoordsPtr(mesh, &coords_p);
02316     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02317       return rc;
02318   }
02319 
02320   // Start off with space for at least 1 pair
02321   if (doPairs) {
02322     ids = (int*)malloc(2*sizeof(int));
02323     num = 0;
02324     maxNum = 1;
02325   }
02326   // Do it
02327   for (i = 0; i < numVertex; i++) {
02328     for (j = i+1; j < numVertex; j++) {
02329       fc_calcSquaredEuclideanDistance(&coords_p[vertexIDs[i]*numDim], 
02330                           &coords_p[vertexIDs[j]*numDim],
02331                           numDim, &temp);
02332       if (temp > diameter2) {
02333      diameter2 = temp;
02334      if (doPairs) {
02335        ids[0] = vertexIDs[i];
02336        ids[1] = vertexIDs[j];
02337        num = 1;
02338      }
02339       }
02340       else if (doPairs && FC_DBL_EQUIV(temp, diameter2)) {
02341      if (num+1 > maxNum) {
02342        ids = (int*)realloc(ids, 4*maxNum*sizeof(int));
02343        if (!ids)
02344          return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
02345        maxNum *= 2;
02346      }
02347      ids[num*2] = vertexIDs[i];
02348      ids[num*2+1] = vertexIDs[j];
02349      num++;
02350       }
02351     }
02352   }
02353   if (displ)
02354     free(coords_p);
02355   free(vertexIDs);
02356 
02357   // Return?
02358   *diameter = sqrt(diameter2);
02359   if (doPairs) {
02360     *numPair = num;
02361     *pairIDs = (int*)realloc(ids, 2*num*sizeof(int)); // squeeze
02362   }
02363 
02364   return FC_SUCCESS;
02365 }
02366 
02367 /** 
02368  * \ingroup  PrivateGeometricRelations
02369  * \brief Core code of 'getDiameter' routines.
02370  *
02371  * Implements brute force comparison of all vertices.
02372  *
02373  * \todo This routine will be very slow for point sets. The best optimization
02374  * is to find the convex hull of the set and then brute force search only the
02375  * points of the hull polygon. However, the 3D convex hull algorithm
02376  * is not easy to implement so I punted -WSD.
02377  *
02378  * \modifications
02379  *    - 6/27/05 WSD Created.
02380  *    - 3/9/06 WSD Changed to do multiple subsets.
02381  */
02382 FC_ReturnCode _fc_getSubsetsDiameterCore(
02383   int numSubset,       /**< input - number of subsets */
02384   FC_Subset* subsets,  /**< input - a subset */
02385   FC_Variable* displs, /**< input - array of displs (NULL = no displ) */
02386   double* diameter,    /**< ouput - diameter of the vertex set */
02387   int* numPair,        /**< output - number of pairs of vertices that are
02388                                diameter distance from each other */
02389   int** pairIDs,       /**< output - IDs of the vertex pairs */
02390   FC_Subset** pairSubsets /**< output - Subsets of the vertex pairs */
02391 ) {
02392   FC_ReturnCode rc;
02393   int i, j, i_s, j_s;
02394   int numDim, numVerts[numSubset], *vertIDs[numSubset], numTotalVert;
02395   int numMember, *memberIDs;
02396   double *coords[numSubset], temp;
02397   FC_Mesh meshes[numSubset];
02398   FC_Subset* subs = NULL, *temp_subs;
02399   FC_AssociationType assoc;
02400   int doPairs = 0, num = 0, maxNum = 1, *ids = NULL, *temp_ids;
02401   double diameter2 = -1; // squared diameter
02402   
02403   // assume args are o.k.
02404   // FIX: assume numDim is the same for all subsets,
02405   // pass as an argument!?
02406 
02407   // setup I
02408   if (numPair && pairSubsets && pairIDs)
02409     doPairs = 1;
02410 
02411   // Get vertIDs per subset
02412   numTotalVert = 0;
02413   for (i = 0; i < numSubset; i++) {
02414     rc = fc_getMeshFromSubset(subsets[i], &meshes[i]);
02415     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02416       return rc;
02417     rc = fc_getMeshDim(meshes[i], &numDim); // FIX
02418     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02419       return rc; 
02420     rc = fc_getSubsetInfo(subsets[i], &numMember, NULL, &assoc);
02421     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02422       return rc;
02423     // get vertices of the members
02424     rc = fc_getSubsetMembersAsArray(subsets[i], &numMember, &memberIDs);
02425     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02426       return rc;
02427     if (assoc == FC_AT_VERTEX) {
02428       numVerts[i] = numMember;
02429       vertIDs[i] = memberIDs;
02430     }
02431     else {
02432       rc = fc_changeMeshEntityType(meshes[i], assoc, numMember, memberIDs, 
02433                        FC_AT_VERTEX, 1, &numVerts[i], &vertIDs[i]);
02434       free(memberIDs);
02435       if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02436      return rc;
02437     }
02438     numTotalVert += numVerts[i];
02439   }
02440 
02441   // Special case: if 0 vertex - return error!
02442   if (numTotalVert == 0) {
02443     fc_printfErrorMessage("Subsets have 0 members, diameter is undefined.");
02444     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02445   }
02446   // Special case: if 1 vertex - return 0
02447   if (numTotalVert == 1) {
02448     for (i = 0; i < numSubset; i++)
02449       free(vertIDs[i]);
02450     *diameter = 0.;
02451     if (doPairs)
02452       *numPair = 0;
02453     return FC_SUCCESS;
02454   }
02455 
02456   // Get the coords
02457   for (i = 0; i < numSubset; i++) {
02458     if (displs) 
02459       rc = fc_getDisplacedMeshCoords(meshes[i], displs[i], &coords[i]);
02460     else 
02461       rc = fc_getMeshCoordsPtr(meshes[i], &coords[i]);
02462     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02463       return rc;
02464   }
02465 
02466   // Start off with space for at least 1 pair
02467   if (doPairs) {
02468     ids = (int*)malloc(2*sizeof(int));
02469     subs = (FC_Subset*)malloc(2*sizeof(FC_Subset));
02470     num = 0;
02471     maxNum = 1;
02472   }
02473   // Note: diameter2 starts at -1
02474   // Do within each subset
02475   for (i_s = 0; i_s < numSubset; i_s++) {
02476     for (i = 0; i < numVerts[i_s]; i++) {
02477       for (j = i+1; j < numVerts[i_s]; j++) {
02478      fc_calcSquaredEuclideanDistance(&coords[i_s][vertIDs[i_s][i]*numDim], 
02479                          &coords[i_s][vertIDs[i_s][j]*numDim],
02480                          numDim, &temp);
02481      if (temp > diameter2) {
02482        diameter2 = temp;
02483        if (doPairs) {
02484          ids[0] = vertIDs[i_s][i];
02485          ids[1] = vertIDs[i_s][j];
02486          subs[0] = subsets[i_s];
02487          subs[1] = subsets[i_s];
02488          num = 1;
02489        }
02490      }
02491      else if (doPairs && FC_DBL_EQUIV(temp, diameter2)) {
02492        if (num+1 > maxNum) {
02493          temp_ids = (int*)realloc(ids, 4*maxNum*sizeof(int));
02494          temp_subs = (FC_Subset*)realloc(subs, 4*maxNum*sizeof(FC_Subset));
02495          if (!temp_ids || !temp_subs)
02496            return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
02497          ids = temp_ids;
02498          subs = temp_subs;
02499          maxNum *= 2;
02500        }
02501        ids[num*2] = vertIDs[i_s][i];
02502        ids[num*2+1] = vertIDs[i_s][j];
02503        subs[num*2] = subsets[i_s];
02504        subs[num*2+1] = subsets[i_s];
02505        num++;
02506      }
02507       }
02508     }
02509   }
02510   // check each vertex in one subset against all verts in other subsets
02511   for (i_s = 0; i_s < numSubset; i_s++) {
02512     for (i = 0; i < numVerts[i_s]; i++) {
02513       for (j_s = i_s+1; j_s < numSubset; j_s++) {
02514      for (j = 0; j < numVerts[j_s]; j++) {
02515        fc_calcSquaredEuclideanDistance(&coords[i_s][vertIDs[i_s][i]*numDim], 
02516                            &coords[j_s][vertIDs[j_s][j]*numDim],
02517                            numDim, &temp);
02518        if (temp > diameter2) {
02519          diameter2 = temp;
02520          if (doPairs) {
02521            ids[0] = vertIDs[i_s][i];
02522            ids[1] = vertIDs[j_s][j];
02523            subs[0] = subsets[i_s];
02524            subs[1] = subsets[j_s];
02525            num = 1;
02526          }
02527        }
02528        else if (doPairs && FC_DBL_EQUIV(temp, diameter2)) {
02529          if (num+1 > maxNum) {
02530            temp_ids = (int*)realloc(ids, 4*maxNum*sizeof(int));
02531            temp_subs = (FC_Subset*)realloc(subs, 4*maxNum*sizeof(FC_Subset));
02532            if (!temp_ids || !temp_subs)
02533           return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
02534            maxNum*= 2;
02535            ids = temp_ids;
02536            subs = temp_subs;
02537          }
02538          ids[num*2] = vertIDs[i_s][i];
02539          ids[num*2+1] = vertIDs[j_s][j];
02540          subs[num*2] = subsets[i_s];
02541          subs[num*2+1] = subsets[j_s];
02542          num++;
02543        }
02544      }
02545       }
02546     }
02547   }
02548   if (displs) 
02549     for (i = 0; i < numSubset; i++)
02550       free(coords[i]);
02551   for (i = 0; i < numSubset; i++)
02552     free(vertIDs[i]);
02553   
02554   // Return?
02555   *diameter = sqrt(diameter2);
02556   if (doPairs) {
02557     *numPair = num;
02558     *pairSubsets = (FC_Subset*)realloc(subs, 2*num*sizeof(FC_Subset));
02559     *pairIDs = (int*)realloc(ids, 2*num*sizeof(int)); // squeeze
02560   }
02561 
02562   return FC_SUCCESS;
02563 }
02564 
02565 
02566 //@}
02567 
02568 /** \name Centroid */
02569 //-------------------------------
02570 //@{
02571 
02572 /**
02573  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
02574  * \brief Compute centroid of mesh.
02575  *
02576  * \description
02577  *  
02578  *    The centroid is the geometric center of the mesh and is calculated by
02579  *    averaging the coordinates in each dimension. Also called center
02580  *    of mass or center of gravity.
02581  *
02582  * \modifications   
02583  *   - Wendy Koegler  Created.
02584  *   - July 3, 2002 W. Koegler removed dependence on var
02585  *   - July 3, 2002  W Koegler  Adapted to modified _FC_Vertex
02586  *   - July 9, 2002  W Koegler  Adapted to modified struct Vector
02587  *   - 2003-AUG-05  W Koegler  Changed to use doubles internally
02588  *   - 10/29/04 WSK, added 'mesh' to name & added dim to returned arg.
02589  */
02590 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshCentroid(
02591   FC_Mesh mesh,        /**< input - mesh id */
02592   int *dim,            /**< output - dimensionality of coords */
02593   FC_Coords *center    /**< output - coordinates of centroid */
02594 ) {
02595   FC_ReturnCode rc;
02596   int i, j;
02597   int numDim, numVertex;
02598   double *coords_p;
02599   double coords_sum[3];
02600   
02601   // default
02602   if (dim)
02603     *dim = -1;
02604   if (center) {
02605     for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
02606       (*center)[i] = -1.;
02607   }
02608 
02609   // check input
02610   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh) || !dim || !center) {
02611     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
02612     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02613   }
02614 
02615   // log message
02616   fc_printfLogMessage("Computing mesh centroid.");  
02617   
02618   // get vertices 
02619   rc = fc_getMeshInfo(mesh, NULL, &numDim, &numVertex, NULL, NULL);
02620   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02621     return rc;
02622   rc = fc_getMeshCoordsPtr(mesh, &coords_p);
02623   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) 
02624     return rc;
02625   
02626   // calculate coordinate sums
02627   for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
02628     coords_sum[i] = 0.;
02629   
02630   for (i = 0; i < numVertex; i++)
02631     for (j = 0; j < numDim; j++)
02632       coords_sum[j] += coords_p[i*numDim + j];
02633   
02634   // calculate centroids
02635   *dim = numDim;
02636   for (i = 0; i < numDim; i++)
02637     (*center)[i] = coords_sum[i]/numVertex;
02638   for (i = numDim; i < 3; i++)
02639     (*center)[i] = 0.;
02640   
02641   return FC_SUCCESS;
02642 }
02643 
02644 /**
02645  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
02646  * \brief Compute centroid of displaced mesh.
02647  *
02648  * \description
02649  *  
02650  *    The centroid is the geometric center of the mesh and is calculated by
02651  *    averaging the coordinates in each dimension.
02652  *
02653  * \modifications   
02654  *   - 10/29/04 WSK, created.
02655  */
02656 FC_ReturnCode fc_getDisplacedMeshCentroid(
02657   FC_Mesh mesh,             /**< input - mesh */
02658   FC_Variable coord_displ,  /**< input - coord displacements */
02659   int *dim,                 /**< output - dimensionality of coords */
02660   FC_Coords *center         /**< output - coordinates of centroid */
02661 ) {
02662   FC_ReturnCode rc;
02663   int i, j;
02664   int numVertex, numDim;
02665   double *coords;
02666   double coords_sum[3];
02667   
02668   // default output
02669   if (dim)
02670     *dim = -1;
02671   if (center) {
02672     for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
02673       (*center)[i] = -1.;
02674   }
02675 
02676   // check input
02677   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh) || 
02678       !fc_isValidDisplacementVariable(mesh, coord_displ) || 
02679       !dim || !center) {
02680     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
02681     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02682   }
02683 
02684   // log message
02685   fc_printfLogMessage("Computing displaced mesh centroid.");  
02686   
02687   // get vertices 
02688   rc = fc_getMeshInfo(mesh, NULL, &numDim, &numVertex, NULL, NULL);
02689   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02690     return rc;
02691   rc = fc_getDisplacedMeshCoords(mesh, coord_displ, &coords);
02692   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) 
02693     return rc;
02694   
02695   // initialize sums
02696   for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
02697     coords_sum[i] = 0.;
02698   
02699   // collect sums
02700   for (i = 0; i < numVertex; i++)
02701     for (j = 0; j < numDim; j++)
02702       coords_sum[j] += coords[i*numDim + j];
02703   free(coords);
02704   
02705   // calculate centroids
02706   *dim = numDim;
02707   for (i = 0; i < numDim; i++)
02708     (*center)[i] = coords_sum[i]/numVertex;
02709   for (i = numDim; i < 3; i++)
02710     (*center)[i] = 0.;
02711 
02712   return FC_SUCCESS;
02713 }
02714 
02715 /**
02716  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
02717  * \brief Compute variable weighted centroid of a mesh.
02718  *
02719  * \description  
02720  *
02721  *    Computes the centroid of a mesh weighted by the variable values
02722  *    (equivalent to center of mass where the variable is the masses). The
02723  *    weights variable must be a scalar variable on the vertices (and should have
02724  *    the same number of vertices as the mesh if it is from a different mesh).
02725  *
02726  * \modifications   
02727  *    - Wendy Koegler  Created.
02728  *    - July 3, 2002  W Koegler  Created, work in progress
02729  *    - July 3, 2002  W Koegler  Adapted to modified _FC_Vertex
02730  *    - July 9, 2002  W Koegler  Adapted to modified struct Vector
02731  *    - 10/29/04 WSK added mesh to input args and dim to output args.
02732  *        Fixed up.
02733  */
02734 FC_ReturnCode fc_getVariableWeightedMeshCentroid(
02735   FC_Mesh mesh,            /**< input - mesh */
02736   FC_Variable weightsVar,  /**< input - weights */
02737   int* dim,                /**< output - dimensionality of centroid */
02738   FC_Coords *center        /**< output - coordinates of centroid */
02739 ) {
02740   FC_ReturnCode rc;
02741   int i, j;
02742   int numDim, numVertex, numDataPoint, data_dim;
02743   FC_AssociationType assoc; // data association
02744   FC_DataType datatype; // data type
02745   double coords_sum[3];
02746   double* coords_p, weight_sum, weight;
02747   void* data_p;
02748 
02749   // default output
02750   if (dim)
02751     *dim = -1;
02752   if (center) {
02753     for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
02754       (*center)[i] = -1.;
02755   }
02756 
02757   // check input
02758   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh) || !fc_isVariableValid(weightsVar) || !dim || 
02759       !center) {
02760     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
02761     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02762   }
02763   
02764   // get mesh & variable information
02765   rc = fc_getMeshInfo(mesh, NULL, &numDim, &numVertex, NULL, NULL);
02766   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02767     return rc;
02768   rc = fc_getVariableInfo(weightsVar, &numDataPoint, &data_dim, &assoc,  
02769                  NULL, &datatype);
02770   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02771     return rc;
02772   
02773    // more checking
02774   if (assoc != FC_AT_VERTEX || numDataPoint != numVertex || data_dim != 1 ||
02775       !fc_isDataTypeValid(datatype) || datatype == FC_DT_UNKNOWN || 
02776       datatype == FC_DT_CHAR) {
02777     fc_printfErrorMessage("Inappropriate variable for weights");
02778     return FC_ERROR;
02779   }
02780 
02781   // log message
02782   fc_printfLogMessage("Computing variable weighted centroid of mesh.");  
02783 
02784   // get vertices and data
02785   rc = fc_getMeshCoordsPtr(mesh, &coords_p);
02786   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02787     return rc;
02788   rc = fc_getVariableDataPtr(weightsVar, &data_p);
02789   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02790     return rc;
02791 
02792 
02793   // init coord sums
02794   weight_sum = 0.;
02795   for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
02796     coords_sum[i] = 0;
02797 
02798   // collect sums
02799   for (i = 0; i < numVertex; i++) {
02800     switch(datatype) {
02801     case FC_DT_INT :    weight = ((int*)data_p)[i];     break;
02802     case FC_DT_FLOAT:   weight = ((float*)data_p)[i];   break;
02803     case FC_DT_DOUBLE:  weight = ((double*)data_p)[i];  break;
02804     default:
02805       ; // nothing
02806     }
02807     weight_sum += weight;
02808     for (j = 0; j < numDim; j++) 
02809       coords_sum[j] += coords_p[i*numDim + j] * weight;
02810   }
02811 
02812   // calculate weight centroid
02813   *dim = numDim;
02814   for (i = 0; i < numDim; i++)
02815     (*center)[i] = coords_sum[i]/weight_sum;
02816   for (i = numDim; i < 3; i++)
02817     (*center)[i] = 0.;
02818 
02819   return FC_SUCCESS;
02820 }
02821 
02822 /**
02823  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
02824  * \brief Compute variable weighted centroid of a displaced mesh.
02825  *
02826  * \description  
02827  *
02828  *    Computes the centroid of a mesh weighted by the variable values
02829  *    (equivalent to center of mass where the variable is the masses). The
02830  *    weights variable must be a scalar variable on the vertices (and should have
02831  *    the same number of vertices as the mesh if it is from a different mesh).
02832  *
02833  * \modifications   
02834  *    - 10/29/04 WSK created.
02835  */
02836 FC_ReturnCode fc_getVariableWeightedDisplacedMeshCentroid(
02837   FC_Mesh mesh,            /**< input - mesh */
02838   FC_Variable coord_displ,  /**< input - coord displacements */
02839   FC_Variable weightsVar,  /**< input - weights */
02840   int* dim,                /**< output - dimensionality of centroid */
02841   FC_Coords *center        /**< output - coordinates of centroid */
02842 ) {
02843   FC_ReturnCode rc;
02844   int i, j;
02845   int numDim, numVertex, numDataPoint, data_dim;
02846   FC_AssociationType assoc; // data association
02847   FC_DataType datatype; // data type
02848   double coords_sum[3];
02849   double* coords, weight_sum, weight;
02850   void* data_p;
02851 
02852   // default output
02853   if (dim)
02854     *dim = -1;
02855   if (center) {
02856     for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
02857       (*center)[i] = -1.;
02858   }
02859 
02860   // check input
02861   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh) || 
02862       !fc_isValidDisplacementVariable(mesh, coord_displ) ||
02863       !fc_isVariableValid(weightsVar) || !dim || !center) {
02864     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
02865     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02866   }
02867   
02868   // get mesh & weights variable information
02869   rc = fc_getMeshInfo(mesh, NULL, &numDim, &numVertex, NULL, NULL);
02870   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02871     return rc;
02872   rc = fc_getVariableInfo(weightsVar, &numDataPoint, &data_dim, &assoc,  
02873                  NULL, &datatype);
02874   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02875     return rc;
02876   
02877    // more checking
02878   if (assoc != FC_AT_VERTEX || numDataPoint != numVertex || data_dim != 1 ||
02879       !fc_isDataTypeValid(datatype) || datatype == FC_DT_UNKNOWN || 
02880       datatype == FC_DT_CHAR) {
02881     fc_printfErrorMessage("Inappropriate variable for weights");
02882     return FC_ERROR;
02883   }
02884 
02885   // log message
02886   fc_printfLogMessage("Computing variable weighted centroid of mesh.");  
02887 
02888   // get vertices and data
02889   rc = fc_getDisplacedMeshCoords(mesh, coord_displ, &coords);
02890   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02891     return rc;
02892   rc = fc_getVariableDataPtr(weightsVar, &data_p);
02893   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02894     return rc;
02895 
02896   // init coord sums
02897   weight_sum = 0.;
02898   for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
02899     coords_sum[i] = 0;
02900 
02901   // collect sums
02902   for (i = 0; i < numVertex; i++) {
02903     switch(datatype) {
02904     case FC_DT_INT :    weight = ((int*)data_p)[i];     break;
02905     case FC_DT_FLOAT:   weight = ((float*)data_p)[i];   break;
02906     case FC_DT_DOUBLE:  weight = ((double*)data_p)[i];  break;
02907     default:
02908       ; // nothing
02909     }
02910     weight_sum += weight;
02911     for (j = 0; j < numDim; j++) {
02912       coords_sum[j] += coords[i*numDim + j] * weight;
02913     }
02914   }
02915   free(coords);
02916 
02917   // calculate weight centroid
02918   *dim = numDim;
02919   for (i = 0; i < numDim; i++)
02920     (*center)[i] = coords_sum[i]/weight_sum;
02921   for (i = numDim; i < 3; i++)
02922     (*center)[i] = 0.;
02923 
02924   return FC_SUCCESS;
02925 }
02926 
02927 /**
02928  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
02929  * \brief Compute centroid of a subset.
02930  *
02931  * \description
02932  *  
02933  *    The centroid is the geometric center of the subset and is calculated by
02934  *    averaging the coordinates in each dimension. Also called center
02935  *    of mass or center of gravity.
02936  *
02937  * \modifications   
02938  *    - 10/29/04 WSK Created.
02939  */
02940 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSubsetCentroid(
02941   FC_Subset subset,    /**< input - subset */
02942   int *dim,            /**< output - dimensionality of coords */
02943   FC_Coords *center    /**< output - coordinates of centroid */
02944 ) {
02945   FC_ReturnCode rc;
02946   int i, j;
02947   FC_Mesh mesh;
02948   FC_AssociationType assoc;
02949   int numDim, numVertex, *vertexIDs, numMember, *memberIDs;
02950   double *coords_p;
02951   double coords_sum[3];
02952   
02953   // default
02954   if (dim)
02955     *dim = -1;
02956   if (center) {
02957     for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
02958       (*center)[i] = -1.;
02959   }
02960 
02961   // check input
02962   if (!fc_isSubsetValid(subset) || !dim || !center) {
02963     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
02964     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
02965   }
02966 
02967   // log message
02968   fc_printfLogMessage("Computing subset centroid.");  
02969   
02970   // setup I
02971   rc = fc_getMeshFromSubset(subset, &mesh);
02972   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02973     return rc;
02974   rc = fc_getSubsetInfo(subset, &numMember, NULL, &assoc);
02975   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02976     return rc;
02977 
02978   // Error case: if subset has zero members - return error
02979   if (numMember == 0 ) {
02980     fc_printfErrorMessage("Subset has 0 members");
02981     return FC_ERROR;
02982   }
02983   
02984   // special case -- whole association
02985   if (assoc == FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH) 
02986     return fc_getMeshCentroid(mesh, dim, center);
02987     
02988   // setup II
02989   rc = fc_getMeshDim(mesh, &numDim);
02990   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02991     return rc;
02992   rc = fc_getMeshCoordsPtr(mesh, &coords_p);
02993   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02994     return rc;
02995   
02996   // get vertices of the members
02997   rc = fc_getSubsetMembersAsArray(subset, &numMember, &memberIDs);
02998   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
02999     return rc;
03000   rc = fc_changeMeshEntityType(mesh, assoc, numMember, memberIDs, 
03001                                FC_AT_VERTEX, 1, &numVertex, &vertexIDs);
03002   free(memberIDs);
03003 
03004   // calculate coordinate sums
03005   for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
03006     coords_sum[i] = 0.;
03007   
03008   for (i = 0; i < numVertex; i++)
03009     for (j = 0; j < numDim; j++)
03010       coords_sum[j] += coords_p[vertexIDs[i]*numDim + j];
03011   free(vertexIDs);
03012   
03013   // calculate centroids
03014   *dim = numDim;
03015   for (i = 0; i < numDim; i++)
03016     (*center)[i] = coords_sum[i]/numVertex;
03017   for (i = numDim; i < 3; i++)
03018     (*center)[i] = 0.;
03019   
03020   return FC_SUCCESS;
03021 }
03022 
03023 /**
03024  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
03025  * \brief Compute centroid of a displaced subset.
03026  *
03027  * \description
03028  *  
03029  *    The centroid is the geometric center of the subset and is calculated by
03030  *    averaging the coordinates in each dimension. Also called center
03031  *    of mass or center of gravity.
03032  *
03033  * \modifications   
03034  *    - 10/29/04 WSK Created.
03035  */
03036 FC_ReturnCode fc_getDisplacedSubsetCentroid(
03037   FC_Subset subset,    /**< input - subset */
03038   FC_Variable coord_displ,  /**< input - coord displacements */
03039   int *dim,            /**< output - dimensionality of coords */
03040   FC_Coords *center    /**< output - coordinates of centroid */
03041 ) {
03042   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03043   int i, j;
03044   FC_Mesh mesh;
03045   FC_AssociationType assoc;
03046   int numDim, numVertex, *vertexIDs, numMember, *memberIDs;
03047   double *coords;
03048   double coords_sum[3];
03049   
03050   // default
03051   if (dim)
03052     *dim = -1;
03053   if (center) {
03054     for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
03055       (*center)[i] = -1.;
03056   }
03057 
03058   // check input
03059   if (!fc_isSubsetValid(subset) || !dim || !center) {
03060     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03061     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03062   }
03063   rc = fc_getMeshFromSubset(subset, &mesh);
03064   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03065     return rc;
03066   if (!fc_isValidDisplacementVariable(mesh, coord_displ)) {
03067     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03068     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03069   }
03070 
03071   // log message
03072   fc_printfLogMessage("Computing displaced subset centroid.");  
03073   
03074   // setup I
03075   rc = fc_getSubsetInfo(subset, &numMember, NULL, &assoc);
03076   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03077     return rc;
03078 
03079   // Error case: if subset has zero members - return error
03080   if (numMember == 0 ) {
03081     fc_printfErrorMessage("Subset has 0 members");
03082     return FC_ERROR;
03083   }
03084   
03085   // special case -- whole association
03086   if (assoc == FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH) 
03087     return fc_getDisplacedMeshCentroid(mesh, coord_displ, dim, center);
03088     
03089   // setup II
03090   rc = fc_getMeshDim(mesh, &numDim);
03091   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03092     return rc;
03093   rc = fc_getDisplacedMeshCoords(mesh, coord_displ, &coords);
03094   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03095     return rc;
03096   
03097   // get vertices of the members
03098   rc = fc_getSubsetMembersAsArray(subset, &numMember, &memberIDs);
03099   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03100     return rc;
03101   rc = fc_changeMeshEntityType(mesh, assoc, numMember, memberIDs, 
03102                                FC_AT_VERTEX, 1, &numVertex, &vertexIDs);
03103   free(memberIDs);
03104 
03105   // calculate coordinate sums
03106   for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
03107     coords_sum[i] = 0.;
03108   
03109   for (i = 0; i < numVertex; i++)
03110     for (j = 0; j < numDim; j++)
03111       coords_sum[j] += coords[vertexIDs[i]*numDim + j];
03112   free(vertexIDs);
03113   free(coords);
03114   
03115   // calculate centroids
03116   *dim = numDim;
03117   for (i = 0; i < numDim; i++)
03118     (*center)[i] = coords_sum[i]/numVertex;
03119   for (i = numDim; i < 3; i++)
03120     (*center)[i] = 0.;
03121   
03122   return FC_SUCCESS;
03123 }
03124 
03125 /**
03126  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
03127  * \brief Compute centroid of a subset.
03128  *
03129  * \description
03130  *  
03131  *    The centroid is the geometric center of the subset and is calculated by
03132  *    averaging the coordinates in each dimension. Also called center
03133  *    of mass or center of gravity.
03134  *
03135  * \modifications   
03136  *    - 10/29/04 WSK Created.
03137  */
03138 FC_ReturnCode fc_getVariableWeightedSubsetCentroid(
03139   FC_Subset subset,    /**< input - subset */
03140   FC_Variable weightsVar,  /**< input - weights */
03141   int *dim,            /**< output - dimensionality of coords */
03142   FC_Coords *center    /**< output - coordinates of centroid */
03143 ) {
03144   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03145   int i, j;
03146   FC_Mesh mesh;
03147   FC_AssociationType var_assoc, subset_assoc;
03148   FC_DataType datatype; // data type
03149   int numDim, numVertexInMesh, numDataPoint, data_dim;
03150   int numVertex, *vertexIDs, numMember, *memberIDs;
03151   double coords_sum[3];
03152   double *coords_p, weight_sum, weight;
03153   void* data_p;
03154 
03155   // default
03156   if (dim)
03157     *dim = -1;
03158   if (center) {
03159     for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
03160       (*center)[i] = -1.;
03161   }
03162 
03163   // check input
03164   if (!fc_isSubsetValid(subset) || !fc_isVariableValid(weightsVar) || !dim 
03165       || !center) {
03166     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03167     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03168   }
03169 
03170   // get mesh & variable information
03171   rc = fc_getMeshFromSubset(subset, &mesh);
03172   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03173     return rc;
03174   rc = fc_getMeshInfo(mesh, NULL, &numDim, &numVertexInMesh, NULL, NULL);
03175   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03176     return rc;
03177   rc = fc_getVariableInfo(weightsVar, &numDataPoint, &data_dim, &var_assoc,  
03178                  NULL, &datatype);
03179   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03180     return rc;
03181   
03182   // more checking
03183   if (var_assoc != FC_AT_VERTEX || numDataPoint != numVertexInMesh || 
03184       data_dim != 1 || !fc_isDataTypeValid(datatype) || 
03185       datatype == FC_DT_UNKNOWN || datatype == FC_DT_CHAR) {
03186     fc_printfErrorMessage("Inappropriate variable for weights");
03187     return FC_ERROR;
03188   }
03189 
03190   // log message
03191   fc_printfLogMessage("Computing variable weighted subset centroid.");  
03192   
03193   // setup I
03194   rc = fc_getSubsetInfo(subset, &numMember, NULL, &subset_assoc);
03195   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03196     return rc;
03197 
03198   // Error case: if subset has zero members - return error
03199   if (numMember == 0 ) {
03200     fc_printfErrorMessage("Subset has 0 members");
03201     return FC_ERROR;
03202   }
03203   
03204   // special case -- whole association
03205   if (subset_assoc == FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH) 
03206     return fc_getVariableWeightedMeshCentroid(mesh, weightsVar, dim, center);
03207     
03208   // setup II
03209   rc = fc_getMeshCoordsPtr(mesh, &coords_p);
03210   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03211     return rc;
03212   rc = fc_getVariableDataPtr(weightsVar, &data_p);
03213   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03214     return rc;
03215   
03216   // get vertices of the members
03217   rc = fc_getSubsetMembersAsArray(subset, &numMember, &memberIDs);
03218   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03219     return rc;
03220   rc = fc_changeMeshEntityType(mesh, subset_assoc, numMember, memberIDs, 
03221                                FC_AT_VERTEX, 1, &numVertex, &vertexIDs);
03222   free(memberIDs);
03223 
03224   // init coordinate sums
03225   weight_sum = 0.;
03226   for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
03227     coords_sum[i] = 0.;
03228   
03229   // collect sums
03230   for (i = 0; i < numVertex; i++) {
03231     switch(datatype) {
03232     case FC_DT_INT :    weight = ((int*)data_p)[vertexIDs[i]];     break;
03233     case FC_DT_FLOAT:   weight = ((float*)data_p)[vertexIDs[i]];   break;
03234     case FC_DT_DOUBLE:  weight = ((double*)data_p)[vertexIDs[i]];  break;
03235     default:
03236       ; // nothing
03237     }
03238     weight_sum += weight;
03239     for (j = 0; j < numDim; j++)
03240       coords_sum[j] += coords_p[vertexIDs[i]*numDim + j] * weight;
03241   }
03242   free(vertexIDs);
03243   
03244   // calculate centroids
03245   *dim = numDim;
03246   for (i = 0; i < numDim; i++)
03247     (*center)[i] = coords_sum[i]/weight_sum;
03248   for (i = numDim; i < 3; i++)
03249     (*center)[i] = 0.;
03250   
03251   return FC_SUCCESS;
03252 }
03253 
03254 /**
03255  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
03256  * \brief Compute centroid of a displaced subset.
03257  *
03258  * \description
03259  *  
03260  *    The centroid is the geometric center of the subset and is calculated by
03261  *    averaging the coordinates in each dimension. Also called center
03262  *    of mass or center of gravity.
03263  *
03264  * \modifications   
03265  *    - 10/29/04 WSK Created.
03266  */
03267 FC_ReturnCode fc_getVariableWeightedDisplacedSubsetCentroid(
03268   FC_Subset subset,    /**< input - subset */
03269   FC_Variable coord_displ, /**< input - coord displacements */
03270   FC_Variable weightsVar,  /**< input - weights */
03271   int *dim,            /**< output - dimensionality of coords */
03272   FC_Coords *center    /**< output - coordinates of centroid */
03273 ) {
03274   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03275   int i, j;
03276   FC_Mesh mesh;
03277   FC_AssociationType var_assoc, subset_assoc;
03278   FC_DataType datatype; // data type
03279   int numDim, numVertexInMesh, numDataPoint, data_dim;
03280   int numVertex, *vertexIDs, numMember, *memberIDs;
03281   double coords_sum[3];
03282   double *coords, weight_sum, weight;
03283   void* data_p;
03284 
03285   // default
03286   if (dim)
03287     *dim = -1;
03288   if (center) {
03289     for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
03290       (*center)[i] = -1.;
03291   }
03292 
03293   // check input
03294   if (!fc_isSubsetValid(subset) || !fc_isVariableValid(weightsVar) ||
03295       !dim || !center) {
03296     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03297     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03298   }
03299   rc = fc_getMeshFromSubset(subset, &mesh);
03300   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03301     return rc;
03302   if (!fc_isValidDisplacementVariable(mesh, coord_displ)) {
03303     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03304     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03305   }
03306 
03307   // get mesh & weights variable information
03308   rc = fc_getMeshInfo(mesh, NULL, &numDim, &numVertexInMesh, NULL, NULL);
03309   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03310     return rc;
03311   rc = fc_getVariableInfo(weightsVar, &numDataPoint, &data_dim, &var_assoc,  
03312                  NULL, &datatype);
03313   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03314     return rc;
03315   
03316   // more checking
03317   if (var_assoc != FC_AT_VERTEX || numDataPoint != numVertexInMesh || 
03318       data_dim != 1 || !fc_isDataTypeValid(datatype) || 
03319       datatype == FC_DT_UNKNOWN || datatype == FC_DT_CHAR) {
03320     fc_printfErrorMessage("Inappropriate variable for weights");
03321     return FC_ERROR;
03322   }
03323 
03324   // log message
03325   fc_printfLogMessage("Computing variable weighted subset centroid.");  
03326   
03327   // setup I
03328   rc = fc_getSubsetInfo(subset, &numMember, NULL, &subset_assoc);
03329   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03330     return rc;
03331 
03332   // Error case: if subset has zero members - return error
03333   if (numMember == 0 ) {
03334     fc_printfErrorMessage("Subset has 0 members");
03335     return FC_ERROR;
03336   }
03337   
03338   // special case -- whole association
03339   if (subset_assoc == FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH) 
03340     return fc_getVariableWeightedDisplacedMeshCentroid(mesh, coord_displ,
03341                                  weightsVar, dim, center);
03342     
03343   // setup II
03344   rc = fc_getDisplacedMeshCoords(mesh, coord_displ, &coords);
03345   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03346     return rc;
03347   rc = fc_getVariableDataPtr(weightsVar, &data_p);
03348   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03349     return rc;
03350   
03351   // get vertices of the members
03352   rc = fc_getSubsetMembersAsArray(subset, &numMember, &memberIDs);
03353   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03354     return rc;
03355   rc = fc_changeMeshEntityType(mesh, subset_assoc, numMember, memberIDs, 
03356                                FC_AT_VERTEX, 1, &numVertex, &vertexIDs);
03357   free(memberIDs);
03358 
03359   // init coordinate sums
03360   weight_sum = 0.;
03361   for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
03362     coords_sum[i] = 0.;
03363   
03364   // collect sums
03365   for (i = 0; i < numVertex; i++) {
03366     switch(datatype) {
03367     case FC_DT_INT :    weight = ((int*)data_p)[vertexIDs[i]];     break;
03368     case FC_DT_FLOAT:   weight = ((float*)data_p)[vertexIDs[i]];   break;
03369     case FC_DT_DOUBLE:  weight = ((double*)data_p)[vertexIDs[i]];  break;
03370     default:
03371       ; // nothing
03372     }
03373     weight_sum += weight;
03374     for (j = 0; j < numDim; j++)
03375       coords_sum[j] += coords[vertexIDs[i]*numDim + j] * weight;
03376   }
03377   free(vertexIDs);
03378   free(coords);
03379   
03380   // calculate centroids
03381   *dim = numDim;
03382   for (i = 0; i < numDim; i++)
03383     (*center)[i] = coords_sum[i]/weight_sum;
03384   for (i = numDim; i < 3; i++)
03385     (*center)[i] = 0.;
03386   
03387   return FC_SUCCESS;
03388 }

03392 /** \name Mesh entities' measurements */
03393 //-------------------------------
03394 //@{
03395 
03396 
03397 /**
03398  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
03399  * \brief Return a variable with the edge lengths of the mesh
03400  *
03401  * \description
03402  *
03403  *    If the mesh is made of 1D elements (i.e. lines)only lines, the length
03404  *    variable will be associated with the elements. Otherwise it will be 
03405  *    associated with the edges of the mesh.
03406  *
03407  *    This routine will return with an error if the elements of the mesh are 
03408  *    not at least 2D (e.g. it is an error to ask for lengths of a point mesh)
03409  *
03410  * \modifications  
03411  *    - 02/03/04 WSK, Created to be more generally useful than
03412  *       fc_createEdgeMesh
03413  *    - 08/23/04 WSK, Fixed bug: was failing for line mesh.
03414  */
03415 FC_ReturnCode fc_getEdgeLengths(
03416   FC_Mesh mesh,              /**< input - mesh */
03417   FC_Variable *edge_lengths  /**< output - edge lengths variable handle */
03418 ) {
03419   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03420   int i;
03421   int dim, numEdge;
03422   double *lengths;
03423   FC_AssociationType assoc;
03424   FC_ElementType elemType;
03425   double* coords;
03426   int* edgeConns;
03427   
03428   // default return
03429   if (edge_lengths) 
03430     *edge_lengths = FC_NULL_VARIABLE;
03431 
03432   // check input
03433   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh) || edge_lengths == NULL) {
03434     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03435     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03436   }
03437     
03438   // log message
03439   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting the edge lengths of the mesh.");  
03440 
03441   // setup & more checking
03442   rc = fc_getMeshInfo(mesh, NULL, &dim, NULL, NULL, &elemType);
03443   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03444     return rc;
03445   rc = fc_getMeshCoordsPtr(mesh, &coords);
03446   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03447     return rc;
03448   rc = fc_getMeshNumEdge(mesh, &numEdge);
03449   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03450     return rc;
03451   rc = fc_getMeshEdgeConnsPtr(mesh, &edgeConns);
03452   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03453     return rc;
03454   if (numEdge < 1 && elemType != FC_ET_LINE) {
03455     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03456     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03457   }
03458   
03459   // compute edge lengths
03460   lengths = (double *)malloc(sizeof(double) * numEdge);
03461   if (lengths == NULL ) {
03462     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
03463     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
03464   }
03465   for (i = 0; i < numEdge; i++) 
03466     fc_calcEuclideanDistance(&coords[edgeConns[i*2]*dim],
03467                              &coords[edgeConns[i*2 + 1]*dim], 
03468                              dim, &lengths[i]);
03469 
03470   // create new variable
03471   if (elemType == FC_ET_LINE)
03472     assoc = FC_AT_ELEMENT;
03473   else
03474     assoc = FC_AT_EDGE;
03475   rc = fc_createVariable(mesh, "edge_lengths", edge_lengths);
03476   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
03477     free(lengths);
03478     return rc;
03479   }
03480   rc = fc_setVariableDataPtr(*edge_lengths, numEdge, 1, assoc, FC_MT_SCALAR, 
03481                              FC_DT_DOUBLE, lengths);
03482   // don't free lengths!
03483   
03484   return rc;
03485 }
03486 
03487 /**
03488  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
03489  * \brief Return a variable with the edge lengths of the displaced mesh
03490  *
03491  * \description
03492  *
03493  *    If the mesh is made of 1D elements (i.e. lines)only lines, the length
03494  *    variable will be associated with the elements. Otherwise it will be 
03495  *    associated with the edges of the mesh.
03496  *
03497  *    This routine will return with an error if the elements of the mesh are 
03498  *    not at least 2D (e.g. it is an error to ask for lengths of a point mesh)
03499  *
03500  * \modifications  
03501  *    - 11/01/04 WSK created.
03502  */
03503 FC_ReturnCode fc_getDisplacedEdgeLengths(
03504   FC_Mesh mesh,              /**< input - mesh */
03505   FC_Variable coord_displ,   /**< input - coordinated displacements */
03506   FC_Variable *edge_lengths  /**< output - edge lengths variable handle */
03507 ) {
03508   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03509   int i, j, k;
03510   int dim, numEdge;
03511   double *lengths;
03512   FC_AssociationType assoc;
03513   FC_ElementType elemType;
03514   int *edgeConns;
03515   double* coords;
03516   FC_Coords points[2] = { { 0., 0., 0.}, { 0., 0., 0.} };
03517   
03518   // default return
03519   if (edge_lengths) 
03520     *edge_lengths = FC_NULL_VARIABLE;
03521 
03522   // check input
03523   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh) || 
03524       !fc_isValidDisplacementVariable(mesh, coord_displ) ||
03525       edge_lengths == NULL) {
03526     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03527     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03528   }
03529     
03530   // log message
03531   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting the edge lengths of the displaced mesh.");  
03532 
03533   // setup & more checking
03534   rc = fc_getMeshInfo(mesh, NULL, &dim, NULL, NULL, &elemType);
03535   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03536     return rc;
03537   rc = fc_getMeshNumEdge(mesh, &numEdge);
03538   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03539     return rc;
03540   rc = fc_getMeshEdgeConnsPtr(mesh, &edgeConns);
03541   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03542     return rc;
03543   if (numEdge < 1 && elemType != FC_ET_LINE) {
03544     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03545     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03546   }
03547   rc = fc_getDisplacedMeshCoords(mesh, coord_displ, &coords);
03548   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) 
03549     return rc;
03550   
03551   // compute edge lengths
03552   lengths = (double *)malloc(sizeof(double) * numEdge);
03553   if (lengths == NULL ) {
03554     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
03555     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
03556   }
03557   for (i = 0; i < numEdge; i++) {
03558     for (j = 0; j < 2; j++) 
03559       for (k = 0; k < dim; k++)
03560      points[j][k] = coords[dim*edgeConns[i*2+j] + k];
03561     fc_calcEuclideanDistance(points[0], points[1], dim, &lengths[i]);
03562   }
03563   free(coords);
03564 
03565   // create new variable
03566   if (elemType == FC_ET_LINE)
03567     assoc = FC_AT_ELEMENT;
03568   else
03569     assoc = FC_AT_EDGE;
03570   rc = fc_createVariable(mesh, "displaced_edge_lengths", edge_lengths);
03571   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
03572     free(lengths);
03573     return rc;
03574   }
03575   rc = fc_setVariableDataPtr(*edge_lengths, numEdge, 1, assoc, FC_MT_SCALAR, 
03576                              FC_DT_DOUBLE, lengths);
03577   // don't free lengths!
03578   
03579   return rc;
03580 }
03581 
03582 /**
03583  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
03584  * \brief Return a variable with the face areas of the mesh
03585  *
03586  * \description
03587  *
03588  *    If the mesh is made of 2D elements (i.e. tris and quads), the
03589  *    area variable will be associated with the elements. Otherwise it
03590  *    will be associated with the faces of the mesh.
03591  *
03592  *    This routine will return with an error if the elements of the mesh are 
03593  *    not at least 2D (e.g. it is an error to ask for areas of an edge mesh). 
03594  *
03595  *    This routine assumes that faces are planar.
03596  *
03597  * \modifications  
03598  *    - 08/23/04 WSK, Created
03599  */
03600 FC_ReturnCode fc_getFaceAreas(
03601   FC_Mesh mesh,            /**< input - mesh */
03602   FC_Variable *face_areas  /**< output - face areas variable handle */
03603 ) {
03604   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03605   int i, j, k;
03606   int dim, numFace;
03607   double *areas;
03608   FC_AssociationType assoc;
03609   FC_ElementType elemType, *faceTypes;
03610   FC_Coords coords[4];    // buffer for coords
03611   double* mesh_coords;    // coords for entire mesh
03612   int maxNumVertPerFace, *numVertPerFaces, *faceConns;
03613   
03614   // default return
03615   if (face_areas) 
03616     *face_areas = FC_NULL_VARIABLE;
03617 
03618   // check input
03619   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh) || face_areas == NULL) {
03620     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03621     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03622   }
03623     
03624   // log message
03625   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting the face areas of the mesh.");  
03626 
03627   // setup & more checking
03628   rc = fc_getMeshInfo(mesh, NULL, &dim, NULL, NULL, &elemType);
03629   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03630     return rc;
03631   rc = fc_getMeshCoordsPtr(mesh, &mesh_coords);
03632   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03633     return rc;
03634   rc = fc_getMeshNumFace(mesh, &numFace);
03635   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03636     return rc;
03637   rc = fc_getMeshFaceConnsPtr(mesh, &numVertPerFaces, &maxNumVertPerFace,
03638                      &faceConns);
03639   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03640     return rc;
03641   rc = fc_getMeshFaceTypesPtr(mesh, &faceTypes);
03642   if (numFace == 0 && !(elemType == FC_ET_TRI || elemType == FC_ET_QUAD)) {
03643     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03644     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03645   }
03646   
03647   // compute face areas
03648   areas = (double *)malloc(sizeof(double) * numFace);
03649   if (areas == NULL ) {
03650     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
03651     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
03652   } 
03653   for (i = 0; i < numFace; i++) {
03654     for (j = 0; j < numVertPerFaces[i]; j++)
03655       for (k = 0; k < dim; k++) 
03656         coords[j][k] = mesh_coords[faceConns[i*maxNumVertPerFace+j]*dim+k];
03657     switch (faceTypes[i]) {
03658     case FC_ET_TRI:   _fc_calcTriArea(dim, coords, &areas[i]);   break;
03659     case FC_ET_QUAD:  _fc_calcQuadArea(dim, coords, &areas[i]);  break;
03660     default:
03661       fc_printfErrorMessage("Unexpected face type %s encountered",
03662                             fc_getElementTypeText(faceTypes[i]));
03663       return FC_ERROR;
03664     }
03665   }
03666 
03667   // create new variable
03668   if (elemType == FC_ET_TRI || elemType == FC_ET_QUAD)
03669     assoc = FC_AT_ELEMENT;
03670   else
03671     assoc = FC_AT_FACE;
03672   rc = fc_createVariable(mesh, "face_areas", face_areas);
03673   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
03674     free(areas);
03675     return rc;
03676   }
03677   rc = fc_setVariableDataPtr(*face_areas, numFace, 1, assoc, FC_MT_SCALAR, 
03678                           FC_DT_DOUBLE, areas);
03679   // don't free areas! 
03680   
03681   return rc;
03682 }
03683 
03684 /**
03685  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
03686  * \brief Return a variable with the face areas of the displaced mesh
03687  *
03688  * \description
03689  *
03690  *    If the mesh is made of 2D elements (i.e. tris and quads), the
03691  *    area variable will be associated with the elements. Otherwise it
03692  *    will be associated with the faces of the mesh.
03693  *
03694  *    This routine will return with an error if the elements of the mesh are 
03695  *    not at least 2D (e.g. it is an error to ask for areas of an edge mesh). 
03696  *
03697  *    This routine assumes that faces are planar.
03698  *
03699  * \modifications  
03700  *    - 11/1/04 WSK, Created
03701  */
03702 FC_ReturnCode fc_getDisplacedFaceAreas(
03703   FC_Mesh mesh,             /**< input - mesh */
03704   FC_Variable coord_displ,  /**< input - coordinated displacements */
03705   FC_Variable *face_areas   /**< output - face areas variable handle */
03706 ) {
03707   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03708   int i, j, k;
03709   int dim, numFace;
03710   double *areas;
03711   FC_AssociationType assoc;
03712   FC_ElementType elemType, *faceTypes;
03713   double* coords;
03714   int maxNumVertPerFace, *numVertPerFaces, *faceConns;
03715   // buffer for coords of face
03716   FC_Coords points[4] = { { 0., 0., 0.}, { 0., 0., 0.},
03717                  { 0., 0., 0.}, { 0., 0., 0.} };  
03718   
03719   // default return
03720   if (face_areas) 
03721     *face_areas = FC_NULL_VARIABLE;
03722 
03723   // check input
03724   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh) || 
03725       !fc_isValidDisplacementVariable(mesh, coord_displ) ||
03726       face_areas == NULL) {
03727     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03728     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03729   }
03730     
03731   // log message
03732   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting the face areas of the displaced mesh.");  
03733 
03734   // setup & more checking
03735   rc = fc_getMeshInfo(mesh, NULL, &dim, NULL, NULL, &elemType);
03736   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03737     return rc;
03738   rc = fc_getMeshNumFace(mesh, &numFace);
03739   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03740     return rc;
03741   rc = fc_getMeshFaceConnsPtr(mesh, &numVertPerFaces, &maxNumVertPerFace,
03742                      &faceConns);
03743   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03744     return rc;
03745   rc = fc_getMeshFaceTypesPtr(mesh, &faceTypes);
03746   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03747     return rc;
03748   if (numFace == 0 && !(elemType == FC_ET_TRI || elemType == FC_ET_QUAD)) {
03749     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03750     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03751   }
03752   rc = fc_getDisplacedMeshCoords(mesh, coord_displ, &coords);
03753   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03754     return rc;
03755   
03756   // compute face areas
03757   areas = (double *)malloc(sizeof(double) * numFace);
03758   if (areas == NULL ) {
03759     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
03760     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
03761   } 
03762   for (i = 0; i < numFace; i++) {
03763     for (j = 0; j < numVertPerFaces[i]; j++)
03764       for (k = 0; k < dim; k++) 
03765         points[j][k] = coords[dim*faceConns[i*maxNumVertPerFace+j] + k];
03766     switch (faceTypes[i]) {
03767     case FC_ET_TRI:   _fc_calcTriArea(dim, points, &areas[i]);   break;
03768     case FC_ET_QUAD:  _fc_calcQuadArea(dim, points, &areas[i]);  break;
03769     default:
03770       fc_printfErrorMessage("Unexpected face type %s encountered",
03771                             fc_getElementTypeText(faceTypes[i]));
03772       return FC_ERROR;
03773     }
03774   }
03775   free(coords);
03776 
03777   // create new variable
03778   if (elemType == FC_ET_TRI || elemType == FC_ET_QUAD)
03779     assoc = FC_AT_ELEMENT;
03780   else
03781     assoc = FC_AT_FACE;
03782   rc = fc_createVariable(mesh, "displaced_face_areas", face_areas);
03783   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
03784     free(areas);
03785     return rc;
03786   }
03787   rc = fc_setVariableDataPtr(*face_areas, numFace, 1, assoc, FC_MT_SCALAR, 
03788                     FC_DT_DOUBLE, areas);
03789   // don't free areas! 
03790   
03791   return rc;
03792 }
03793 
03794 /**
03795  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
03796  * \brief Return a variable with the region volumes of the mesh.
03797  *
03798  * \description
03799  *
03800  *    This will return with an error if the elements of the mesh are not 3D 
03801  *    (e.g. it is an error to ask for volumes of a quad mesh).
03802  *
03803  *    This routine assumes that the faces of the regions are planar.
03804  *
03805  * \modifications  
03806  *    - 08/23/04 WSK, Created
03807  */
03808 FC_ReturnCode fc_getRegionVolumes(
03809   FC_Mesh mesh,            /**< input - mesh */
03810   FC_Variable *region_volumes  /**< output - region volumes variable handle */
03811 ) {
03812   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03813   int i, j, k;
03814   int dim, numElement, numVertPerElem;
03815   double *vols;
03816   FC_ElementType elemType;
03817   FC_Coords points[8];    // buffer for coords
03818   double* coords;
03819   int* conns;
03820 
03821   // default return
03822   if (region_volumes) 
03823     *region_volumes = FC_NULL_VARIABLE;
03824   
03825   // check input
03826   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh) || region_volumes == NULL) {
03827     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03828     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03829   }
03830   
03831   // log message
03832   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting the region volumes of the mesh.");  
03833   
03834   // setup & more checking
03835   rc = fc_getMeshInfo(mesh, NULL, &dim, NULL, &numElement, &elemType);
03836   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03837     return rc;
03838   if (elemType != FC_ET_TET && elemType != FC_ET_PYRAMID && 
03839       elemType != FC_ET_PRISM && elemType != FC_ET_HEX) {
03840     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03841     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03842   }
03843   rc = fc_getMeshCoordsPtr(mesh, &coords);
03844   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03845     return rc;
03846   rc = fc_getMeshElementConnsPtr(mesh, &conns);
03847   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03848     return rc;
03849   numVertPerElem = fc_getElementTypeNumVertex(elemType);
03850   
03851   // compute element volumes
03852   vols = (double *)malloc(sizeof(double) * numElement);
03853   if (vols == NULL ) {
03854     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
03855     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
03856   } 
03857   for (i = 0; i < numElement; i++) {
03858     for (j = 0; j < numVertPerElem; j++)
03859       for (k = 0; k < dim; k++) 
03860         points[j][k] = coords[conns[i*numVertPerElem+j]*dim+k];
03861     switch (elemType) {
03862     case FC_ET_TET:      _fc_calcTetVolume(points, &vols[i]);      break;
03863     case FC_ET_PYRAMID:  _fc_calcPyramidVolume(points, &vols[i]);  break;
03864     case FC_ET_PRISM:    _fc_calcPrismVolume(points, &vols[i]);    break;
03865     case FC_ET_HEX:      _fc_calcHexVolume(points, &vols[i]);      break;
03866     default:
03867       fc_printfErrorMessage("Unexpected element type %s encountered",
03868                             fc_getElementTypeText(elemType));
03869       return FC_ERROR;
03870     }
03871   }
03872 
03873   // create new variable
03874   rc = fc_createVariable(mesh, "region_volumes", region_volumes);
03875   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
03876     free(vols);
03877     return rc;
03878   }
03879   rc = fc_setVariableDataPtr(*region_volumes, numElement, 1, FC_AT_ELEMENT,
03880                              FC_MT_SCALAR, FC_DT_DOUBLE, vols);
03881   // don't free vols!
03882   
03883   return rc;
03884 }
03885 
03886 /**
03887  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
03888  * \brief Return a variable with the region volumes of the displaced mesh.
03889  *
03890  * \description
03891  *
03892  *    This will return with an error if the elements of the mesh are not 3D 
03893  *    (e.g. it is an error to ask for volumes of a quad mesh).
03894  *
03895  *    This routine assumes that the faces of the regions are planar.
03896  *
03897  * \modifications  
03898  *    - 11/01/04 WSK, Created
03899  */
03900 FC_ReturnCode fc_getDisplacedRegionVolumes(
03901   FC_Mesh mesh,             /**< input - mesh */
03902   FC_Variable coord_displ,  /**< input - coordinated displacements */
03903   FC_Variable *region_volumes  /**< output - region volumes variable handle */
03904 ) {
03905   FC_ReturnCode rc;
03906   int i, j, k;
03907   int dim, numElement, numVertPerElem;
03908   double *vols;
03909   FC_ElementType elemType;
03910   double* coords;
03911   int* conns;
03912   // buffer for coords of the region
03913   FC_Coords points[8] = { { 0., 0., 0.}, { 0., 0., 0.},
03914                  { 0., 0., 0.}, { 0., 0., 0.},
03915                  { 0., 0., 0.}, { 0., 0., 0.},
03916                  { 0., 0., 0.}, { 0., 0., 0.} };   
03917 
03918   // default return
03919   if (region_volumes) 
03920     *region_volumes = FC_NULL_VARIABLE;
03921   
03922   // check input
03923   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh) || 
03924       !fc_isValidDisplacementVariable(mesh, coord_displ) ||
03925       region_volumes == NULL) {
03926     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03927     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03928   }
03929   
03930   // log message
03931   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting the region volumes of the displaced mesh.");  
03932   
03933   // setup & more checking
03934   rc = fc_getMeshInfo(mesh, NULL, &dim, NULL, &numElement, &elemType);
03935   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03936     return rc;
03937   if (elemType != FC_ET_TET && elemType != FC_ET_PYRAMID && 
03938       elemType != FC_ET_PRISM && elemType != FC_ET_HEX) {
03939     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
03940     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
03941   }
03942   rc = fc_getDisplacedMeshCoords(mesh, coord_displ, &coords);
03943   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03944     return rc;
03945 
03946   rc = fc_getMeshElementConnsPtr(mesh, &conns);
03947   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
03948     return rc;
03949   numVertPerElem = fc_getElementTypeNumVertex(elemType);
03950   
03951   // compute element volumes
03952   vols = (double *)malloc(sizeof(double) * numElement);
03953   if (vols == NULL ) {
03954     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
03955     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
03956   } 
03957   for (i = 0; i < numElement; i++) {
03958     for (j = 0; j < numVertPerElem; j++)
03959       for (k = 0; k < dim; k++) 
03960         points[j][k] = coords[dim*conns[i*numVertPerElem+j] + k];
03961     switch (elemType) {
03962     case FC_ET_TET:      _fc_calcTetVolume(points, &vols[i]);      break;
03963     case FC_ET_PYRAMID:  _fc_calcPyramidVolume(points, &vols[i]);  break;
03964     case FC_ET_PRISM:    _fc_calcPrismVolume(points, &vols[i]);    break;
03965     case FC_ET_HEX:      _fc_calcHexVolume(points, &vols[i]);      break;
03966     default:
03967       fc_printfErrorMessage("Unexpected element type %s encountered",
03968                             fc_getElementTypeText(elemType));
03969       return FC_ERROR;
03970     }
03971   }
03972   free(coords);
03973 
03974   // create new variable
03975   rc = fc_createVariable(mesh, "region_volumes", region_volumes);
03976   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
03977     free(vols);
03978     return rc;
03979   }
03980   rc = fc_setVariableDataPtr(*region_volumes, numElement, 1, FC_AT_ELEMENT,
03981                              FC_MT_SCALAR, FC_DT_DOUBLE, vols);
03982   // don't free vols!
03983   
03984   return rc;
03985 }

03987 
03988 /**
03989  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
03990  * \brief Return a variable with the volume of the mesh.
03991  *
03992  * \description
03993  *
03994  *    This will return with an error and volume = -1 if the elements
03995  *    of the mesh are not 3D (e.g. it is an error to ask for volumes
03996  *    of a quad mesh).
03997  *
03998  *    This routine uses fc_getRegionVolumes and therefore has the same
03999  *    assumptions fc_getRegionVolumes does.
04000  *
04001  * \modifications  
04002  *    - 11/23/04 ACG, Created
04003  */
04004 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshVolume(
04005   FC_Mesh mesh,            /**< input - mesh */
04006   double *volume  /**< output - volume of mesh */
04007 ) {
04008 
04009   FC_ReturnCode rc;
04010   FC_Variable elemvols;
04011   double vol;
04012 
04013   // log message
04014   fc_printfLogMessage("Calculating volume of mesh");
04015 
04016 
04017   // default return
04018   if (volume)
04019     *volume = -1;
04020 
04021   // test input
04022   if (!volume) {
04023     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
04024     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04025   }
04026 
04027   //this will test if mesh is valid
04028   rc = fc_getRegionVolumes(mesh,&elemvols);
04029   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
04030     fc_deleteVariable(elemvols);
04031     return rc;
04032   }
04033   rc = fc_getVariableSum(elemvols,&vol);
04034   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
04035     fc_deleteVariable(elemvols);
04036     return rc;
04037   }
04038 
04039   fc_deleteVariable(elemvols);
04040   *volume = vol;
04041   return FC_SUCCESS;
04042 }
04043 
04044 
04045 /**
04046  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
04047  * \brief Compute displaced mesh volume
04048  *
04049  * \description
04050  *
04051  *    Gets the volume of the mesh after displacing the coordinates
04052  *    with the given variable.
04053  *
04054  *    This will return with an error and vol = -1 if the elements of
04055  *    the mesh are not 3D (e.g. it is an error to ask for volumes of
04056  *    a quad mesh).
04057  *
04058  *    This routine uses fc_getDisplacedRegionVolumes and therefore has the same
04059  *    assumptions fc_getDisplacedRegionVolumes does.
04060  *
04061  *
04062  * \modifications   
04063  *   - 12/03/04 ACG, Created.
04064  */
04065 FC_ReturnCode fc_getDisplacedMeshVolume(
04066   FC_Mesh mesh,            /**< input - mesh handle */
04067   FC_Variable coord_displ, /**< input - coord displacements */
04068   double *volume  /**< output - volume of mesh */
04069 ) {
04070 
04071   FC_ReturnCode rc;
04072   FC_Variable elemvols;
04073   double vol;
04074 
04075   // default return
04076   if (volume)
04077     *volume = -1;
04078 
04079   // test input
04080   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh) || 
04081       !fc_isValidDisplacementVariable(mesh, coord_displ) || !volume) {
04082     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
04083     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04084   }
04085 
04086   // log message
04087   fc_printfLogMessage("Calculating volume of displaced mesh");
04088 
04089   //this will test if mesh and the coord_displ are valid
04090   rc = fc_getDisplacedRegionVolumes(mesh,coord_displ,&elemvols);
04091   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
04092     fc_deleteVariable(elemvols);
04093     return rc;
04094   }
04095   rc = fc_getVariableSum(elemvols,&vol);
04096   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
04097     fc_deleteVariable(elemvols);
04098     return rc;
04099   }
04100 
04101   fc_deleteVariable(elemvols);
04102   *volume = vol;
04103   return FC_SUCCESS;
04104 }
04105 
04106 
04107 
04108 /**
04109  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
04110  * \brief Returns a variable with the volume of the subset
04111  *
04112  * \description
04113  *
04114  *    This will return with an error if the elements of the mesh are not 3D 
04115  *    (e.g. it is an error to ask for volumes of a subset on a quad mesh).
04116  *
04117  *    This routine uses fc_getRegionVolumes and therefore has the same
04118  *    assumptions fc_getRegionVolumes does.
04119  *
04120  *    This routine uses fc_copySubsetWithNewAssociation to make
04121  *    a temporary intermediate subset with association FC_AT_ELEMENT.
04122  *    the "doStrict" input variable is for this call. See documentation
04123  *    there for further information.
04124  * 
04125  *
04126  * \modifications  
04127  *    - 11/30/04 ACG, Created
04128  */
04129 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSubsetVolume(
04130   FC_Subset subs, /**< input - subset */
04131   int doStrict, /**< input - flag for dropping incomplete entities */
04132   double *volume  /**< output - volume of subset */
04133 ) {
04134   int k;
04135   FC_Mesh mesh;
04136   FC_ReturnCode rc;
04137   FC_Variable elemvols;
04138   FC_Subset  newSubset;
04139   void* actual_vols;
04140   int numDataPoint;
04141   char newSubsetName[20] = "junkSubset";
04142   int subsize;
04143   int* memarray;
04144   double vol = 0.0;
04145 
04146   // default return
04147   if (volume)
04148     *volume = -1;
04149 
04150   // test input
04151   if (!fc_isSubsetValid(subs) || !volume ||
04152       (doStrict != 0 && doStrict != 1)) {
04153     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
04154     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04155   }
04156 
04157   // log message
04158   fc_printfLogMessage("Computing subset volume.");
04159 
04160   //need parent 
04161   rc = fc_getMeshFromSubset(subs,&mesh);
04162   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
04163     //    fc_printfErrorMessage("cant get mesh from subset");
04164     return rc;
04165   }
04166 
04167   // get volumes of regions of mesh
04168   // know these have assoc fc_AT_ELEMENT
04169   rc = fc_getRegionVolumes(mesh,&elemvols);
04170   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
04171     //    fc_printfErrorMessage("cant get region volumes");
04172     fc_deleteVariable(elemvols);
04173     return rc;
04174   }
04175 
04176   rc = fc_getVariableDataPtr(elemvols,&actual_vols);
04177   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
04178     //    fc_printfErrorMessage("cant get actual vols");
04179     fc_deleteVariable(elemvols);
04180     return rc;
04181   }
04182 
04183   //just want to know how many there are for safety check below
04184   rc = fc_getVariableNumDataPoint(elemvols, &numDataPoint);
04185   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
04186     fc_deleteVariable(elemvols);
04187     return rc;
04188   }
04189 
04190   rc = fc_copySubsetWithNewAssociation
04191     (subs,newSubsetName,FC_AT_ELEMENT,doStrict,&newSubset);
04192   if (rc!= FC_SUCCESS){
04193     fc_deleteVariable(elemvols);
04194     return rc;
04195   }
04196 
04197   //next steps to match up subset elements with mesh region vols
04198   rc = fc_getSubsetMembersAsArray(newSubset,&subsize,&memarray);
04199   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
04200     //    fc_printfErrorMessage("cant get subset members as array");
04201     fc_deleteVariable(elemvols);
04202     rc = fc_deleteSubset(newSubset);
04203     free(memarray);
04204     return rc;
04205   }
04206 
04207   vol = 0.0;
04208   for (k = 0; k < subsize; k++)
04209     vol += ((double *)(actual_vols))[memarray[k]];
04210 
04211   fc_deleteVariable(elemvols);
04212   rc = fc_deleteSubset(newSubset);
04213   free(memarray);
04214   *volume = vol;
04215   return FC_SUCCESS;
04216 }
04217 
04218 /**
04219  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
04220  * \brief Returns a variable with the volume of the subset on the
04221  *        displaced mesh
04222  *
04223  * \description
04224  *
04225  *    This will return with an error if the elements of the mesh are not 3D 
04226  *    (e.g. it is an error to ask for volumes of a subset on a quad mesh).
04227  *
04228  *    This routine uses fc_getDisplacedRegionVolumes and therefore has the same
04229  *    assumptions fc_getDisplacedRegionVolumes does.
04230  *
04231  *    This routine uses fc_copySubsetWithNewAssociation to make
04232  *    a temporary intermediate subset with association FC_AT_ELEMENT.
04233  *    the "doStrict" input variable is for this call. See documentation
04234  *    there for further information.
04235  * 
04236  *
04237  * \modifications  
04238  *    - 12/06/04 ACG, Created
04239  */
04240 FC_ReturnCode fc_getDisplacedSubsetVolume(
04241   FC_Subset subs, /**< input - subset */
04242   int doStrict, /**< input - flag for dropping incomplete entities */
04243   FC_Variable coord_displ, /**< input - coord displacements */
04244   double *volume  /**< output - volume of subset */
04245 ) {
04246   int k;
04247   FC_Mesh mesh;
04248   FC_ReturnCode rc;
04249   FC_Variable elemvols;
04250   FC_Subset  newSubset;
04251   void* actual_vols;
04252   int numDataPoint;
04253   char newSubsetName[20] = "junkSubset";
04254   int subsize;
04255   int* memarray;
04256   double vol = 0.0;
04257 
04258   // default return
04259   if (volume)
04260     *volume = -1;
04261 
04262   // test input
04263   if (!fc_isSubsetValid(subs) || (doStrict != 0 && doStrict != 1) ||
04264       !volume) {
04265     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
04266     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04267   }
04268   rc = fc_getMeshFromSubset(subs, &mesh);
04269   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04270     return rc;
04271   if (!fc_isValidDisplacementVariable(mesh, coord_displ)) {
04272     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
04273     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04274   }
04275 
04276   // log message
04277   fc_printfLogMessage("Computing displaced subset volume.");
04278 
04279   // get volumes of displaced regions of mesh
04280   rc = fc_getDisplacedRegionVolumes(mesh, coord_displ, &elemvols);
04281   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
04282     fc_deleteVariable(elemvols);
04283     return rc;
04284   }
04285 
04286   rc = fc_getVariableDataPtr(elemvols,&actual_vols);
04287   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
04288     //    fc_printfErrorMessage("cant get actual vols");
04289     fc_deleteVariable(elemvols);
04290     return rc;
04291   }
04292 
04293   // just want to know how many there are for safety check below
04294   rc = fc_getVariableNumDataPoint(elemvols, &numDataPoint);
04295   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
04296     fc_deleteVariable(elemvols);
04297     return rc;
04298   }
04299 
04300   rc = fc_copySubsetWithNewAssociation(subs, newSubsetName, FC_AT_ELEMENT, 
04301                            doStrict, &newSubset);
04302   if (rc!= FC_SUCCESS) {
04303     fc_deleteVariable(elemvols);
04304     return rc;
04305   }
04306 
04307   // next steps to match up subset elements with displaced mesh region vols
04308   rc = fc_getSubsetMembersAsArray(newSubset, &subsize, &memarray);
04309   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS){
04310     //    fc_printfErrorMessage("cant get subset members as array");
04311     fc_deleteVariable(elemvols);
04312     rc = fc_deleteSubset(newSubset);
04313     free(memarray);
04314     return rc;
04315   }
04316 
04317   vol = 0.0;
04318   for (k = 0; k < subsize; k++)
04319     vol += ((double *)(actual_vols))[memarray[k]];
04320 
04321   fc_deleteVariable(elemvols);
04322   rc = fc_deleteSubset(newSubset);
04323   free(memarray);
04324   *volume = vol;
04325   return FC_SUCCESS;
04326 }
04327 
04328 
04329 /**
04330  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
04331  * \brief Returns a variable with the area of the subset
04332  *
04333  * \description
04334  *
04335  *    Returns the area of subset. The subset must have assoc
04336  *    FC_AT_FACE. Fails for NULL Subset, Returns 0 for empty subset.
04337  *
04338  * \todo
04339  *    - make displaced version
04340  *
04341  * \modifications  
04342  *    - 07/18/06 ACG, Created from old fc_getSidesAreas
04343  */
04344 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSubsetArea(
04345   FC_Subset subset, /**< input - subset */
04346   double *area  /**< output - area of subset */
04347 ) {
04348   FC_Mesh mesh;
04349   FC_ReturnCode rc;
04350   FC_Variable faceareas;
04351   double *areaarray;
04352   double retarea = 0.0;
04353   FC_AssociationType assoc;
04354   int numMem, *ids;
04355   int i;
04356 
04357   //default return
04358   if (area)
04359     *area = -1;
04360 
04361   if (!fc_isSubsetValid(subset) || !area ){
04362     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
04363     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04364   }
04365 
04366 
04367   rc = fc_getSubsetAssociationType(subset, &assoc);
04368   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04369     return rc;
04370   if ( assoc != FC_AT_FACE){
04371     fc_printfErrorMessage("Wrong association type");
04372     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04373   }
04374 
04375   // log message
04376   fc_printfLogMessage("Computing Subset Area");
04377 
04378 
04379   rc = fc_getSubsetMembersAsArray(subset, &numMem, &ids);
04380   if (rc!= FC_SUCCESS){
04381     return rc;
04382   }
04383   if (numMem == 0){
04384     *area = 0.0;
04385     return FC_SUCCESS;
04386   }
04387 
04388   //get areas for all faces of the mesh
04389   rc = fc_getMeshFromSubset(subset,&mesh);
04390   if (rc!= FC_SUCCESS){
04391     free(ids);
04392     return rc;
04393   }
04394 
04395   rc = fc_getFaceAreas(mesh,&faceareas);
04396   if (rc!= FC_SUCCESS){
04397     fc_printfErrorMessage("cant get face areas");
04398     free(ids);
04399     return rc;
04400   }
04401 
04402   rc = fc_getVariableDataPtr(faceareas,(void **) &areaarray);
04403   if (rc!= FC_SUCCESS){
04404     free(ids);
04405     return rc;
04406   }
04407 
04408 
04409   for (i = 0; i < numMem; i++){
04410     retarea += areaarray[ids[i]];
04411   }
04412   free(ids);
04413   fc_deleteVariable(faceareas);
04414   *area = retarea;
04415 
04416   return FC_SUCCESS;
04417 }
04418 
04419 
04420 
04421 
04422 //@}
04423 
04424 /** \name Normals */
04425 //-------------------------------
04426 //@{
04427 
04428 /**
04429  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
04430  * \brief Compute surface normals on all elements in a mesh
04431  *
04432  * \description
04433  *  
04434  *    Compute surface normals on all elements in a mesh. Currently
04435  *    only correct for meshes with planar elements (like triangles
04436  *    and planar quads).
04437  *
04438  * \modifications  
04439  *    - Steph Boyles  Created.
04440  *    - 2002-JUL-09  W Koegler  Adapted to modified struct Vector
04441  *    - 2003-SEP-04  W Koegler  Created: _fc_SurfaceNormal was split between
04442  *    this function and _fc_calcSurfaceNormal for better modularity.
04443  *
04444  * \todo needs a flag if the normals are already computed
04445  * \todo expand to 3D elements -> could return surface normals of faces?
04446  *      ... but what would their orientation be?
04447  */
04448 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSurfaceNormals(
04449   FC_Mesh mesh,          /**< input - mesh to compute surface normals of */
04450   FC_Variable *new_var   /**< output - new variable w/ surface normals as data */
04451 ) {
04452   FC_ReturnCode rc;
04453   int i, j, k;
04454   double *normals;
04455   FC_Vector temp_normal;  // normal vector to an element
04456   FC_Coords temp_vertices[4]; // array of vertex coords to pass around
04457   int numElem, dim, numVertPerElem;
04458   FC_ElementType elemType;
04459   double* coords;
04460   int* conns;
04461   
04462   // default return
04463   if (new_var)
04464     *new_var = FC_NULL_VARIABLE;
04465   
04466   // check input
04467   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh) || !new_var) {
04468     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
04469     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04470   }
04471 
04472   // setup and more checking
04473   rc = fc_getMeshInfo(mesh, NULL, &dim, NULL, &numElem, &elemType);
04474   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04475     return rc;
04476   if (elemType != FC_ET_TRI && elemType != FC_ET_QUAD) {
04477     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s, can't handle element type %s", 
04478         fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR),fc_getElementTypeText(elemType));
04479     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04480   }
04481   rc = fc_getMeshCoordsPtr(mesh, &coords);
04482   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04483     return rc;
04484   rc = fc_getMeshElementConnsPtr(mesh, &conns);
04485   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04486     return rc;
04487   numVertPerElem = fc_getElementTypeNumVertex(elemType);
04488   
04489   // log message
04490   fc_printfLogMessage("Computing surface normals.");
04491   
04492   // make space for the data array 
04493   normals = (double *)malloc(sizeof(double) * dim * numElem);
04494   if (normals == NULL ) {
