04495     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
04496     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
04497   } 
04498   
04499   // compute Surface normals, save in buffer
04500   for (i = 0; i < numElem; i++) {
04501 
04502     // make list of pointers to this elements vertices
04503     for (j = 0; j < numVertPerElem; j++) {
04504       for (k = 0; k < dim; k++)
04505         temp_vertices[j][k] = coords[conns[i*numVertPerElem+j]*dim+k];
04506       for (k = dim; k < 3; k++)
04507         temp_vertices[j][k] = 0;
04508     }
04509 
04510     // calculate normal
04511     _fc_calcSurfaceNormal(numVertPerElem, temp_vertices, &temp_normal);
04512     
04513     // save results in element info and an array to make into a var
04514     for (j = 0; j < dim; j++) 
04515       normals[i*dim+j] = temp_normal[j];
04516   }
04517   
04518   // add new variable to current mesh
04519   fc_createVariable(mesh, "surfaceNormals", new_var);
04520   fc_setVariableDataPtr(*new_var, numElem, dim, FC_AT_ELEMENT, FC_MT_VECTOR, 
04521                         FC_DT_DOUBLE, normals);
04522   // don't free normals
04523   
04524   return FC_SUCCESS;
04525 }
04526 
04527 /**
04528  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
04529  * \brief Compute surface normals on all elements in a mesh
04530  *
04531  * \description
04532  *
04533  *    Compute surface normals on all elements in a mesh after the mesh has been
04534  *    deformed by adding a displacement vector to the coordinates. See
04535  *    fc_getSurfaceNormals.
04536  *
04537  * \modifications 
04538  *   - 2003-JUL-01  W Koegler  Created from fc_getSurfaceNormals 
04539  *   - 2003-SEP-04  W Koegler  Moved calculation of displaced coords to its
04540  *   own function, fc_getDisplacedVertices. 
04541  */
04542 FC_ReturnCode fc_getDisplacedSurfaceNormals(
04543   FC_Mesh mesh,          /**< input - mesh to compute surface normals of */
04544   FC_Variable displ,     /**< input - coord displacment variable */
04545   FC_Variable *new_var   /**< output - new variable w/ surface normals as data */
04546 ) 
04547 {
04548   FC_ReturnCode rc;
04549   int i, j, k;
04550   double *normals;
04551   FC_Vector temp_normal;         // normal vector an the element
04552   int numElem, dim, numVertPerElem;
04553   FC_ElementType elemType;
04554   double *displ_coords; // mesh's displaced coords
04555   int* conns;
04556   FC_Coords temp_vertices[4];
04557 
04558   // default return
04559   if (new_var)
04560     *new_var = FC_NULL_VARIABLE;
04561   
04562   // check input
04563   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh) || 
04564       !fc_isValidDisplacementVariable(mesh, displ) || 
04565       !new_var) {
04566     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
04567     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04568   }
04569 
04570   // log message
04571   fc_printfLogMessage("Getting displaced surface normals.");  
04572   
04573   // get this meshes element info
04574   rc = fc_getMeshInfo(mesh, NULL, &dim, NULL, &numElem, &elemType);
04575   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04576     return rc;
04577   rc = fc_getMeshElementConnsPtr(mesh, &conns);
04578   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04579     return rc;
04580   numVertPerElem = fc_getElementTypeNumVertex(elemType);
04581  
04582   // get the displaced vertex list
04583   fc_getDisplacedMeshCoords(mesh, displ, &displ_coords);
04584   
04585   // make space for the data array 
04586   normals = (double *)malloc(sizeof(double) * dim * numElem);
04587   if (normals == NULL ) {
04588     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
04589     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
04590   } 
04591 
04592   // compute Surface normals, save in buffer
04593   for (i = 0; i < numElem; i++) {
04594     // make list of pointers to this elements vertices
04595     for (j = 0; j < numVertPerElem; j++) {
04596       for (k = 0; k < dim; k++)
04597         temp_vertices[j][k] = displ_coords[conns[i*numVertPerElem+j]*dim + k];
04598       for (k = dim; k < 3; k++)
04599         temp_vertices[j][k] = 0.;
04600     }
04601 
04602     // calculate normal  
04603     _fc_calcSurfaceNormal(numVertPerElem, temp_vertices, &temp_normal);
04604     
04605     // save in array to make var
04606     for (j = 0; j < dim; j++) 
04607       normals[i*dim+j] = temp_normal[j];
04608   }
04609   free(displ_coords);
04610   
04611   // add new variable to current mesh
04612   fc_createVariable(mesh, "displacedSurfaceNormals", new_var);
04613   fc_setVariableDataPtr(*new_var, numElem, dim, FC_AT_ELEMENT, FC_MT_VECTOR, 
04614                         FC_DT_DOUBLE, normals);
04615   // don't free normals
04616  
04617   return FC_SUCCESS;
04618 }
04619 
04620 //@}
04621 
04622 /** \name Deformation */
04623 //-------------------------------
04624 //@{
04625 
04626 /** 
04627  * \ingroup GeometricRelations
04628  * \brief Calculation the deformation of a mesh.
04629  *
04630  * \description
04631  *
04632  *   The displacement variable that is used to define changing mesh geometry 
04633  *    is a combination of mesh translation, rotation, and deformation.  This 
04634  *   routine attempts to extract the deformation component.  It assumes that 
04635  *   deformation is zero in the first step.
04636  *
04637  *   This routines assumes that there is no rotation, and then uses the
04638  *   supplied reference vertex to calculate the translation component. The 
04639  *   deformation component is then the displacement minus the translation.
04640  *   This routine will not perform well if the reference vertex is in a region
04641  *   that deforms.
04642  *
04643  * \todo Want to add two more routines: 1) takes 3 points & so might handles
04644  *   rotation, 2) use optimization to find transformation matrix that
04645  *   minimizes deformation - most robust and automatic.
04646  *
04647  * \modifications
04648  *   - 04/19/05 WSK Created.
04649  */
04650 FC_ReturnCode fc_calcMeshDeformationUsingRefVertex(
04651   FC_Mesh mesh,        /**< input - mesh handle */
04652   int vertexID,        /**< input - vertex to use as translation reference */
04653   int numStep,  /**< input - number of steps in displacement variable */
04654   FC_Variable* displ,  /**< input - the displacement variable */
04655   FC_Variable** deform /**< output - the deformation variable */
04656 ) {
04657   FC_ReturnCode rc;
04658   int i, j, k;
04659   int numDim, numVertex, temp_numStep;
04660   FC_Sequence sequence;
04661   double* displ_coords, *current, orig[3];
04662   double* displ_data, *deform_data;
04663   
04664   // default output
04665   if (deform)
04666     *deform = NULL;
04667 
04668   // check input
04669   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh) || vertexID < 0 || 
04670       !fc_isSeqVariableValid(numStep, displ) ||
04671       !fc_isValidDisplacementVariable(mesh, displ[0])) {
04672     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
04673     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04674   }
04675 
04676   // setup
04677   rc = fc_getVariableInfo(displ[0], &numVertex, &numDim, NULL, NULL, NULL);
04678   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04679     return rc;
04680   
04681   // more checking
04682   if (vertexID >= numVertex) {
04683     fc_printfErrorMessage("The vertex ID is out of range");
04684     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04685   }
04686   
04687   // create the deformation variable
04688   rc = fc_getSequenceFromSeqVariable(numStep, displ, &sequence);
04689   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04690     return rc;
04691   rc = fc_createSeqVariable(mesh, sequence, "deformation", &temp_numStep,
04692                    deform);
04693   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
04694     fc_printfErrorMessage("Could not create sequence variable");
04695     return rc;
04696   }
04697 
04698   // Set the data
04699   for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++) {
04700     // get the displacement of the vertex
04701     // (might be slightly more efficient to calc this on our own)
04702     rc = fc_getDisplacedMeshCoords(mesh, displ[i], &displ_coords);
04703     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04704       return rc;
04705     current = &displ_coords[vertexID*numDim];
04706     if (i == 0) 
04707       for (j = 0; j < numDim; j++)
04708      orig[j] = current[j];
04709     
04710     // create and set deform data
04711     rc = fc_getVariableDataAsDataType(displ[i], FC_DT_DOUBLE,
04712                           (void**)&displ_data);
04713     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
04714       fc_printfErrorMessage("Could not get displ data as double");
04715       return rc;
04716     }
04717     deform_data = (double*)malloc(numDim*numVertex*sizeof(double));
04718     if (!deform_data) {
04719       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
04720       return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
04721     }
04722     // IMPORTANT! To prevent bad roundoff errors, check that values are 
04723     // different before subtracting. If they are not different, answer is 0!
04724     // (Using FC_VALUE_EQUIV instead of FC_DBL_EQUIV because of roundoff in 
04725     // centroid calculation, have to be more flexible)
04726     for (j = 0; j < numVertex; j++) {
04727       for (k = 0; k < numDim; k++) {
04728      if (FC_VALUE_EQUIV(displ_data[j*numDim+k] + orig[k], current[k],
04729                   100*DBL_EPSILON, DBL_MIN))
04730        deform_data[j*numDim+k] = 0.;
04731      else
04732        deform_data[j*numDim+k] = displ_data[j*numDim+k] + orig[k] - current[k];
04733       }
04734     }
04735     free(displ_coords);
04736     rc = fc_setVariableDataPtr((*deform)[i], numVertex, numDim, FC_AT_VERTEX, 
04737                       FC_MT_VECTOR, FC_DT_DOUBLE, deform_data);
04738     free(displ_data);
04739   }
04740   
04741   return FC_SUCCESS;
04742 }
04743 
04744 /** 
04745  * \ingroup GeometricRelations
04746  * \brief Calculation the deformation of a mesh.
04747  *
04748  * \description
04749  *
04750  *   The displacement variable that is used to define changing mesh geometry 
04751  *   is a combination of mesh translation, rotation, and deformation. This 
04752  *   routine attempts to extract the deformation component.  It assumes that
04753  *   deformation is zero in the first step.
04754  *
04755  *   This routines assumes that there is no rotation, and then uses the
04756  *   centroid of the mesh to calculate the translation component. The 
04757  *   deformation component is then the displacement minus the translation.
04758  *   This routine will not perform well if deformation noticeably affects
04759  *   the centroid of the mesh.
04760  *
04761  *  \modifications
04762  *    - 04/19/05 WSK Created.
04763  */
04764 FC_ReturnCode fc_calcMeshDeformationUsingCentroid(
04765   FC_Mesh mesh,        /**< input - mesh handle */
04766   int numStep,  /**< input - number of steps in displacement variable */
04767   FC_Variable* displ,  /**< input - the displacement variable */
04768   FC_Variable** deform /**< output - the deformation variable */
04769 ) {
04770   FC_ReturnCode rc;
04771   int i, j, k;
04772   int numDim, numVertex, temp_numStep;
04773   FC_Sequence sequence;
04774   double* displ_data, *deform_data;
04775   FC_Coords orig, current;
04776   
04777   // default output
04778   if (deform)
04779     *deform = NULL;
04780 
04781   // check input
04782   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh) || !fc_isSeqVariableValid(numStep, displ) ||
04783       !fc_isValidDisplacementVariable(mesh, displ[0])) {
04784     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
04785     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
04786   }
04787 
04788   // setup
04789   rc = fc_getVariableInfo(displ[0], &numVertex, &numDim, NULL, NULL, NULL);
04790   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04791     return rc;
04792   
04793   // create the deformation variable
04794   rc = fc_getSequenceFromSeqVariable(numStep, displ, &sequence);
04795   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04796     return rc;
04797   rc = fc_createSeqVariable(mesh, sequence, "deformation", &temp_numStep,
04798                    deform);
04799   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
04800     fc_printfErrorMessage("Could not create sequence variable");
04801     return rc;
04802   }
04803 
04804   // Set the data
04805   for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++) {
04806     // get the displacement of the centroid
04807     rc = fc_getDisplacedMeshCentroid(mesh, displ[i], &numDim, &current);
04808     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
04809       fc_printfErrorMessage("Could not get centroid");
04810       return rc;
04811     }
04812     if (i == 0) {
04813       for (j = 0; j < numDim; j++) 
04814      orig[j] = current[j];
04815     }
04816 
04817     // create and set deform data
04818     rc = fc_getVariableDataAsDataType(displ[i], FC_DT_DOUBLE,
04819                           (void**)&displ_data);
04820     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) {
04821       fc_printfErrorMessage("Could not get displ data as double");
04822       return rc;
04823     }
04824     deform_data = (double*)malloc(numDim*numVertex*sizeof(double));
04825     if (!deform_data) {
04826       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
04827       return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
04828     }
04829     // IMPORTANT! To prevent bad roundoff errors, check that values are 
04830     // different before subtracting. If they are not different, answer is 0!
04831     // (Using FC_VALUE_EQUIV instead of FC_DBL_EQUIV because of roundoff in 
04832     // centroid calculation, have to be more flexible)
04833     for (j = 0; j < numVertex; j++) {
04834       for (k = 0; k < numDim; k++) {
04835      if (FC_VALUE_EQUIV(displ_data[j*numDim+k] + orig[k], current[k],
04836                   100*DBL_EPSILON, DBL_MIN))
04837        deform_data[j*numDim+k] = 0.;
04838      else
04839        deform_data[j*numDim+k] = displ_data[j*numDim+k] + orig[k] - current[k];
04840       }
04841     }
04842     rc = fc_setVariableDataPtr((*deform)[i], numVertex, numDim, FC_AT_VERTEX, 
04843                       FC_MT_VECTOR, FC_DT_DOUBLE, deform_data);
04844     free(displ_data);
04845   }
04846 
04847   return FC_SUCCESS;
04848 }
04849 
04850 //@}
04851 
04852 /** 
04853  *\name Proximity
04854  *
04855  * Use these routines to test if meshes and subsets are close to each other.
04856  * The actual test is to find pairs of vertices (one from each mesh/subset)
04857  * that are less than or equal to a specified distance cutoff.
04858  */
04859 //-------------------------------
04860 //@{
04861 
04862 /** 
04863  * \ingroup GeometricRelations
04864  * \brief Return the proximal vertices between two meshes.
04865  *
04866  * \description
04867  *   
04868  *    This returns all vertex pairs that are less than or equal
04869  *    to min_dist apart. Vertices may show up in more than one pair.
04870  *    (In the extrememe case if you put in min_dist = infinity, you
04871  *    would end up with each vertex being connected to all vertices
04872  *    of the other mesh.)
04873  *
04874  *    The routine can be forced to return "early", after the first
04875  *    match is found, if you use NULL for the last two arguments (the
04876  *    vertex arrays). In this case, the returned numPair is
04877  *    really a flag for whether a pair was found or not and will
04878  *    never be greater than 1 even if there are more than one
04879  *    possible pairs.
04880  *
04881  *    Note, passing in min_dist = 0 will find overlapping vertices.
04882  *
04883  *    Note, meshes may be closer together than any of the vertex
04884  *    pairs (imagine 1 vertex of one mesh very close to middle of
04885  *    a face of another mesh. the vert to face distance is less
04886  *    than distance to the face's verts).
04887  *
04888  *    Will return if error if mesh1 == mesh2.
04889  *
04890  * \modifications
04891  *    - 02/13/2006 WSD Created.
04892  *    - 03/14/2006 WSD guts common to all proximity routines to a common
04893  *         core routine.
04894  *    - 03/16/2006 WSD changed behavior so that if NULLs are passed
04895  *         in for the vertIDs, will return after 1st match.
04896  */
04897 FC_ReturnCode fc_getMeshesProximity(
04898   FC_Mesh mesh1, /**< input - the first mesh */
04899   FC_Mesh mesh2, /**< input - the second mesh */
04900   double min_dist, /**< input - the distance cutoff */
04901   int* numPair_p, /**< output - the number of vertex pairs found */
04902   int** mesh1VertIDs_p, /**< output - ids of the mesh1 verts (order matters),
04903                 user is responsible for freeing */
04904   int** mesh2VertIDs_p /**< output - ids of the mesh2 verts (order matters),
04905                 user is responsible for freeing */
04906 ) {
04907   FC_ReturnCode rc;
04908   FC_Subset subset1, subset2;
04909 
04910   // argument testing & default returns
04911   rc = _fc_getSubsetsProximityArgsTest(&mesh1, NULL, NULL, &mesh2,
04912                            NULL, NULL, min_dist, numPair_p,
04913                            mesh1VertIDs_p, mesh2VertIDs_p);
04914   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04915     return rc;
04916 
04917   // log message
04918   fc_printfLogMessage("Computing meshes proximity");
04919 
04920   // convert to subsets (WHOLE_MESH)
04921   rc = fc_createSubset(mesh1, "temp", FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH, &subset1);
04922   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04923     return rc;
04924   rc = fc_addMemberToSubset(subset1, 0);
04925   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04926     return rc;
04927   rc = fc_createSubset(mesh2, "temp", FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH, &subset2);
04928   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04929     return rc;
04930   rc = fc_addMemberToSubset(subset2, 0);
04931   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
04932     return rc;
04933 
04934   // do it
04935   rc = _fc_getSubsetsProximityCore(subset1, NULL, subset2, NULL, min_dist, 
04936                        numPair_p, mesh1VertIDs_p, mesh2VertIDs_p);
04937 
04938   // cleanup
04939   fc_deleteSubset(subset1);
04940   fc_deleteSubset(subset2);
04941 
04942   return rc;
04943 }
04944 
04945 /** 
04946  * \ingroup GeometricRelations
04947  * \brief Return the proximal vertices between two displaced meshes.
04948  *
04949  * \description
04950  *   
04951  *    This returns all vertex pairs that are less than or equal
04952  *    to min_dist apart. Vertices may show up in more than one pair.
04953  *    (In the extrememe case if you put in min_dist = infinity, you
04954  *    would end up with each vertex being connected to all vertices
04955  *    of the other mesh.)
04956  *
04957  *    The routine can be forced to return "early", after the first
04958  *    match is found, if you use NULL for the last two arguments (the
04959  *    vertex arrays). In this case, the returned numPair is
04960  *    really a flag for whether a pair was found or not and will
04961  *    never be greater than 1 even if there are more than one
04962  *    possible pairs.
04963  *
04964  *    Note, passing in min_dist = 0 will find overlapping vertices.
04965  *
04966  *    Note, meshes may be closer together than any of the vertex
04967  *    pairs (imagine 1 vertex of one mesh very close to middle of
04968  *    a face of another mesh. the vert to face distance is less
04969  *    than distance to the face's verts).
04970  *
04971  *    Will return if error if mesh1 == mesh2 AND displ1 == displ2.
04972  *    (mesh1 can be the same as mesh2 if displ1 != displ2)
04973  *
04974  * \modifications
04975  *    - 02/14/2006 WSD Created.
04976  *    - 03/14/2006 WSD guts common to all proximity routines to a common
04977  *         core routine.
04978  *    - 03/16/2006 WSD changed behavior so that if NULLs are passed
04979  *         in for the vertIDs, will return after 1st match.
04980  */
04981 FC_ReturnCode fc_getDisplacedMeshesProximity(
04982   FC_Mesh mesh1, /**< input - the first mesh */
04983   FC_Variable displ1, /**< input - the displacements on the first mesh */
04984   FC_Mesh mesh2, /**< input - the second mesh */
04985   FC_Variable displ2, /**< input - the displacements on the second mesh */
04986   double min_dist, /**< input - the distance cutoff */
04987   int* numPair_p, /**< output - the number of vertex pairs found */
04988   int** mesh1VertIDs_p, /**< output - ids of the mesh1 verts (order matters),
04989                 user is responsible for freeing */
04990   int** mesh2VertIDs_p /**< output - ids of the mesh2 verts (order matters),
04991                 user is responsible for freeing */
04992 ) {
04993   FC_ReturnCode rc;
04994   FC_Subset subset1, subset2;
04995 
04996   // argument testing & default returns
04997   rc = _fc_getSubsetsProximityArgsTest(&mesh1, NULL, &displ1, &mesh2,
04998                            NULL, &displ2, min_dist, numPair_p,
04999                            mesh1VertIDs_p, mesh2VertIDs_p);
05000   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05001     return rc;
05002 
05003   // log message
05004   fc_printfLogMessage("Computing displaced meshes proximity");
05005 
05006   // convert to subsets that are whole
05007   rc = fc_createSubset(mesh1, "temp", FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH, &subset1);
05008   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05009     return rc;
05010   rc = fc_addMemberToSubset(subset1, 0);
05011   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05012     return rc;
05013   rc = fc_createSubset(mesh2, "temp", FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH, &subset2);
05014   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05015     return rc;
05016   rc = fc_addMemberToSubset(subset2, 0);
05017   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05018     return rc;
05019 
05020   // do it
05021   rc = _fc_getSubsetsProximityCore(subset1, &displ1, subset2, &displ2,
05022                        min_dist, numPair_p, mesh1VertIDs_p,
05023                        mesh2VertIDs_p);
05024 
05025   // cleanup
05026   fc_deleteSubset(subset1);
05027   fc_deleteSubset(subset2);
05028 
05029   return rc;
05030 }
05031 
05032 /** 
05033  * \ingroup GeometricRelations
05034  * \brief Return the proximal vertices between two subsets.
05035  *
05036  * \description
05037  *   
05038  *    This returns all vertex pairs that are less than or equal
05039  *    to min_dist apart. Vertices may show up in more than one pair.
05040  *    (In the extrememe case if you put in min_dist = infinity, you
05041  *    would end up with each vertex being connected to all vertices
05042  *    of the other subset.)
05043  *
05044  *    The routine can be forced to return "early", after the first
05045  *    match is found, if you use NULL for the last two arguments (the
05046  *    vertex arrays). In this case, the returned numPair is
05047  *    really a flag for whether a pair was found or not and will
05048  *    never be greater than 1 even if there are more than one
05049  *    possible pairs.
05050  *
05051  *    Note, passing in min_dist = 0 will find overlapping vertices,
05052  *    or if subsets are on the same mesh, will find common vertices.
05053  *
05054  *    Note, subsets may be closer together than any of the vertex
05055  *    pairs (imagine 1 vertex of one mesh very close to middle of
05056  *    a face of another mesh. the vert to face distance is less
05057  *    than distance to the face's verts).
05058  *
05059  *    Will return if error if subset1 == subset2.
05060  *
05061  * \modifications
05062  *    - 02/14/2006 WSD Created.
05063  *    - 03/14/2006 WSD guts common to all proximity routines to a common
05064  *         core routine.
05065  *    - 03/16/2006 WSD changed behavior so that if NULLs are passed
05066  *         in for the vertIDs, will return after 1st match.
05067  */
05068 FC_ReturnCode fc_getSubsetsProximity(
05069   FC_Subset subset1, /**< input - the first subset */
05070   FC_Subset subset2, /**< input - the second subset */
05071   double min_dist, /**< input - the distance cutoff */
05072   int* numPair_p, /**< output - the number of vertex pairs found */
05073   int** mesh1VertIDs_p, /**< output - ids of the mesh1 verts (order matters),
05074                 user is responsible for freeing */
05075   int** mesh2VertIDs_p /**< output - ids of the mesh2 verts (order matters),
05076                 user is responsible for freeing */
05077 ) {
05078   FC_ReturnCode rc;
05079 
05080   // argument testing & default returns
05081   rc = _fc_getSubsetsProximityArgsTest(NULL, &subset1, NULL, NULL,
05082                            &subset2, NULL, min_dist, numPair_p,
05083                            mesh1VertIDs_p, mesh2VertIDs_p);
05084   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05085     return rc;
05086  
05087   // log message
05088   fc_printfLogMessage("Computing subsets proximity");
05089 
05090   // do it
05091   return _fc_getSubsetsProximityCore(subset1, NULL, subset2, NULL, min_dist,
05092                          numPair_p, mesh1VertIDs_p,
05093                          mesh2VertIDs_p);
05094 }
05095 
05096 /** 
05097  * \ingroup GeometricRelations
05098  * \brief Return the proximal vertices between two displaced subsets.
05099  *
05100  * \description
05101  *   
05102  *    This returns all vertex pairs that are less than or equal
05103  *    to min_dist apart. Vertices may show up in more than one pair.
05104  *    (In the extrememe case if you put in min_dist = infinity, you
05105  *    would end up with each vertex being connected to all vertices
05106  *    of the other subset.)
05107  *
05108  *    The routine can be forced to return "early", after the first
05109  *    match is found, if you use NULL for the last two arguments (the
05110  *    vertex arrays). In this case, the returned numPair is
05111  *    really a flag for whether a pair was found or not and will
05112  *    never be greater than 1 even if there are more than one
05113  *    possible pairs.
05114  *
05115  *    Note, passing in min_dist = 0 will find overlapping vertices,
05116  *    or if subsets are on the same mesh, will find common vertices.
05117  *
05118  *    Note, subsets may be closer together than any of the vertex
05119  *    pairs (imagine 1 vertex of one mesh very close to middle of
05120  *    a face of another mesh. the vert to face distance is less
05121  *    than distance to the face's verts).
05122  *
05123  *    Will return if error if subset1 == subset2 AND displ1 == displ2.
05124  *    (subset1 can be the same as subset2 if displ1 != displ2)
05125  *
05126  * \modifications
05127  *    - 02/14/2006 WSD Created.
05128  *    - 03/14/2006 WSD guts common to all proximity routines to a common
05129  *         core routine.
05130  *    - 03/16/2006 WSD changed behavior so that if NULLs are passed
05131  *         in for the vertIDs, will return after 1st match.
05132  */
05133 FC_ReturnCode fc_getDisplacedSubsetsProximity(
05134   FC_Subset subset1, /**< input - the first subset */
05135   FC_Variable displ1, /**< input - the displacements on the mesh of the
05136                  first subset */
05137   FC_Subset subset2, /**< input - the second subset */
05138   FC_Variable displ2, /**< input - the displacements on the mesh of the
05139                  second subset */
05140   double min_dist, /**< input - the distance cutoff */
05141   int* numPair_p, /**< output - the number of vertex pairs found */
05142   int** mesh1VertIDs_p, /**< output - ids of the mesh1 verts (order matters),
05143                 user is responsible for freeing */
05144   int** mesh2VertIDs_p /**< output - ids of the mesh2 verts (order matters),
05145                 user is responsible for freeing */
05146 ) {
05147   FC_ReturnCode rc;
05148 
05149   // argument testing & default returns
05150   rc = _fc_getSubsetsProximityArgsTest(NULL, &subset1, &displ1, NULL,
05151                            &subset2, &displ2, min_dist, numPair_p,
05152                            mesh1VertIDs_p, mesh2VertIDs_p);
05153   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05154     return rc;
05155 
05156   // log message
05157   fc_printfLogMessage("Computing displaced subsets proximity");
05158 
05159   return _fc_getSubsetsProximityCore(subset1, &displ1, subset2, &displ2,
05160                          min_dist, numPair_p,
05161                          mesh1VertIDs_p, mesh2VertIDs_p);
05162 }
05163 
05164 //@}
05165 
05166 /** \name Proximity helpers */
05167 //-------------------------------
05168 //@{
05169 
05170 /** 
05171  * \ingroup PrivateGeometricRelations
05172  * \brief Common argument testing for all proximity routines.
05173  *
05174  * \description
05175  *
05176  * \modifications
05177  *    - 03/14/2006 WSD Created.
05178  *    - 03/16/2006 WSD changed behavior so that if NULLs are passed
05179  *         in for the vertIDs, will return after 1st match.
05180  */
05181 FC_ReturnCode _fc_getSubsetsProximityArgsTest(
05182   FC_Mesh* mesh1,      /**< input - the first mesh */
05183   FC_Subset* subset1,  /**< input - the first subset */
05184   FC_Variable* displ1, /**< input - the displs on the first mesh/subset */ 
05185   FC_Mesh* mesh2,      /**< input - the first mesh */
05186   FC_Subset* subset2,  /**< input - the second subset */
05187   FC_Variable* displ2, /**< input - the disps on the 2nd mesh/subset */
05188   double min_dist,     /**< input - the distance cutoff */
05189   int* numPair,        /**< output - the number of vertex pairs found */
05190   int** mesh1VertIDs,  /**< output - ids of the mesh1 verts (order matters),
05191                  user is responsible for freeing */
05192   int** mesh2VertIDs  /**< output - ids of the mesh2 verts (order matters),
05193                 user is responsible for freeing */
05194 ) {
05195   int numDim1, numDim2;
05196   FC_Mesh temp_mesh1, temp_mesh2;
05197 
05198   // default returns
05199   if (numPair)
05200     *numPair = -1;
05201   if (mesh1VertIDs)
05202     *mesh1VertIDs = NULL;
05203   if (mesh2VertIDs)
05204     *mesh2VertIDs = NULL;
05205 
05206   // test input
05207   // It is o.k. to pass in mesh1VertIDs = NULL && mesh2VertIDs = NULL
05208   if (!numPair || (!mesh1VertIDs && mesh2VertIDs) ||
05209       (mesh1VertIDs && !mesh2VertIDs)) { 
05210     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
05211     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
05212   }
05213   if ( (mesh1 && !fc_isMeshValid(*mesh1)) ||
05214        (mesh2 && !fc_isMeshValid(*mesh2)) ||
05215        (subset1 && !fc_isSubsetValid(*subset1)) ||
05216        (subset2 && !fc_isSubsetValid(*subset2)) ||
05217        (displ1 && !fc_isVariableValid(*displ1)) ||
05218        (displ2 && !fc_isVariableValid(*displ2)) ||
05219        fc_lt(min_dist, 0., DBL_EPSILON, DBL_MIN) ) { 
05220     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
05221     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
05222   }
05223   // If have 1, have to have the other, and can't be equal
05224   // (NOTE displ1 == displ2 implies mesh1 = mesh2, so not testing that
05225   if ( (mesh1 && !mesh2) || (!mesh1 && mesh2) ||
05226        (subset1 && !subset2) || (!subset1 && subset2) ||
05227        (displ1 && !displ2) || (!displ1 && displ2) || 
05228        (mesh1 && !displ1 && FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(*mesh1, *mesh2)) ||
05229        (mesh1 && displ1 && FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(*displ1, *displ2)) || 
05230        (subset1 && !displ1 && FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(*subset1, *subset2)) || 
05231        (subset1 && displ1 && (FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(*subset1, *subset2) &&
05232                      FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(*displ1, *displ2))) ) {
05233     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
05234     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
05235   }
05236   // some setup for further testing
05237   if (mesh1) 
05238     temp_mesh1 = *mesh1;
05239   else
05240     fc_getMeshFromSubset(*subset1, &temp_mesh1);
05241   if (mesh2)
05242     temp_mesh2 = *mesh2;
05243   else
05244     fc_getMeshFromSubset(*subset2, &temp_mesh2);
05245   // more tests
05246   if ( (displ1 && !fc_isValidDisplacementVariable(temp_mesh1, *displ1)) ||
05247        (displ2 && !fc_isValidDisplacementVariable(temp_mesh2, *displ2))) {
05248     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
05249     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
05250   }
05251   fc_getMeshDim(temp_mesh1, &numDim1);
05252   fc_getMeshDim(temp_mesh2, &numDim2);
05253   if (numDim1 != numDim2) {
05254     fc_printfErrorMessage("Meshes must have same numDim (%d != %d)",
05255                  numDim1, numDim2);
05256     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
05257   }
05258 
05259   // made it past tests
05260   return FC_SUCCESS;
05261 }
05262 
05263 /** 
05264  * \ingroup PrivateGeometricRelations
05265  * \brief Return the proximal vertices between two displaced subsets.
05266  *
05267  * \description
05268  *   
05269  *    This returns all vertex pairs that are less than or equal
05270  *    to min_dist apart. Vertices may show up in more than one pair.
05271  *    (In the extrememe case if you put in min_dist = infinity, you
05272  *    would end up with each vertex being connected to all vertices
05273  *    of the other subset.)
05274  *
05275  *    The routine can be forced to return "early", after the first
05276  *    match is found, if you use NULL for the last two arguments (the
05277  *    vertex arrays). In this case, the returned numPair is
05278  *    really a flag for whether a pair was found or not and will
05279  *    never be greater than 1 even if there are more than one
05280  *    possible pairs.
05281  *
05282  *    Note, passing in min_dist = 0 will find overlapping vertices,
05283  *    or if subsets are on the same mesh, will find common vertices.
05284  *
05285  *    Note, subsets may be closer together than any of the vertex
05286  *    pairs (imagine 1 vertex of one mesh very close to middle of
05287  *    a face of another mesh. the vert to face distance is less
05288  *    than distance to the face's verts).
05289  *
05290  *    Will return if error if subset1 == subset2 AND displ1 == displ2.
05291  *    (subset1 can be the same as subset2 if displ1 != displ2)
05292  *
05293  * \todo (performance) Restrict the brute force search to vertices 
05294  *     in the bounding box overlap
05295  *
05296  * \todo (performance) make the pairs grow by greater than 1 each time
05297  *
05298  * \modifications
05299  *    - 02/14/2006 WSD Created.
05300  *    - 03/16/2006 WSD changed behavior so that if NULLs are passed
05301  *         in for the vertIDs, will return after 1st match.
05302  */
05303 FC_ReturnCode _fc_getSubsetsProximityCore(
05304   FC_Subset subset1, /**< input - the first subset */
05305   FC_Variable* displ1, /**< input - the displacements on the mesh of the
05306                  first subset */
05307   FC_Subset subset2, /**< input - the second subset */
05308   FC_Variable* displ2, /**< input - the displacements on the mesh of the
05309                  second subset */
05310   double min_dist, /**< input - the distance cutoff */
05311   int* numPair_p, /**< output - the number of vertex pairs found */
05312   int** mesh1VertIDs_p, /**< output - ids of the mesh1 verts (order matters),
05313                 user is responsible for freeing */
05314   int** mesh2VertIDs_p /**< output - ids of the mesh2 verts (order matters),
05315                 user is responsible for freeing */
05316 ) {
05317   FC_ReturnCode rc;
05318   int i, j;
05319   FC_Mesh mesh1, mesh2;
05320   int numDim, temp_numDim, overlap_flag;
05321   int numMember1, numMember2, *memberIDs1, *memberIDs2;
05322   int numVert1, numVert2, *vertIDs1, *vertIDs2;
05323   FC_AssociationType assoc1, assoc2;
05324   FC_Coords lowers1, uppers1, lowers2, uppers2, lowers3, uppers3;
05325   double *coords1, *coords2;
05326   double min_dist2, distance2; // squared versions of min_dist & distance
05327   int numPair = 0, *mesh1VertIDs = NULL, *mesh2VertIDs = NULL;
05328   int *temp1, *temp2;
05329   int doDispl = 0, doPairs = 0;
05330 
05331   // assume args all tested & defaults set
05332 
05333   // setup
05334   if (displ1 && displ2)
05335     doDispl = 1;
05336   if (mesh1VertIDs_p && mesh2VertIDs_p)
05337     doPairs = 1;
05338   fc_getMeshFromSubset(subset1, &mesh1);
05339   fc_getMeshFromSubset(subset2, &mesh2);
05340 
05341   // plus one more test:
05342   fc_getMeshDim(mesh1, &numDim);
05343   fc_getMeshDim(mesh2, &temp_numDim);
05344   if (numDim != temp_numDim) {
05345     fc_printfErrorMessage("Meshes must have same numDim (%d != %d)",
05346                  numDim, temp_numDim);
05347     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
05348   }
05349 
05350   // Compute bounding boxes +/- min_dist/2
05351   if (doDispl) {
05352     rc = fc_getDisplacedSubsetBoundingBox(subset1, *displ1, &numDim, &lowers1, 
05353                            &uppers1);
05354     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05355       return rc;
05356     rc = fc_getDisplacedSubsetBoundingBox(subset2, *displ2, &numDim, &lowers2, 
05357                            &uppers2);
05358     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05359       return rc;
05360   }
05361   else {
05362     rc = fc_getSubsetBoundingBox(subset1, &numDim, &lowers1, &uppers1);
05363     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05364       return rc;
05365     rc = fc_getSubsetBoundingBox(subset2, &numDim, &lowers2, &uppers2);
05366     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05367       return rc;
05368   }
05369   for (i = 0; i < numDim; i++) {
05370     lowers1[i] -= min_dist/2.;
05371     lowers2[i] -= min_dist/2.;
05372     uppers1[i] += min_dist/2.;
05373     uppers2[i] += min_dist/2.;
05374   }
05375   rc = fc_getBoundingBoxesOverlap(numDim, lowers1, uppers1, lowers2, uppers2, 
05376                       &overlap_flag, &lowers3, &uppers3);
05377   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05378     return rc;
05379 
05380   // early return if no overlap
05381   if (overlap_flag == 0) {
05382     *numPair_p = 0;
05383     return FC_SUCCESS;
05384   }
05385 
05386   // convert subset members to verts (if needed)
05387   fc_getSubsetAssociationType(subset1, &assoc1);
05388   fc_getSubsetAssociationType(subset2, &assoc2);
05389   fc_getSubsetMembersAsArray(subset1, &numMember1, &memberIDs1);
05390   fc_getSubsetMembersAsArray(subset2, &numMember2, &memberIDs2);
05391   if (assoc1 == FC_AT_VERTEX) {
05392     numVert1 = numMember1;
05393     vertIDs1 = memberIDs1;
05394   }
05395   else {
05396     fc_changeMeshEntityType(mesh1, assoc1, numMember1, memberIDs1,
05397                    FC_AT_VERTEX, 0, &numVert1, &vertIDs1);
05398     free(memberIDs1);
05399   }
05400   if (assoc2 == FC_AT_VERTEX) {
05401     numVert2 = numMember2;
05402     vertIDs2 = memberIDs2;
05403   }
05404   else {
05405     fc_changeMeshEntityType(mesh2, assoc2, numMember2, memberIDs2,
05406                    FC_AT_VERTEX, 0, &numVert2, &vertIDs2);
05407     free(memberIDs2);
05408   }
05409 
05410   // get coords
05411   if (doDispl) {
05412     rc = fc_getDisplacedMeshCoords(mesh1, *displ1, &coords1);
05413     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05414       return rc;
05415     rc = fc_getDisplacedMeshCoords(mesh2, *displ2, &coords2);
05416     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05417       return rc;
05418   }
05419   else {
05420     rc = fc_getMeshCoordsPtr(mesh1, &coords1);
05421     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05422       return rc;
05423     rc = fc_getMeshCoordsPtr(mesh2, &coords2);
05424     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05425       return rc;
05426   }
05427 
05428   // FIX make this better 
05429   // 1) have smarter realloc of pairs - grow by *2
05430   // 2) could just test vertices in the overlap
05431   // 3) set up two sets of loops - switch from the first
05432   //    after the first pair is found so don't have the
05433   //    doPairs test in every loop
05434   
05435   // If find a pair, add to pairs
05436   // Note: early return if not doing pairs
05437   min_dist2 = min_dist*min_dist;
05438   for (i = 0; i < numVert1; i++) {
05439     int vertID1 = vertIDs1[i];
05440     for (j = 0; j < numVert2; j++) {
05441       int vertID2 = vertIDs2[j];
05442       fc_calcSquaredEuclideanDistance(&coords1[vertID1*numDim], 
05443                           &coords2[vertID2*numDim], numDim,
05444                           &distance2);
05445       if (fc_lteq(distance2, min_dist2, DBL_EPSILON, DBL_MIN)) {
05446      if (!doPairs) {
05447        *numPair_p = 1;
05448        free(vertIDs1);
05449        free(vertIDs2);
05450        if (doDispl) {
05451          free(coords1);
05452          free(coords2);
05453        }
05454        return FC_SUCCESS;
05455      }
05456      temp1 = realloc(mesh1VertIDs, (numPair+1)*sizeof(int));
05457      temp2 = realloc(mesh2VertIDs, (numPair+1)*sizeof(int));
05458      if (!temp1 || !temp2) {
05459        free(mesh1VertIDs); free(mesh2VertIDs);
05460        fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
05461        return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
05462      }
05463      mesh1VertIDs = temp1;
05464      mesh2VertIDs = temp2;
05465      mesh1VertIDs[numPair] = vertID1;
05466      mesh2VertIDs[numPair] = vertID2;
05467      numPair++;
05468       }
05469     }
05470   }
05471   free(vertIDs1);
05472   free(vertIDs2);
05473   if (doDispl) {
05474     free(coords1);
05475     free(coords2);
05476   }
05477 
05478   // set return values
05479   *numPair_p = numPair;
05480   if (doPairs) { // in case numPair is zero
05481     *mesh1VertIDs_p = mesh1VertIDs;
05482     *mesh2VertIDs_p = mesh2VertIDs;
05483   }
05484 
05485   return FC_SUCCESS;
05486 }
05487 
05488 //@}
05489 
05490 /** 
05491  *\name Range queries and variable smoothing 
05492  *
05493  * There are no subset versions of these routines since the searching
05494  * data structure is per mesh. To find the entities of a subset within a range:
05495  * do the range search on the mesh, then use fc_createSubsetIntersection()
05496  * to "AND" that with the original subset. The result are the members of
05497  * the subset that fall within the range.
05498  */
05499 //-------------------------------
05500 //@{
05501 
05502 /**
05503  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
05504  * \brief Create spatial bins for vertices for geometric queries
05505  *
05506  * \description
05507  * 
05508  *     Create an FC_VertexBin to use for geometric queries.  The user is
05509  *     responsible for freeing the created FC_VertexBin by calling
05510  *     fc_freeVertexBin().
05511  *
05512  *     This is a wrapper around _fc_createVertexBinCore() which does all the
05513  *     work.
05514  *   
05515  * \todo Check that this works with 1D & 2D coords
05516  *
05517  * \modifications 
05518  *    - 03/08/04 WSK, created.
05519  *    - 02/20/06 WSD, moved core code into _fc_createVertexBinCore so could
05520  *         easily extend to dislaced and subset cases.
05521  */
05522 FC_ReturnCode fc_createMeshVertexBin(
05523   FC_Mesh mesh,           /**< input - mesh handle */
05524   FC_VertexBin** bin_p    /**< output - bin */
05525 ) 
05526 {
05527   FC_ReturnCode rc;
05528   int numDim, numVertex;
05529   double* coords;
05530   FC_Coords lowers, uppers;
05531 
05532   // default output
05533   if (bin_p)
05534     *bin_p = NULL;
05535 
05536   // Check input
05537   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh) || bin_p == NULL) {
05538     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
05539     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
05540   }
05541   
05542   // log message
05543   fc_printfLogMessage("Creating spatial bins for vertices.");  
05544   
05545   // Get info from mesh
05546   rc = fc_getMeshInfo(mesh, NULL, &numDim, &numVertex, NULL, NULL);
05547   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05548     return rc;
05549   rc = fc_getMeshCoordsPtr(mesh, &coords);
05550   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05551     return rc;
05552 
05553   // do it
05554   rc = fc_getMeshBoundingBox(mesh, &numDim, &lowers, &uppers);
05555   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) 
05556     return rc;
05557   rc = _fc_createVertexBinCore(numVertex, numDim, coords, lowers, uppers,
05558                       bin_p);
05559   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05560     return rc;
05561   (*bin_p)->mesh = mesh;
05562   (*bin_p)->displ = FC_NULL_VARIABLE;
05563   (*bin_p)->numDim = numDim;
05564 
05565   return FC_SUCCESS;
05566 }
05567 
05568 /**
05569  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
05570  * \brief Create spatial bins for vertices for geometric queries
05571  *
05572  * \description
05573  * 
05574  *     Create an FC_VertexBin to use for geometric queries.  This version
05575  *     creates bins of the displaced vertices of the mesh. The user is
05576  *     responsible for freeing the created FC_VertexBin by calling
05577  *     fc_freeVertexBin().
05578  *
05579  *     This is a wrapper around _fc_createVertexBinCore() which does all the
05580  *     work.
05581  *   
05582  * \todo Check that this works with 1D & 2D coords
05583  *
05584  * \modifications 
05585  *    - 03/08/04 WSK, created.
05586  *    - 02/20/06 WSD, moved core code into _fc_createVertexBinCore so could
05587  *         easily extend to dislaced and subset cases.
05588  */
05589 FC_ReturnCode fc_createDisplacedMeshVertexBin(
05590   FC_Mesh mesh,          /**< input - mesh handle */
05591   FC_Variable displ,     /**< input - displacement variable */
05592   FC_VertexBin** bin_p   /**< output - bin */
05593 ) 
05594 {
05595   FC_ReturnCode rc;
05596   int numDim, numVertex;
05597   double* coords;
05598   FC_Coords lowers, uppers;
05599 
05600   // default output
05601   if (bin_p)
05602     *bin_p = NULL;
05603 
05604   // Check input
05605   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh) || 
05606       !fc_isValidDisplacementVariable(mesh, displ) || !bin_p) {
05607     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
05608     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
05609   }
05610   
05611   // log message
05612   fc_printfLogMessage("Creating spatial bins for displaced vertices.");  
05613   
05614   // Get info from mesh
05615   rc = fc_getMeshInfo(mesh, NULL, &numDim, &numVertex, NULL, NULL);
05616   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05617     return rc;
05618   rc = fc_getDisplacedMeshCoords(mesh, displ, &coords);
05619   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05620     return rc;
05621 
05622   // do it
05623   rc = fc_getDisplacedMeshBoundingBox(mesh, displ, &numDim, &lowers, &uppers);
05624   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS) 
05625     return rc;
05626   rc = _fc_createVertexBinCore(numVertex, numDim, coords, lowers, uppers,
05627                       bin_p);
05628   free(coords);
05629   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05630     return rc;
05631   (*bin_p)->mesh = mesh;
05632   (*bin_p)->displ = displ;
05633   (*bin_p)->numDim = numDim;
05634 
05635   return FC_SUCCESS;
05636 }
05637 
05638 /**
05639  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
05640  * \brief Clear memory in an FC_VertexBin
05641  *
05642  * \description
05643  * 
05644  *     Releases allocated memory in an FC_VertexBin.
05645  *
05646  * \modifications 
05647  *    - 03/08/04 WSK, created.
05648  */
05649 void fc_freeVertexBin(
05650   FC_VertexBin* bin    /**< input/output - bin */
05651 ) 
05652 {
05653   int i, j, k;
05654 
05655   // Check input
05656   if (bin == NULL)
05657     return;
05658 
05659   // log message
05660   fc_printfLogMessage("Freeing vertex bins.");       
05661 
05662   // Clear dynamically allocated storage
05663   for (i = 0; i < bin->numBins[0]; i++) {
05664     for (j = 0; j < bin->numBins[1]; j++) {
05665       for (k = 0; k < bin->numBins[2]; k++) 
05666         free(bin->vertexIDs[i][j][k]);
05667       free(bin->numVertex[i][j]);
05668       free(bin->vertexIDs[i][j]);
05669     }
05670     free(bin->numVertex[i]);
05671     free(bin->vertexIDs[i]);
05672   }
05673   free(bin->numVertex);
05674   free(bin->vertexIDs);
05675   bin->numVertex = NULL;
05676   bin->vertexIDs = NULL;
05677 
05678   free(bin);
05679 }
05680 
05681 /**
05682  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
05683  * \brief Find all entities within a bounding box.
05684  *
05685  * \description 
05686  *
05687  *     Takes two points describing a bounding box and returns IDs of entities
05688  *     in a mesh that lie completely within the bounding box (and on it's
05689  *     boundary), regardless of the topology the mesh. To use this routine, you
05690  *     must first call fc_createMeshVertexBin or
05691  *     fc_createDisplacedMeshVertexBin to make the vertex bins used for
05692  *     searching
05693  *
05694  *     The returned ID array is created by this routine, but it is the
05695  *     responsibility of the caller to free it.
05696  *
05697  * \todo add argument so user can request entities compeletely within
05698  *     range, or entities that are partially in range.
05699  * \todo Change routines to return a subset instead 
05700  *
05701  * \modifications 
05702  *    - 10/27/04, WSK, Created.
05703  */
05704 FC_ReturnCode fc_getEntitiesWithinBoundingBox(
05705   FC_Mesh mesh,         /**< input - mesh handle */
05706   FC_VertexBin* bin,    /**< input - vertex bin for the mesh */
05707   FC_Coords lowpoint,   /**< input - lower left corner of bounding box */
05708   FC_Coords highpoint,  /**< input - upper left corner of bounding box */
05709   FC_AssociationType assoc, /**< input - type of entity */
05710   int* numEntity,       /**< output - number of entities within sphere */
05711   int **entityIDs       /**< output - array of entity IDs */
05712 )
05713 {
05714   FC_ReturnCode rc;
05715   int numVertex, *vertexIDs;            // number & IDs in sphere
05716 
05717   // default return
05718   if (numEntity)
05719     *numEntity = -1;
05720   if (entityIDs)
05721     *entityIDs = NULL;
05722   
05723   // check input
05724   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh) || !bin || !FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(mesh, bin->mesh) ||
05725       !fc_isBoundingBoxValid(bin->numDim, lowpoint, highpoint) ||
05726       !fc_isAssociationTypeValid(assoc) || assoc == FC_AT_UNKNOWN || 
05727       assoc == FC_AT_WHOLE_DATASET || !numEntity || !entityIDs) {
05728     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
05729     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
05730   }
05731   
05732   // log message
05733   fc_printfLogMessage("Finding entities within a bounding box.");    
05734 
05735   // get the vertices within radius
05736   rc = _fc_getVertexIDsWithinBoundingBoxUsingVertexBin(mesh, bin, lowpoint,
05737                                    highpoint, &numVertex, &vertexIDs);
05738   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05739     return rc;
05740 
05741   // if we asked for vertices, we are done!
05742   if (assoc == FC_AT_VERTEX) {
05743     *numEntity = numVertex;
05744     *entityIDs = vertexIDs;
05745     return FC_SUCCESS;
05746   }
05747 
05748   // convert to requested entity type
05749   rc = fc_changeMeshEntityType(mesh, FC_AT_VERTEX, numVertex, vertexIDs,
05750                       assoc, 1, numEntity, entityIDs);
05751   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05752     return rc;
05753 
05754   // cleanup
05755   free(vertexIDs);
05756 
05757   return FC_SUCCESS;
05758 }
05759 
05760 /**
05761  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
05762  * \brief Find all entities within a sphere.
05763  *
05764  * \description 
05765  *
05766  *     Takes a point and a radius, and returns IDs of entities in a mesh that
05767  *     lie completely within the radius of the point (i.e. the elements whose
05768  *     vertices all fall within the radius of the point), regardless of the
05769  *     topology the mesh. To use this routine, you must first call
05770  *     fc_createMeshVertexBin or fc_createDisplacedMeshVertexBin to make the
05771  *     vertex bins used for searching.
05772  *
05773  *     The returned ID array is created by this routine, but it is the
05774  *     responsibility of the caller to free it.
05775  *
05776  * \todo add argument so user can request entities compeletely within
05777  *     range, or entities that are partially in range.
05778  * \todo Changed routines to return a subset instead 
05779  *
05780  * \modifications 
05781  *    - 10/14/04 WSK, Created to replace
05782  *          fc_getVertexIDsWithinSphereUsingBertexBin and
05783  *          fc_getElementIDsWithinSphereUsingVertexBin with a more general
05784  *          purpose routine.
05785  */
05786 FC_ReturnCode fc_getEntitiesWithinSphere(
05787   FC_Mesh mesh,       /**< input - mesh handle */
05788   FC_VertexBin* bin,  /**< input - vertex bin for the mesh */
05789   FC_Coords center,   /**< input - center of the sphere */
05790   double radius,      /**< input - radius of the sphere */
05791   FC_AssociationType assoc, /**< input - type of entity */
05792   int* numEntity,     /**< output - number of entities within sphere */
05793   int **entityIDs    /**< output - array of entity IDs */
05794 )
05795 {
05796   FC_ReturnCode rc;
05797   int numVertex, *vertexIDs;            // number & IDs in sphere
05798 
05799   // default return
05800   if (numEntity)
05801     *numEntity = -1;
05802   if (entityIDs)
05803     *entityIDs = NULL;
05804   
05805   // check input
05806   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh) || !bin || !FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(mesh, bin->mesh) ||
05807       !center || radius < 0 || !fc_isAssociationTypeValid(assoc) || 
05808       assoc == FC_AT_UNKNOWN || assoc == FC_AT_WHOLE_DATASET || 
05809       !numEntity || !entityIDs) {
05810     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
05811     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
05812   }
05813   
05814   // log message
05815   fc_printfLogMessage("Finding entities within a sphere.");    
05816 
05817   // get the vertices within radius
05818   rc = _fc_getVertexIDsWithinSphereUsingVertexBin(mesh, bin, center,
05819                                    radius, &numVertex, &vertexIDs);
05820   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05821     return rc;
05822 
05823   // if we asked for vertices, we are done!
05824   if (assoc == FC_AT_VERTEX) {
05825     *numEntity = numVertex;
05826     *entityIDs = vertexIDs;
05827     return FC_SUCCESS;
05828   }
05829 
05830   // convert to requested entity type
05831   rc = fc_changeMeshEntityType(mesh, FC_AT_VERTEX, numVertex, vertexIDs,
05832                       assoc, 1, numEntity, entityIDs);
05833   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05834     return rc;
05835 
05836   // cleanup
05837   free(vertexIDs);
05838 
05839   return FC_SUCCESS;
05840 }
05841 
05842 /**
05843  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
05844  * \brief Smooth a variable field
05845  *
05846  * \description
05847  * 
05848  *    This routine creates a "smoothed" version of the original variable where
05849  *    each data point in the smoothed variable is the average of all data
05850  *    points within the given radius of the original data point. It uses the
05851  *    vertex bins created using fc_createMeshVertexBin(). Non-scalar variables
05852  *    are averaged component-wise. (Note that only entities that completely
05853  *    fall within the radius are used for the smoothing.) The smoothed
05854  *    variable will always have data type of double.
05855  *
05856  *    Because the vertex bins are per mesh, if you want to smooth a variable
05857  *    over all meshes, you must provide handles for the variable on all
05858  *    of the meshes and the appropriate vertex bins).
05859  *
05860  * \modifications 
05861  *    - 03/09/04 WSK, Created.
05862  *    - 04/26/04 WSK, added handling for smoothing element associated vars
05863  */
05864 FC_ReturnCode fc_geomSmoothVariable(
05865   int numMesh,         /**< input - the number of meshes the variable is on */
05866   FC_Mesh* meshes,     /**< input - the meshes */ 
05867   FC_VertexBin** bins, /**< input - for each mesh, its vertex bin */
05868   FC_Variable* vars,   /**< input - for each mesh, the variable to smooth */
05869   double radius,       /**< input - the kernel radius */
05870   int doLocalSmooth,   /**< input - if true, only points on local mesh are used for smoothing 
05871                                     if false, points on all meshes are used for smoothing */
05872   FC_Variable** smooth_vars /**< output - the smoothed vars */
05873 ) {
05874   return _fc_geomSmoothCore(numMesh, meshes, 0, NULL, bins, vars,
05875                    radius, doLocalSmooth, smooth_vars);
05876 }
05877 
05878 /**
05879  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
05880  * \brief Smooth a variable field on a displaced mesh
05881  *
05882  * \description 
05883  *
05884  *    This routine creates a "smoothed" version of the original variable where
05885  *    each data point in the smoothed variable is the average of all data
05886  *    points within the given radius of the original data point. It uses the
05887  *    vertex bins created using fc_createDisplacedMeshVertexBin(). Non-scalar variables
05888  *    are averaged component-wise. (Note that only entities that completely
05889  *    fall within the radius are used for the smoothing.) The smoothed
05890  *    variable will always have data type of double.
05891  *
05892  *    Because the vertex bins are per mesh, if you want to smooth a variable
05893  *    over all meshes, you must provide handles for the variable on all
05894  *    of the meshes and the appropriate vertex bins).
05895  *
05896  * \modifications 
05897  *    - 03/09/04 WSK, Created.
05898  *    - 04/26/04 WSK, added handling for smoothing element associated vars
05899  */
05900 FC_ReturnCode fc_displacedGeomSmoothVariable(
05901   int numMesh,         /**< input - the number of meshes the variable is on */
05902   FC_Mesh* meshes,     /**< input - the meshes */ 
05903   FC_Variable* displs, /**< input - for each mesh, the displacement variable */
05904   FC_VertexBin** displBins, /**< input - for each mesh, its displaced vertex 
05905                       bin */
05906   FC_Variable* vars,   /**< input - for each mesh, the variable to smooth */
05907   double radius,       /**< input - the kernel radius */
05908   int doLocalSmooth,       /**< input - flag for whether smoothing is done over one mesh or all */
05909   FC_Variable** smooth_vars /**< output - the smoothed vars */
05910 ) {
05911   return _fc_geomSmoothCore(numMesh, meshes, 1, displs, displBins, vars,
05912                    radius, doLocalSmooth, smooth_vars);
05913 }
05914 
05915 /**
05916  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
05917  * \brief Smooth a sequence variable field
05918  *
05919  * \description 
05920  *    
05921  *    Wrapper that calls fc_geomSmoothVariables() under the hood.
05922  *
05923  * \modifications 
05924  *    - 10/11/04 WSK Created.
05925  */
05926 FC_ReturnCode fc_geomSmoothSeqVariable(
05927   int numMesh,         /**< input - the number of meshes to provide values */
05928   FC_Mesh* meshes,     /**< input - the meshes */ 
05929   FC_VertexBin** bins, /**< input - for each mesh, its vertex bin */
05930   int numStep,         /**< input - the number of steps for each seq variable */
05931   FC_Variable** seqVars, /**< input - for each mesh, the seq vars to smooth */
05932   double radius,       /**< input - the kernel radius */
05933   int doLocalSmooth,       /**< input - flag for whether smoothing is done over one mesh or all */
05934   FC_Variable*** smooth_seq_vars /**< output: the smoothed seq vars */
05935 ) {
05936   FC_ReturnCode rc;
05937   int i, j;
05938   FC_Mesh temp_mesh;
05939   FC_Sequence sequence;
05940   FC_Variable *temp_smooth;
05941   FC_Variable **smooth_vars, *temp_seqVar;
05942   
05943   // default output
05944   if (smooth_seq_vars)
05945     *smooth_seq_vars = NULL;
05946 
05947   if (numMesh < 1 || !meshes || !bins || numStep < 0 || !seqVars ||
05948       radius <= 0. || !smooth_seq_vars) {
05949     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
05950     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
05951   }
05952   for (i = 0; i < numMesh; i++) {
05953     if (!fc_isMeshValid(meshes[i]) || !bins[i] ||
05954         !fc_isSeqVariableValid(numStep, seqVars[i]) ||
05955      fc_isVariableGlobal(seqVars[i][0])) {
05956       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
05957       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
05958     }
05959     fc_getMeshFromVariable(seqVars[i][0], &temp_mesh);
05960     if (!FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(bins[i]->mesh, meshes[i]) || 
05961         !FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(temp_mesh, meshes[i]) ) {
05962       fc_printfErrorMessage("bins or vars do not match meshes");
05963       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
05964     }
05965   }
05966 
05967   // make room for smoothed vars (this will become *smooth_seq_vars)
05968   smooth_vars = (FC_Variable**)malloc(numMesh*sizeof(FC_Variable*));
05969   if (!smooth_vars) {
05970     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
05971     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
05972   }
05973   for (i = 0; i < numMesh; i++) {
05974     smooth_vars[i] = (FC_Variable*)malloc(numStep*sizeof(FC_Variable));
05975     if (!smooth_vars[i]) {
05976       for (j = 0; j < i-1; j++)
05977         free(smooth_vars[j]);
05978       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
05979       return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
05980     }
05981   }
05982 
05983   // smooth each time step (have to rearrange handles going in & out)
05984   for (i = 0; i < numStep; i++) {
05985     FC_Variable temp_vars[numMesh];
05986     for (j = 0; j < numMesh; j++)
05987       temp_vars[j] = seqVars[j][i];
05988     rc = fc_geomSmoothVariable(numMesh, meshes, bins, temp_vars,
05989                                radius, doLocalSmooth, &temp_smooth);
05990     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
05991       return rc;
05992     for (j = 0; j < numMesh; j++)
05993       smooth_vars[j][i] = temp_smooth[j];
05994     free(temp_smooth);
05995   }
05996   
05997   // convert the smoothed vars to seq vars
05998   rc = fc_getSequenceFromSeqVariable(numStep, seqVars[0], &sequence);
05999   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
06000     return rc;
06001   for (i = 0; i < numMesh; i++) {
06002     rc = fc_convertVariablesToSeqVariable(numStep, smooth_vars[i],
06003                                           sequence, NULL, &temp_seqVar);
06004     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
06005       return rc;
06006     free(temp_seqVar);
06007   }
06008 
06009   // our array of basic handles is the same as the array of seqVar handles
06010   *smooth_seq_vars = smooth_vars;
06011 
06012   return FC_SUCCESS;
06013 }
06014 
06015 /**
06016  * \ingroup  GeometricRelations
06017  * \brief Smooth each step of a sequence variable on a displaced mesh.
06018  *
06019  * \description 
06020  *    
06021  *    Wrapper that calls fc_displacedGeomSmoothVariables() under the hood.
06022  *    NOTE that unlike fc_geomSmoothSeqVariable, one has to input an
06023  *    array of displaced vertex bins for each step of the seqVariable.
06024  *
06025  * \modifications 
06026  *    - 2/28/06 WSD Created.
06027  */
06028 FC_ReturnCode fc_displacedGeomSmoothSeqVariable(
06029   int numMesh,         /**< input - the number of meshes to provide values */
06030   FC_Mesh* meshes,     /**< input - the meshes */ 
06031   int numStep1,        /**< input - the number of steps for each displ variable */
06032   FC_Variable** seqDispls, /**< input - for each mesh, the displ seq var */
06033   FC_VertexBin*** displBins, /**< input - for each mesh, its displaced vertex 
06034                     bins */
06035   int numStep2,        /**< input - the number of steps for each seq variable */
06036   FC_Variable** seqVars, /**< input - for each mesh, the seq vars to smooth */
06037   double radius,       /**< input - the kernel radius */
06038   int doLocalSmooth,       /**< input - flag for whether smoothing is done over one mesh or all */
06039   FC_Variable*** smooth_seq_vars /**< output: the smoothed seq vars */
06040 ) {
06041   FC_ReturnCode rc;
06042   int i, j;
06043   FC_Mesh temp_mesh;
06044   FC_Sequence sequence;
06045   FC_Variable *temp_smooth;
06046   FC_Variable **smooth_vars, *temp_seqVar;
06047   
06048   // default output
06049   if (smooth_seq_vars)
06050     *smooth_seq_vars = NULL;
06051 
06052   if (numMesh < 1 || !meshes || numStep1 < 0 || !seqDispls || !displBins || 
06053       numStep2 < 0 || numStep2 != numStep1 || !seqVars || radius <= 0. || 
06054       !smooth_seq_vars) {
06055     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
06056     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
06057   }
06058   for (i = 0; i < numMesh; i++) {
06059     if (!fc_isMeshValid(meshes[i]) || 
06060      !fc_isSeqVariableValid(numStep1, seqDispls[i]) || !displBins[i] ||
06061         !fc_isSeqVariableValid(numStep2, seqVars[i]) ||
06062      fc_isVariableGlobal(seqVars[i][0])) {
06063       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
06064       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
06065     }
06066     for (j = 0; j < numStep1; j++) {
06067       if (!displBins[i][j] || !FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(displBins[i][j]->mesh, meshes[i]) || 
06068        !fc_isValidDisplacementVariable(meshes[i], seqDispls[i][j])) {
06069      fc_printfErrorMessage("bad bin or not a valid displ var");
06070      return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
06071       }
06072     }
06073     fc_getMeshFromVariable(seqVars[i][0], &temp_mesh);
06074     if (!FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(temp_mesh, meshes[i])) {
06075       fc_printfErrorMessage("vars do not match meshes");
06076       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
06077     }
06078   }
06079 
06080   // make room for smoothed vars (this will become *smooth_seq_vars)
06081   smooth_vars = (FC_Variable**)malloc(numMesh*sizeof(FC_Variable*));
06082   if (!smooth_vars) {
06083     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
06084     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
06085   }
06086   for (i = 0; i < numMesh; i++) {
06087     smooth_vars[i] = (FC_Variable*)malloc(numStep1*sizeof(FC_Variable));
06088     if (!smooth_vars[i]) {
06089       for (j = 0; j < i-1; j++)
06090         free(smooth_vars[j]);
06091       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
06092       return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
06093     }
06094   }
06095 
06096   // smooth each time step (have to rearrange handles going in & out)
06097   for (i = 0; i < numStep1; i++) {
06098     FC_Variable temp_displs[numMesh];
06099     FC_Variable temp_vars[numMesh];
06100     FC_VertexBin* temp_bins[numMesh];
06101     for (j = 0; j < numMesh; j++) {
06102       temp_displs[j] = seqDispls[j][i];
06103       temp_vars[j] = seqVars[j][i];
06104       temp_bins[j] = displBins[j][i];
06105     }
06106     rc = fc_displacedGeomSmoothVariable(numMesh, meshes, temp_displs, temp_bins,
06107                          temp_vars, radius, doLocalSmooth, &temp_smooth);
06108     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
06109       return rc;
06110     for (j = 0; j < numMesh; j++)
06111       smooth_vars[j][i] = temp_smooth[j];
06112     free(temp_smooth);
06113   }
06114   
06115   // convert the smoothed vars to seq vars
06116   rc = fc_getSequenceFromSeqVariable(numStep1, seqVars[0], &sequence);
06117   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
06118     return rc;
06119   for (i = 0; i < numMesh; i++) {
06120     rc = fc_convertVariablesToSeqVariable(numStep1, smooth_vars[i],
06121                                           sequence, NULL, &temp_seqVar);
06122     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
06123       return rc;
06124     free(temp_seqVar);
06125   }
06126 
06127   // our array of basic handles is the same as the array of seqVar handles
06128   *smooth_seq_vars = smooth_vars;
06129 
06130   return FC_SUCCESS;
06131 }
06132 
06133 //@}
06134 
06135 /** \name Range query helpers */
06136 //-------------------------------
06137 //@{
06138 
06139 /**
06140  * \ingroup  PrivateGeometricRelations
06141  * \brief Create spatial bins for vertices for geometric queries
06142  *
06143  * \description
06144  * 
06145  *     Create an FC_VertexBin to use for geometric queries.
06146  *     The user is responsible for freeing the created FC_VertexBin
06147  *     by calling fc_freeVertexBin().
06148  *
06149  *     The algorithm attempts to create bins of roughly equal width
06150  *     in each dimension, and that hold on average about 1 vertex each.
06151  *     Given the Widths of the bounding box of the mesh (Wx,Wy,Wz)
06152  *     and the number of vertices (numVertex) and our requirement
06153  *     of one vertex per bin we can write a conservation of vertices:
06154  *
06155  *     Wx * Wy * Wz ~ (Wbin)^3 * numVertex
06156  *
06157  *     where Wbin is the bin width for each dimension. However, the bin
06158  *     widths are restricted so that the number of bins in the
06159  *     bounding box of the mesh is an integer. Given that 
06160  * 
06161  *     Wbin-x * nx = Wx
06162  *
06163  *     We first choose nx (number of bins in x direction) as
06164  *
06165  *     nx = (truncate to int) Wx * cubic_root(numVertex / (Wx*Wy*Wz))
06166  *     
06167  *     (except if nx < 1, then nx = 1) and then calculate the actual bin 
06168  *     width
06169  *
06170  *     Wbin-x = Wx / nx
06171  *
06172  *     And repeat for z and y.
06173  *
06174  * \todo - Check that this works with 2D coords
06175  *
06176  * \modifications 
06177  *    - 03/08/04 WSK, created.
06178  */
06179 FC_ReturnCode _fc_createVertexBinCore(
06180   int numVertex, /**< input - number of verts to go into the vertex bin */
06181   //  int* vertIDs,     /**< input - dimensionsality of * coords */
06182   int numDim,           /**< input - dimensionsality of * coords */
06183   double* coords,       /**< input - coords of vertices */
06184   FC_Coords lowers,     /**< input - the bounding box of the point set */
06185   FC_Coords uppers,     /**< input - the bounding box of the point set */
06186   FC_VertexBin** bin_p  /**< output - bin */
06187 ) 
06188 {
06189   //FC_ReturnCode rc;
06190   int i, j, I, J, K;
06191   double volume, density;   // number of points per unit volume, but cube root
06192   int icoords[3] = { 0, 0, 0 };          // i j k coords of a bin
06193   void* temp;
06194   FC_VertexBin* bin;
06195 
06196   // default output
06197   if (bin_p)
06198     *bin_p = NULL;
06199 
06200   // Check input
06201   if (bin_p == NULL) {
06202     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
06203     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
06204   }
06205   
06206   // log message
06207   fc_printfLogMessage("Creating spatial bins for vertices.");
06208 
06209   // Setup basics
06210   bin = calloc(1, sizeof(FC_VertexBin));
06211   if (bin == NULL) {
06212     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
06213     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
06214   }
06215   for (i = 0; i < numDim; i++) {
06216     bin->lowerCoords[i] = lowers[i];
06217     bin->upperCoords[i] = uppers[i];
06218     bin->widths[i] = bin->upperCoords[i] - bin->lowerCoords[i];
06219   }
06220 
06221   // determine number of bins (at least 1 bin in each dimension)
06222   volume = 1;
06223   for (i = 0; i < numDim; i++)
06224     volume *= bin->widths[i];
06225   density = pow(numVertex/volume, 1./3.);
06226   for (i = 0; i < numDim; i++) {
06227     bin->numBins[i] = (int)(bin->widths[i]*density); // truncate
06228     if (bin->numBins[i] < 1) {
06229       bin->numBins[i] = 1;
06230       bin->binWidths[i] = bin->widths[i];
06231     }
06232     else
06233       bin->binWidths[i] = bin->widths[i]/bin->numBins[i];
06234   }
06235 
06236   // make space for bins
06237   bin->numVertex = malloc(bin->numBins[0]*sizeof(int**));
06238   bin->vertexIDs = malloc(bin->numBins[0]*sizeof(int***));
06239   if ( bin->numVertex == NULL ||  bin->vertexIDs == NULL) {
06240     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
06241     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
06242   } 
06243   for (i = 0; i < bin->numBins[0]; i++) {
06244     bin->numVertex[i] = malloc(bin->numBins[1]*sizeof(int*));
06245     bin->vertexIDs[i] = malloc(bin->numBins[1]*sizeof(int**));
06246     if ( bin->numVertex[i] == NULL ||  bin->vertexIDs[i] == NULL) {
06247       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
06248       return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
06249     } 
06250     for (j = 0; j < bin->numBins[1]; j++) {
06251       bin->numVertex[i][j] = calloc(bin->numBins[2], sizeof(int));
06252       bin->vertexIDs[i][j] = calloc(bin->numBins[2], sizeof(int*));
06253       if ( bin->numVertex[i][j] == NULL ||  bin->vertexIDs[i][j] == NULL) {
06254         fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
06255         return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
06256       } 
06257     }
06258   }
06259 
06260   // Put vertices in the bins
06261   // Usually cells on boundaries of bins land in next bin up
06262   // (except for highest bin)
06263   for (i = 0; i < numVertex; i++) {
06264     for (j = 0; j < numDim; j++) { 
06265       icoords[j] = (int) ((coords[i*numDim+j] - bin->lowerCoords[j]) / 
06266         bin->binWidths[j]);
06267       // check boundaries
06268       if (icoords[j] < 0)
06269         icoords[j] = 0;
06270       else if (icoords[j] == bin->numBins[j])
06271         icoords[j] = bin->numBins[j] - 1;
06272     }
06273     for (j = numDim; j < 3; j++)
06274       icoords[j] = 0;
06275     I = icoords[0];
06276     J = icoords[1];
06277     K = icoords[2];
06278     temp = realloc(bin->vertexIDs[I][J][K], 
06279                    (1 + bin->numVertex[I][J][K])*sizeof(int));
06280     if (temp == NULL) {
06281       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
06282       return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
06283     }
06284     bin->vertexIDs[I][J][K] = temp;
06285     bin->vertexIDs[I][J][K][bin->numVertex[I][J][K]] = i;
06286     bin->numVertex[I][J][K]++;
06287   }
06288   
06289   *bin_p = bin;
06290   return FC_SUCCESS;
06291 }
06292 
06293 /**
06294  * \ingroup  PrivateGeometricRelations
06295  * \brief Find all vertices within a bounding box
06296  *
06297  * \description
06298  * 
06299  *     Takes two points describing a bounding box and returns the IDs of all 
06300  *     vertices which are within the bounding box (including those on its
06301  *     boundary), regardless of the connectivity information in the mesh. 
06302  *     To use this routine, you must first call fc_createMeshVertexBin to make the 
06303  *     vertex bins used for searching.
06304  *
06305  *     The returned ID array is created by this routine, but it is the
06306  *     responsibility of the caller to free it.
06307  *
06308  * \modifications 
06309  *    - 10/27/04 WSK, Created.
06310  *    - 2/21/04 WSD can now handle displaced mesh
06311  */
06312 FC_ReturnCode _fc_getVertexIDsWithinBoundingBoxUsingVertexBin(
06313   FC_Mesh mesh,         /**< input - mesh handle */
06314   FC_VertexBin* bin,    /**< input - vertex bin for mesh */
06315   FC_Coords lowpoint,   /**< input - lower corner of bb */
06316   FC_Coords highpoint,  /**< input - upper corner of bb */
06317   int* numVertex_p,     /**< output - number of vertices within radius */
06318   int **vertexIDs_p     /**< output - array of vertex IDs */
06319 ) 
06320 {
06321   FC_ReturnCode rc;
06322   int i, j, k, m, n;
06323   int numVert, maxNumVert, *vertIDs, *temp;
06324   int lowerICoords[3] = { 0, 0, 0 };
06325   int upperICoords[3] = { 0, 0, 0 };
06326   double lower, upper;
06327   int intersects = 1; // true;
06328   double* coords;
06329   int do_displ;
06330 
06331   // default return
06332   if (numVertex_p)
06333     *numVertex_p = -1;
06334   if (vertexIDs_p)
06335     *vertexIDs_p = NULL;
06336   
06337   // check input
06338   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh) || !bin || !FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(mesh, bin->mesh) || 
06339       !fc_isBoundingBoxValid(bin->numDim, lowpoint, highpoint) || 
06340       !numVertex_p || !vertexIDs_p) {
06341     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
06342     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
06343   }
06344 
06345   // log message
06346   fc_printfLogMessage("Finding vertices within given bounding box.");  
06347   
06348   // determine i,j,k bounding box for bins = intersection with bounding box
06349   for (i = 0; i < bin->numDim; i++) {
06350     lower = lowpoint[i];
06351     upper = highpoint[i];
06352     // special case - no intersection
06353     if (lower > bin->upperCoords[i] || upper < bin->lowerCoords[i]) {
06354       intersects = 0; // false
06355       break;
06356     }
06357     else {
06358       lowerICoords[i] = (int) ((lower - bin->lowerCoords[i])/bin->binWidths[i]);
06359       upperICoords[i] = (int) ((upper - bin->lowerCoords[i])/bin->binWidths[i]);
06360       if (lowerICoords[i] < 0)
06361         lowerICoords[i] = 0;
06362       else if (lowerICoords[i] >= bin->numBins[i])
06363         lowerICoords[i] = bin->numBins[i] - 1;
06364       if (upperICoords[i] < 0)
06365         upperICoords[i] = 0;
06366       else if (upperICoords[i] >= bin->numBins[i])
06367         upperICoords[i] = bin->numBins[i] - 1;
06368     }
06369   }
06370 
06371   // early return
06372   if (intersects == 0) {
06373     *numVertex_p = 0;
06374     return FC_SUCCESS; 
06375   }
06376 
06377   // Setup
06378   if (fc_isVariableValid(bin->displ)) {
06379     do_displ = 1;
06380     rc = fc_getDisplacedMeshCoords(mesh, bin->displ, &coords);
06381   }
06382   else {
06383     do_displ = 0;
06384     rc = fc_getMeshCoordsPtr(mesh, &coords);
06385   }
06386   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
06387     return rc;
06388   numVert = 0;
06389   maxNumVert = 0;
06390   vertIDs = NULL;
06391 
06392   // just check vertices in bins in i,j,k bounding box
06393   for (i = lowerICoords[0]; i <= upperICoords[0]; i++) {
06394     for (j = lowerICoords[1]; j <= upperICoords[1]; j++) {
06395       for (k = lowerICoords[2]; k <= upperICoords[2]; k++) {
06396         for (m = 0; m < bin->numVertex[i][j][k]; m++) {
06397        int vertID = bin->vertexIDs[i][j][k][m];
06398        intersects = 1;
06399           for (n = 0; n < bin->numDim; n++) {
06400          if (coords[vertID*bin->numDim+n] < lowpoint[n] ||
06401           coords[vertID*bin->numDim+n] > highpoint[n]) {
06402            intersects = 0;
06403            break;
06404          }
06405        }
06406           if (intersects) {
06407          if (numVert == maxNumVert) {
06408            if (maxNumVert == 0)
06409           maxNumVert = 2;
06410            else
06411           maxNumVert *= 2;
06412            temp = realloc(vertIDs, maxNumVert*sizeof(int));
06413            if (!temp) {
06414           free(vertIDs);
06415           fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
06416           return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
06417            }
06418            vertIDs = temp;
06419          }
06420             vertIDs[numVert] = bin->vertexIDs[i][j][k][m];
06421             numVert++;
06422           }
06423         }
06424       }
06425     }
06426   }
06427   if (do_displ)
06428     free(coords);
06429 
06430   // organize results
06431   if (numVert > 0) 
06432     fc_sortIntArray(numVert, vertIDs);
06433   *numVertex_p = numVert;
06434   *vertexIDs_p = vertIDs;
06435 
06436   return FC_SUCCESS;
06437 }
06438 
06439 /**
06440  * \ingroup  PrivateGeometricRelations
06441  * \brief Find all vertices within a given radius of a point.
06442  *
06443  * \description
06444  * 
06445  *     Takes a point and a radius, and returns the IDs of all vertices
06446  *     which are within the described sphere, regardless of the element
06447  *     (connectivity) information in the mesh. To use this routine,
06448  *     you must first call fc_createMeshVertexBin to make the vertex
06449  *     bins used for searching.
06450  *
06451  *     The returned ID array is created by this routine, but it is the
06452  *     responsibility of the caller to free it.
06453  *
06454  *     This routine will produce the same results as
06455  *     fc_markGeomNeighbors. It should be used when you plan to
06456  *     perform multiple queries.
06457  *
06458  * \modifications 
06459  *    - 03/09/04 WSK, Created.
06460  *    - 06/30/04 WSK Changed interface to return int array. 
06461  */
06462 FC_ReturnCode _fc_getVertexIDsWithinSphereUsingVertexBin(
06463   FC_Mesh mesh,       /**< input - mesh handle */
06464   FC_VertexBin* bin,  /**< input - vertex bins */
06465   FC_Coords center,   /**< input - center of sphere */
06466   double radius,      /**< input - radius of sphere */
06467   int* numVertex_p,   /**< output - number of vertices within radius */
06468   int **vertexIDs_p   /**< output - array of vertex IDs */
06469 ) 
06470 {
06471   FC_ReturnCode rc;
06472   int i, j, k, m, n;
06473   int numVert, maxNumVert, *vertIDs, *temp;
06474   double r2, t2, d;
06475   int lowerICoords[3] = { 0, 0, 0 };
06476   int upperICoords[3] = { 0, 0, 0 };
06477   double lower, upper;
06478   int intersects = 1; // true;
06479   double* coords;
06480   int do_displ;
06481 
06482   // default return
06483   if (numVertex_p)
06484     *numVertex_p = -1;
06485   if (vertexIDs_p)
06486     *vertexIDs_p = NULL;
06487
