06488   // check input
06489   if (!fc_isMeshValid(mesh) || !bin || !FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(mesh, bin->mesh) || 
06490       !center || radius < 0. || !numVertex_p || !vertexIDs_p) {
06491     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
06492     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
06493   }
06494 
06495   // log message
06496   fc_printfLogMessage("Finding vertices within a sphere");  
06497   
06498   // algorithm - Most efficient algorithm would only need to search bins
06499   // that intersect boundary of the sphere - do not take  vertices from bins
06500   // completely outside of sphere and take all vertices from bins completely
06501   // inside of sphere. But determining intersection of sphere with the bins
06502   // is difficult. So instead, here we search all bins that intersect or
06503   // are within the bounding box of the sphere. 
06504 
06505   // determine i,j,k bounding box for bins = intersection with sphere's bounding box
06506   for (i = 0; i < bin->numDim; i++) {
06507     lower = center[i] - radius;
06508     upper = center[i] + radius;
06509     // special case - no intersection
06510     if (lower > bin->upperCoords[i] || upper < bin->lowerCoords[i]) {
06511       intersects = 0; // false
06512       break;
06513     }
06514     else {
06515       lowerICoords[i] = (int) ((lower - bin->lowerCoords[i])/bin->binWidths[i]);
06516       upperICoords[i] = (int) ((upper - bin->lowerCoords[i])/bin->binWidths[i]);
06517       if (lowerICoords[i] < 0)
06518         lowerICoords[i] = 0;
06519       else if (lowerICoords[i] >= bin->numBins[i])
06520         lowerICoords[i] = bin->numBins[i] - 1;
06521       if (upperICoords[i] < 0)
06522         upperICoords[i] = 0;
06523       else if (upperICoords[i] >= bin->numBins[i])
06524         upperICoords[i] = bin->numBins[i] - 1;
06525     }
06526   }
06527 
06528   // early return
06529   if (intersects == 0) {
06530     *numVertex_p = 0;
06531     return FC_SUCCESS; 
06532   }
06533 
06534   // Setup
06535   if (fc_isVariableValid(bin->displ)) {
06536     do_displ = 1;
06537     rc = fc_getDisplacedMeshCoords(mesh, bin->displ, &coords);
06538   }
06539   else {
06540     do_displ = 0;
06541     rc = fc_getMeshCoordsPtr(mesh, &coords);
06542   }
06543   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
06544     return rc;
06545   numVert = 0;
06546   maxNumVert = 0;
06547   vertIDs = NULL;
06548 
06549   // just check vertices in bins in i,j,k bounding box
06550   r2 = radius * radius; 
06551   for (i = lowerICoords[0]; i <= upperICoords[0]; i++) {
06552     for (j = lowerICoords[1]; j <= upperICoords[1]; j++) {
06553       for (k = lowerICoords[2]; k <= upperICoords[2]; k++) {
06554         for (m = 0; m < bin->numVertex[i][j][k]; m++) {
06555           t2 = 0;
06556           for (n = 0; n < bin->numDim; n++) {
06557             d = center[n] - coords[bin->vertexIDs[i][j][k][m]*bin->numDim+n];
06558             t2 += d * d;
06559           }
06560           if (t2 <= r2) {
06561          if (numVert == maxNumVert) {
06562            if (maxNumVert == 0)
06563           maxNumVert = 2;
06564            else
06565           maxNumVert *= 2;
06566            temp = realloc(vertIDs, maxNumVert*sizeof(int));
06567            if (!temp) {
06568           free(vertIDs);
06569           fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
06570           return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
06571            }
06572            vertIDs = temp;
06573          }
06574             vertIDs[numVert] = bin->vertexIDs[i][j][k][m];
06575             numVert++;
06576           }
06577         }
06578       }
06579     }
06580   }
06581   if (do_displ)
06582     free(coords);
06583 
06584   // organize results
06585   if (numVert > 0)
06586     fc_sortIntArray(numVert, vertIDs);
06587   *numVertex_p = numVert;
06588   *vertexIDs_p = vertIDs;
06589 
06590   return FC_SUCCESS;
06591 }
06592 
06593 /**
06594  * \ingroup  PrivateGeometricRelations
06595  * \brief Smooth a variable field
06596  *
06597  * \description
06598  * 
06599  *    This routine creates a "smoothed" version of the original variable where
06600  *    each data point in the smoothed variable is the average of all data
06601  *    points within the given radius of the original data point. It uses the
06602  *    vertex bins created using fc_createMeshVertexBin(). Non-scalar variables
06603  *    are averaged component-wise. (Note that only entities that completely
06604  *    fall within the radius are used for the smoothing.) The smoothed
06605  *    variable will always have data type of double.
06606  *
06607  *    Because the vertex bins are per mesh, if you want to smooth a variable
06608  *    over all meshes, you must provide handles for the variable on all
06609  *    of the meshes and the appropriate vertex bins).
06610  *
06611  * \modifications 
06612  *    - 03/09/04 WSK, Created.
06613  *    - 04/26/04 WSK, added handling for smoothing element associated vars
06614  */
06615 FC_ReturnCode _fc_geomSmoothCore(
06616   int numMesh,         /**< input - the number of meshes the variable is on */
06617   FC_Mesh* meshes,     /**< input - the meshes */ 
06618   int doDispl,         /**< input - flag for whether to do displacment */
06619   FC_Variable* displs, /**< input - for each mesh, the displacement variable */
06620   FC_VertexBin** bins, /**< input - for each mesh, its vertex bin */
06621   FC_Variable* vars,   /**< input - for each mesh, the variable to smooth */
06622   double radius,       /**< input - the kernel radius */
06623   int doLocalSmooth,       /**< input - flag for whether smoothing is done over one mesh or all */
06624   FC_Variable** smooth_vars /**< output - the smoothed vars */
06625 ) {
06626   FC_ReturnCode rc;
06627   int i, j, k, m, n;
06628   char* var_name, *temp_name;
06629   int dim, numComponent, temp_dim, temp_numComponent;
06630   int numDataPoints[numMesh];
06631   FC_Mesh temp_mesh;
06632   FC_AssociationType assoc, temp_assoc;
06633   FC_MathType mathtype, temp_mathtype;
06634   FC_DataType datatype, temp_datatype;
06635   int numID, *ids;
06636   double* coords[numMesh];
06637   int maxNumVertPerFace[numMesh], *numVertPerFaces[numMesh];
06638   int* edgeConns[numMesh], *faceConns[numMesh], *elemConns[numMesh];
06639   int num;
06640   double *sums;
06641   void *old_datas[numMesh];
06642   double *new_datas[numMesh];
06643 
06644   // default output
06645   if (smooth_vars)
06646     *smooth_vars = NULL;
06647 
06648   // check input
06649   if (numMesh < 1 || !meshes || (doDispl && !displs) || !bins || !vars || 
06650       radius <= 0. ||  !smooth_vars) {
06651     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
06652     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
06653   }
06654   for (i = 0; i < numMesh; i++) {
06655     if (doDispl && !fc_isValidDisplacementVariable(meshes[i], displs[i])) {
06656       fc_printfErrorMessage("displ[%d] is not a valid displ var", i);
06657       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
06658     }
06659     fc_getMeshFromVariable(vars[i], &temp_mesh);
06660     if (!fc_isMeshValid(meshes[i]) || !bins[i] || 
06661      !fc_isVariableValid(vars[i]) || 
06662      !FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(temp_mesh, bins[i]->mesh) || 
06663         !FC_HANDLE_EQUIV(temp_mesh, meshes[i]) ) {
06664       fc_printfErrorMessage("bins or vars do not match meshes");
06665       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
06666     }
06667   }
06668   
06669   // log message
06670   if (doDispl) {
06671     fc_printfLogMessage("Smoothing a variable on displaced meshes");
06672   }
06673   else {
06674     fc_printfLogMessage("Smoothing a variable.");
06675   }
06676   
06677   // get info & more checking
06678   rc = fc_getMeshDim(meshes[0], &dim);
06679   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
06680     return rc;
06681   rc = fc_getVariableInfo(vars[0], &numDataPoints[0], &numComponent,
06682                           &assoc, &mathtype, &datatype);
06683   if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
06684     return rc;
06685   if (datatype == FC_DT_CHAR) {
06686     fc_printfErrorMessage("Can't handle FC_DT_CHAR data");
06687     return FC_ERROR;
06688   }
06689   // All variables must have same dim, numComponent, assoc, mathtype, datatype
06690   for (i = 1; i < numMesh; i++) {
06691     fc_getMeshDim(meshes[i], &temp_dim);
06692     fc_getVariableInfo(vars[i], &numDataPoints[i], &temp_numComponent,
06693                        &temp_assoc, &temp_mathtype, &temp_datatype);
06694     if (temp_dim != dim || temp_numComponent != numComponent ||
06695         temp_assoc != assoc || temp_mathtype != mathtype ||
06696         temp_datatype != datatype) {
06697       fc_printfErrorMessage("Variables do not match");
06698       return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
06699     }
06700   }
06701   
06702   // For each mesh, get coords & variable data, make room for new data
06703   for (i = 0; i < numMesh; i++) {
06704     if (doDispl) 
06705       rc = fc_getDisplacedMeshCoords(meshes[i], displs[i], &coords[i]);
06706     else
06707       rc = fc_getMeshCoordsPtr(meshes[i], &coords[i]);
06708     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
06709       return rc;
06710     if (assoc == FC_AT_EDGE)
06711       fc_getMeshEdgeConnsPtr(meshes[i], &edgeConns[i]);
06712     else if (assoc == FC_AT_FACE)
06713       fc_getMeshFaceConnsPtr(meshes[i], &numVertPerFaces[i],
06714                     &maxNumVertPerFace[i], &faceConns[i]);
06715     else if (assoc == FC_AT_ELEMENT)
06716       fc_getMeshElementConnsPtr(meshes[i], &elemConns[i]);
06717     fc_getVariableDataPtr(vars[i], &old_datas[i]);
06718     new_datas[i] = (double*)malloc(sizeof(double)*
06719                                    numDataPoints[i]*numComponent);
06720     if (new_datas[i] == NULL) {
06721       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
06722       return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
06723     }
06724   }
06725 
06726   // for each data point 
06727   // 1) find center
06728   // 2) find all other points on all meshes that fall within radius 
06729   //   ( 2A) make sure have current point)
06730   // 3) sum all contributions & divide by number of data points
06731   sums = (double*)malloc(sizeof(double)*numComponent);
06732   if (sums == NULL)  {
06733     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
06734     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
06735   }
06736   for (i = 0; i < numMesh; i++) {
06737     for (j = 0; j < numDataPoints[i]; j++) {
06738       FC_Coords center;
06739 
06740       // Find center
06741       if (assoc == FC_AT_VERTEX) {
06742         for (k = 0; k < dim; k++)
06743           center[k] = coords[i][j*dim + k];
06744       }
06745       else if (assoc == FC_AT_WHOLE_MESH) {
06746         int numVert;
06747         fc_getMeshNumVertex(meshes[i], &numVert);
06748         for (k = 0; k < dim; k++)
06749           center[k] = 0;
06750         for (k = 0; k < numVert; k++)
06751           for (m = 0; m < dim; m++)
06752             center[m] += coords[i][k*dim + m];
06753         for (k = 0; k < dim; k++) 
06754           center[k] /= numVert;
06755       }
06756       else {
06757         // Centroid of this edge, face or element
06758         int numVert, *vertIDs;
06759         if (assoc == FC_AT_EDGE) {
06760           numVert = 2;
06761           vertIDs = &edgeConns[i][j*2];
06762         }
06763         else if (assoc == FC_AT_FACE) {
06764           numVert = numVertPerFaces[i][j];
06765           vertIDs = &faceConns[i][j*maxNumVertPerFace[i]];
06766         }
06767         else if (assoc == FC_AT_ELEMENT) {
06768        FC_ElementType elemType;
06769        fc_getMeshElementType(meshes[i], &elemType);
06770           numVert = fc_getElementTypeNumVertex(elemType);
06771           vertIDs = &elemConns[i][j*numVert];
06772         }
06773         for (k = 0; k < dim; k++)
06774           center[k] = 0;
06775         for (k = 0; k < numVert; k++)
06776           for (m = 0; m < dim; m++)
06777             center[m] += coords[i][vertIDs[k]*dim + m];
06778         for (k = 0; k < dim; k++) 
06779           center[k] /= numVert;
06780       }
06781  
06782       // find geometric neighbors on each mesh & add their values
06783       num = 0;
06784       for (k = 0; k < numComponent; k++)
06785         sums[k] = 0;
06786       for (k = (doLocalSmooth?i:0); k < (doLocalSmooth?i+1:numMesh); k++) {
06787         rc = fc_getEntitiesWithinSphere(meshes[k], bins[k], center, radius, 
06788                                         assoc, &numID, &ids);
06789         if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
06790           return rc;
06791 
06792         // make sure we include the current entity
06793         if (k == i) {
06794           int found = 0;
06795           for (m = 0; m < numID; m++) {
06796             if (ids[m] == j) {
06797               found = 1;
06798               break;
06799             }
06800           }
06801           if (!found) {
06802             int* temp = realloc(ids, (numID+1)*sizeof(int));
06803             if (!temp) {
06804               fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
06805               return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
06806             }
06807             ids = temp;
06808             ids[numID] = j;
06809             numID++;
06810           }
06811         }
06812 
06813         // add to our cumulative sums
06814         for (m = 0; m < numID; m++) {
06815           for (n = 0; n < numComponent; n++) {
06816             switch(datatype) {
06817             case FC_DT_INT:
06818               sums[n] += ((int*)(old_datas[k]))[ids[m]*numComponent+n];
06819               break;
06820             case FC_DT_FLOAT:
06821               sums[n] += ((float*)(old_datas[k]))[ids[m]*numComponent+n];
06822               break;
06823             case FC_DT_DOUBLE:
06824               sums[n] += ((double*)(old_datas[k]))[ids[m]*numComponent+n];
06825               break;
06826             default:
06827               return FC_ERROR;
06828             }
06829           }
06830           num++;
06831         }
06832         free(ids);
06833       }
06834       for (k = 0; k < numComponent; k++)
06835         new_datas[i][j*numComponent+k] = sums[k]/num;
06836     }
06837   }
06838   free(sums);
06839   if (doDispl) {
06840     for (i = 0; i < numMesh; i++)
06841       free(coords[i]);
06842   }
06843 
06844   // create new vars
06845   *smooth_vars = (FC_Variable*)malloc(numMesh*sizeof(FC_Variable));
06846   if (*smooth_vars == NULL) {
06847     fc_printfErrorMessage("memory allocation error");
06848     return FC_MEMORY_ERROR;
06849   }
06850   for (i = 0; i < numMesh; i++) {
06851     rc = fc_getVariableName(vars[i], &var_name);
06852     temp_name = (char*)malloc((strlen(var_name) + 10)*sizeof(char));
06853     sprintf(temp_name, "%s_smoothed", var_name);
06854     free(var_name);
06855     rc = fc_createVariable(meshes[i], temp_name, &(*smooth_vars)[i]);
06856     free(temp_name);
06857     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
06858       return rc;
06859     rc = fc_setVariableDataPtr((*smooth_vars)[i], numDataPoints[i], 
06860                numComponent, assoc, mathtype, FC_DT_DOUBLE, new_datas[i]);
06861     if (rc != FC_SUCCESS)
06862       return rc;
06863     // don't free new_datas[i]
06864   }
06865   
06866   return FC_SUCCESS;
06867 }
06868 
06869 //@}
06870 
06871 /** \name Normals helpers */
06872 //-------------------------------
06873 //@{
06874 
06875 /**
06876  * \ingroup  PrivateGeometricRelations
06877  * \brief  Compute unit normal of surface
06878  *
06879  * \description
06880  *
06881  *    This function implements Newell's method of calculating the normal of
06882  *    a planar polygon. It has the advantage of providing a decent estimate
06883  *    of a normal if the polygon is not planar.
06884  *
06885  *    Order of the points is important. Looking down on the plane,
06886  *    a counterclockwise traversal of the three points will yield
06887  *    a normal pointing up towards the viewer.
06888  *
06889  *    This routine currently assumes 3D coordinates. If you are less
06890  *    than 3D, pad with zeros. This can't do more than 3D.
06891  *
06892  *    Reference for Newell's method: Hill, Francis S, "Computer Graphics", 
06893  *    Prentice Hall, 1990, pg 258.
06894  *
06895  * \modifications  
06896  *    - 2003-SEP-04  W Koegler  Created: _fc_SurfaceNormal was split between
06897  *      this function and fc_getSurfaceNormals for better modularity.
06898  *    - 11/3/04 WSK Renamed & rewritten to use Newell's method (so will
06899  *      find estimate of surface normal of non-planar quads).
06900  */
06901 void _fc_calcSurfaceNormal(
06902   int numPoint,       /**< input - number of points (at least 3) */
06903   FC_Coords *coords,  /**< input - array of point coordinates (at least 3) */
06904   FC_Vector *normal   /**< output - surface normal */
06905 ) {
06906   int i;
06907   double *point1, *point2; // temp pointers to points
06908   FC_Coords temp_norm;
06909   double magnitude;
06910  
06911   // log message
06912   fc_printfLogMessage("Computing a normal vector.");   
06913  
06914   // init 
06915   temp_norm[0] = 0.;
06916   temp_norm[1] = 0.;
06917   temp_norm[2] = 0.;
06918 
06919   // Newell method
06920   for (i = 0; i < numPoint; i++) {
06921     point1 = coords[i];
06922     if (i == numPoint - 1)
06923       point2 = coords[0];
06924     else
06925       point2 = coords[i+1];
06926     temp_norm[0] += (point1[1] - point2[1])*(point1[2] + point2[2]);  
06927     temp_norm[1] += (point1[2] - point2[2])*(point1[0] + point2[0]);  
06928     temp_norm[2] += (point1[0] - point2[0])*(point1[1] + point2[1]);  
06929   }
06930 
06931   // Convert to unit vector
06932   magnitude = 0;
06933   for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
06934     magnitude += temp_norm[i]*temp_norm[i];
06935   magnitude = sqrt(magnitude);
06936   for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
06937     (*normal)[i] = temp_norm[i]/magnitude;
06938 }
06939 
06940 //@}
06941 
06942 /** \name Math helpers */
06943 //-------------------------------
06944 //@{
06945 
06946 /**
06947  * \ingroup  PrivateGeometricRelations
06948  * \brief Calculate determinant of a 2x2 matrix
06949  *
06950  * \description
06951  *
06952  *    Input is by rows (top row, then bottom row).
06953  *
06954  * \modifications  
06955  *    - 08/23/04 WSK created.
06956  */
06957 double _fc_calcDeterminant2x2(double a1, double a2,
06958                               double b1, double b2) {
06959   return a1*b2 - a2*b1;
06960 }
06961 
06962 /**
06963  * \ingroup  PrivateGeometricRelations
06964  * \brief Calculate determinant of a 3x3 matrix
06965  *
06966  * \description
06967  *
06968  *    Input is by rows (top row, middle row, etc).
06969  *
06970  * \modifications  
06971  *    - 08/23/04 WSK created.
06972  */
06973 double _fc_calcDeterminant3x3(double a1, double a2, double a3,
06974                               double b1, double b2, double b3,
06975                               double c1, double c2, double c3) {
06976   return (  a1 * _fc_calcDeterminant2x2(b2, b3, c2, c3)
06977           - b1 * _fc_calcDeterminant2x2(a2, a3, c2, c3)
06978           + c1 * _fc_calcDeterminant2x2(a2, a3, b2, b3) );
06979 }
06980 
06981 //@}
06982 
06983 /** \name Parameterization helpers */
06984 //-------------------------------
06985 //@{
06986 
06987 /**
06988  * \ingroup  PrivateGeometricRelations
06989  * \brief Compute parameterization of a point on a quad
06990  *
06991  * \description
06992  *  
06993  *   Given a point on a quad, computes the parameterization location
06994  *   (in u & v) of that point. Combined with fc_calcQuadLocation, it
06995  *   can be used to find the location of a point on a quad that
06996  *   has been moved or distorted. (If the point is not on the surface
06997  *   of the quad, the closest point on the surface of the quad is
06998  *   parameterized.)
06999  *
07000  *   I.e. given an initial quad and a point in xyz space, the points'
07001  *   relative position in the quad can determined as the parameters u and
07002  *   v. If the quad's vertices' coordinates change. The new xzy coordinates
07003  *   of the point can be determined from u and v and the new quad's
07004  *   coordinates. See fc_calcQuadLocation.
07005  *
07006  *   Although this routine returns doubles, they are only gauranted
07007  *   to have as many significant digits as a float.
07008  *
07009  * \modifications   
07010  *    - 2003-SEP-04  Wendy Koegler  Created.
07011  *    - 2006-09-07 WSD Clarified exit conditions.
07012  */
07013 void _fc_calcQuadParams(
07014   FC_Coords *vertices,     /**< input - the coordinates of the vertices of the quad */
07015   FC_Coords point,         /**< input - 3d coordinates of a point */
07016   int* numParam,           /**< output - the number of params found (0 or 2) */
07017   double** params          /**< output - the parameters found */
07018 ) {
07019   int i, j;
07020   int iter, MAX_ITER = 10;
07021   int converged;
07022   double diff[2], current[2], current_m[2];
07023   double fcol[2]; // solution vector
07024   double rcol[2], scol[2];  // columns of the Jacobian matrix
07025   double determinant;  // matrix determinant
07026   double weights[4];
07027   double derivs[8];
07028   double proj_point[3];
07029   FC_Vector normal;
07030   int indices[2];
07031   int maxID; // the index of the max component (which we will drop)
07032   double maxComponent;
07033   
07034   // default values
07035   *numParam = 0;
07036   *params = NULL;
07037 
07038   // get normal
07039   _fc_calcSurfaceNormal(4, vertices, &normal);
07040 
07041   // project point to plane of quad
07042   {
07043     double temp_point[3];
07044     double temp;
07045 
07046     // vector from point to "origin" of plane
07047     for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
07048       temp_point[i] = point[i] - vertices[0][i];
07049     // compute dot product
07050     temp = 0;
07051     for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
07052       temp += normal[i]*temp_point[i];
07053     // ??
07054     for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
07055       proj_point[i] = point[i] - temp*normal[i];
07056   }
07057 
07058   // choose indices
07059   maxID = 2;  
07060   maxComponent = fabs(normal[2]);
07061   for (i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
07062     if (fabs(normal[i]) > maxComponent) {
07063       maxID = i;
07064       maxComponent = fabs(normal[i]);
07065     }
07066   }
07067   j = 0;
07068   for (i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
07069     if (i != maxID) {
07070       indices[j] = i;
07071       j++;
07072     }
07073   }
07074 
07075   // Use Newton's method to solve for parametric coordinates
07076 
07077   // initial guess - starting at (0, 0) cause that can be a problem point
07078   current[0] = current[1] = 0;
07079 
07080   converged = 0;
07081   for (iter = 0; iter < MAX_ITER; iter++) {
07082     // intermediate calcs
07083     current_m[0] = 1. - current[0];
07084     current_m[1] = 1. - current[1];
07085     weights[0] = current_m[0] * current_m[1];
07086     weights[1] =   current[0] * current_m[1];
07087     weights[2] =   current[0] *   current[1];
07088     weights[3] = current_m[0] *   current[1];
07089     derivs[0] = -1 * current_m[1];
07090     derivs[1] =      current_m[1];
07091     derivs[2] =        current[1];
07092     derivs[3] = -1 *   current[1];
07093     derivs[4] = -1 * current_m[0];
07094     derivs[5] = -1 *   current[0];
07095     derivs[6] =        current[0];
07096     derivs[7] =      current_m[0];
07097 
07098     // calculate newton functions
07099     for (i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
07100       fcol[i] = -1 * proj_point[indices[i]];
07101       rcol[i] = scol[i] = 0.0;
07102     }
07103 
07104     for (i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
07105       for (j = 0; j < 2; j++) { // overdetermined system, only use 2 of 3 dims
07106         fcol[j] += vertices[i][indices[j]] * weights[i];
07107         rcol[j] += vertices[i][indices[j]] * derivs[i];
07108         scol[j] += vertices[i][indices[j]] * derivs[i+4];
07109       }
07110     }
07111 
07112     determinant = rcol[0]*scol[1] - scol[0]*rcol[1];
07113     // FIX: check, a zero determinant is bad
07114     diff[0] = (fcol[0]*scol[1] - scol[0]*fcol[1])/determinant;
07115     diff[1] = (rcol[0]*fcol[1] - fcol[0]*rcol[1])/determinant;
07116 
07117     // Test for exit, and set up next guess
07118     if (FC_DBL_EQUIV(current[0] - diff[0], current[0]) &&
07119      FC_DBL_EQUIV(current[1] - diff[1], current[1])) {
07120       converged = 1;
07121       break;
07122     }
07123     
07124     // guess for next round
07125     current[0] -= diff[0];
07126     current[1] -= diff[1];
07127   } // end of iteration
07128 
07129   // debug
07130   //printf("***iter = %d, converged = %d\n", iter, converged);
07131   //printf("***diff        = %.20g %.20g\n", diff[0], diff[1]);
07132   //printf("***params      = %.20g %.20g\n", current[0], current[1]);
07133   //printf("***params-diff = %.20g %.20g\n", current[0]-diff[0], current[1]-diff[1]);
07134 
07135   // HACK - The exit condition for the loop is very stringent
07136   // here we have a more relaxed condition
07137   if (fabs(diff[0]) < FLT_EPSILON && fabs(diff[1]) < FLT_EPSILON) {
07138     converged = 1;
07139   }
07140 
07141   if (converged) {
07142     *numParam = 2;
07143     *params = malloc(sizeof(double)*2);
07144     if ( *params == NULL) {
07145       fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_MEMORY_ERROR));
07146       exit(FC_MEMORY_ERROR);
07147     } 
07148     (*params)[0] = current[0];
07149     (*params)[1] = current[1];
07150   }
07151 }
07152 
07153 /**
07154  * \ingroup  PrivateGeometricRelations
07155  * \brief Compute parameterization of a point on a quad
07156  *
07157  * \description
07158  *  
07159  *   Given a point on a quad, computes the parameterization location
07160  *   (in u & v) of that point. Combined with fc_calcQuadLocation, it
07161  *   can be used to find the location of a point on a quad that
07162  *   has been moved or distorted.
07163  *
07164  *   I.e. given an initial quad and a point in xyz space, the points'
07165  *   relative position in the quad can determined as the parameters u and
07166  *   v. If the quad's vertices' coordinates change. The new xzy coordinates
07167  *   of the point can be determined from u and v and the new quad's
07168  *   coordinates. See fc_calcQuadLocation.
07169  *
07170  *   Assumes that the quad is planar. Code is based on implementation in
07171  *   VTK (visualization toolkit). Somebody should probably check the
07172  *   theoretics ....
07173  *
07174  * \modifications   
07175  *    - 2003-SEP-04  Wendy Koegler  Created.
07176  */
07177 void _fc_calcQuadLocation(
07178   FC_Coords *vertices,     /**< input -  the coordinates of the vertices of the quad */
07179   int numParam,            /**< input - the number of params  */
07180   double* params,          /**< input - the parameters of the point */
07181   FC_Coords* point         /**< output - 3d coordinates of the point */
07182 ) {
07183   int i, j;
07184   double params_m[2];
07185   double weights[4];
07186   
07187   // FIX? default value?
07188 
07189   if (numParam != 2)
07190     return;
07191 
07192   // intermediate calcs
07193   params_m[0] = 1. - params[0];
07194   params_m[1] = 1. - params[1];
07195   weights[0] = params_m[0] * params_m[1];
07196   weights[1] =   params[0] * params_m[1];
07197   weights[2] =   params[0] *   params[1];
07198   weights[3] = params_m[0] *   params[1];
07199 
07200   for (i = 0; i < 3; i++)
07201     (*point)[i] = 0;
07202 
07203   for (i = 0; i < 4; i++) 
07204     for (j = 0; j < 3; j++) 
07205       (*point)[j] += vertices[i][j] * weights[i];
07206 }
07207 
07208 //@}
07209 
07210 /** \name Mesh entities' measurement helpers */
07211 //-------------------------------
07212 //@{
07213 
07214 /**
07215  * \ingroup  PrivateGeometricRelations
07216  * \brief Compute surface area of a triangle
07217  *
07218  * \description
07219  *    
07220  *    Provide array of three vertex coords and get the area back.
07221  *
07222  * \modifications
07223  *    - 8/23/04 WSK Created
07224  *    - 6/30/06 WSD Saw roundoff error w/ gcc 4 with Kahan's algorithm,
07225  *        switched back to Heron's which works fine.
07226  */
07227 void _fc_calcTriArea(
07228   int numDim,           /**< input - the dimensionality of coordinates */
07229   FC_Coords *vertices,  /**< input - the coordinates of the tri */
07230   double* area          /**< output - surface area */
07231 ) {
07232   double a2, b2, c2;
07233   //double a, b, c, da, db, dc;
07234 
07235   // get lengths of sides of triangle
07236   fc_calcSquaredEuclideanDistance(vertices[0], vertices[1], numDim, &a2);
07237   fc_calcSquaredEuclideanDistance(vertices[1], vertices[2], numDim, &b2);
07238   fc_calcSquaredEuclideanDistance(vertices[2], vertices[0], numDim, &c2);
07239 
07240   // A version of Heron's formula
07241   *area = 0.25 * sqrt(fabs(4.0*a2*c2 - (a2-b2+c2)*(a2-b2+c2)));
07242 
07243   // Not used: found lacking on 6/30/06 by WSD. Switch back to old formula
07244   // This formula is from pdf found on the web:
07245   // http://www.cs.berkeley.edu/~wkahan/VtetLang.pdf
07246   // "What has the Volume of a Tetrahedron to do with Computer
07247   // Programming Languages?" 
07248   // by Prof. W. Kahan, Math Dept & EE & CS Dept at Berkeley
07249   //
07250   // It is supposed to be more accurate in terms of roundoff error
07251   // than the typical Heron's formula and other methods. 
07252   /*
07253   if (b > c)
07254     da = (b - a) + c;
07255   else 
07256     da = (c - a) + b;
07257   if (a > c)
07258     db = (a - b) + c;
07259   else
07260     db = (c - b) + a;
07261   if (a > b)
07262     dc = (a - c) + b;
07263   else
07264     dc = (b - c) + a;
07265   *area = 0.25 * sqrt((a+b+c)*da*db*dc);
07266   */
07267 
07268   return;
07269 }
07270 
07271 /**
07272  * \ingroup  PrivateGeometricRelations
07273  * \brief Compute surface area of a quadrilateral
07274  *
07275  * \description
07276  *    
07277  *    Provide array of vertex coords and get the area back. Note that
07278  *    if the coords are 2D, the last entry of FC_Coords should be 0.
07279  *
07280  *    This routine works for planar convex and planar nonconvex quads.
07281  *    (Will return results for non-planar quads, but behavior may not be what
07282  *    you want).
07283  *
07284  *    Basic procedure: divide the quad into two triangles and sum the
07285  *    areas of those triangles. There are two possible ways to divide a quad
07286  *    into triangles. This choice is important for non-convex quads and it
07287  *    should be chosen so that the shared edge falls within the quad. 
07288  *    However, figuring out which way to divide quads is difficult. Instead,
07289  *    the procedure is to calculate the quad area for both divisions and
07290  *    then to choose the smaller area (the wrong division for a non-convex
07291  *    quad would double count area outside of the quad).
07292  *
07293  * \modifications   
07294  *    - 8/23/04 WSK Created
07295  */
07296 void _fc_calcQuadArea(
07297   int numDim,           /**< input - the dimensionality of coordinates */
07298   FC_Coords *vertices,  /**< input - the coordinates of the tri */
07299   double* area          /**< output - surface area */
07300 ) {
07301   int i, j, k;
07302   FC_Coords coords[4][3];
07303   int lookup[4][3] = { { 0, 1, 2 }, { 0, 2, 3 }, { 0, 1, 3 }, { 1, 2, 3 } };
07304   double area_tri1, area_tri2, area1, area2;
07305 
07306   // setup triangles
07307   for (i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
07308     for (j = 0; j < 3; j++) {
07309       for (k = 0; k < numDim; k++) {
07310         coords[i][j][k] = vertices[lookup[i][j]][k];
07311       }
07312     }
07313   }
07314 
07315   _fc_calcTriArea(numDim, coords[0], &area_tri1);
07316   _fc_calcTriArea(numDim, coords[1], &area_tri2);
07317   area1 = area_tri1 + area_tri2;
07318   _fc_calcTriArea(numDim, coords[2], &area_tri1);
07319   _fc_calcTriArea(numDim, coords[3], &area_tri2);
07320   area2 = area_tri1 + area_tri2;
07321 
07322   // return smaller area
07323   if (area1 < area2)
07324     *area = area1;
07325   else
07326     *area = area2;
07327   
07328   return;
07329 }
07330 
07331 /**
07332  * \ingroup  PrivateGeometricRelations
07333  * \brief Compute volume of a tetrahedron
07334  *
07335  * \description
07336  *    
07337  *    Provide array of four vertex coords and get the volume back.
07338  *
07339  *    Implementation taken from vtk: vtkTetra::ComputeVolume.
07340  *
07341  * \modifications   
07342  *    - 8/23/04 WSK Created
07343  */
07344 void _fc_calcTetVolume(
07345   FC_Coords *vertices,  /**< input - the coordinates of the tri */
07346   double* volume        /**< output - surface area */
07347 ) {
07348   *volume = _fc_calcDeterminant3x3(vertices[1][0] - vertices[0][0],
07349                                    vertices[2][0] - vertices[0][0],
07350                                    vertices[3][0] - vertices[0][0],
07351                                    vertices[1][1] - vertices[0][1],
07352                                    vertices[2][1] - vertices[0][1],
07353                                    vertices[3][1] - vertices[0][1],
07354                                    vertices[1][2] - vertices[0][2],
07355                                    vertices[2][2] - vertices[0][2],
07356                                    vertices[3][2] - vertices[0][2]) / 6.0;
07357   return;
07358 }
07359 
07360 /**
07361  * \ingroup  PrivateGeometricRelations
07362  * \brief Compute volume of a pyramid
07363  *
07364  * \description
07365  *    
07366  *    Provide array of five vertex coords and get the volume back
07367  *    (the tip of the pyramid is the last last vertex).
07368  *
07369  *    Implementation. Divides the pyramid into 2 tets and sum their volumes.
07370  *    Only accurate if square face is planar.
07371  *
07372  * \modifications   
07373  *    - 8/24/04 WSK Created
07374  */
07375 void _fc_calcPyramidVolume(
07376   FC_Coords *vertices,  /**< input - the coordinates of the tri */
07377   double* volume        /**< output - region volume */
07378 ) {
07379   // Note, if the square face is not concave, this works no matter which
07380   // way you split the tet's because if you split "wrong" you get a positve
07381   // and negative tet volume that add up to the right answer. I think.
07382   int i, j, k;
07383   int numDim = 3;
07384   FC_Coords coords[4];
07385   int lookup[2][4] = { { 0, 1, 3, 4 }, { 1, 2, 3, 4 } };
07386   double temp_vol;
07387 
07388   *volume = 0.0;
07389   for (i = 0; i < 2; i++) {
07390     // get coords for tet i
07391     for (j = 0; j < 4; j++)
07392       for (k = 0; k < numDim; k++) 
07393         coords[j][k] = vertices[lookup[i][j]][k];
07394     // add volume for tet i
07395     _fc_calcTetVolume(coords, &temp_vol);
07396     *volume += temp_vol;
07397   }
07398 
07399   return;
07400 }
07401 
07402 /**
07403  * \ingroup  PrivateGeometricRelations
07404  * \brief Compute volume of a prism
07405  *
07406  * \description
07407  *    
07408  *    Provide array of six vertex coords and get the volume back.
07409  *
07410  *    Implementation. Divides the prism into 3 tets and sums their volumes.
07411  *    Probably only accurate if square faces are convex and planar.
07412  *
07413  * \modifications   
07414  *    - 8/24/04 WSK Created
07415  */
07416 void _fc_calcPrismVolume(
07417   FC_Coords *vertices,  /**< input - the coordinates of the tri */
07418   double* volume        /**< output - region volume */
07419 ) {
07420   int i, j, k;
07421   int numDim = 3;
07422   FC_Coords coords[4];
07423   int lookup[3][4] = { { 0, 1, 2, 3 }, { 1, 4, 2, 3 }, { 2, 4, 5, 3 } };
07424   double temp_vol;
07425 
07426   *volume = 0.0;
07427   for (i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
07428     // get coords for tet i
07429     for (j = 0; j < 4; j++)
07430       for (k = 0; k < numDim; k++) 
07431         coords[j][k] = vertices[lookup[i][j]][k];
07432     // add volume for tet i
07433     _fc_calcTetVolume(coords, &temp_vol);
07434     *volume += temp_vol;
07435   }
07436 
07437   return;
07438 }
07439 
07440 /**
07441  * \ingroup  PrivateGeometricRelations
07442  * \brief Compute volume of a hex
07443  *
07444  * \description
07445  *    
07446  *    Provide array of vertex coords and get the volume back.
07447  *
07448  *    Probably only works if the hex is convex.
07449  *
07450  *    Implementation. Divides the hex into 5 tets and sum their volumes.
07451  *    Probably only accurate if square faces are convex and planar.
07452  *
07453  * \modifications   
07454  *    - 8/23/04 WSK Created
07455  */
07456 void _fc_calcHexVolume(
07457   FC_Coords *vertices,  /**< input - the coordinates of the tri */
07458   double* volume        /**< output - region volume */
07459 ) {
07460   int i, j, k;
07461   int numDim = 3;
07462   FC_Coords coords[4];
07463   int lookup[5][4] = { { 0, 1, 2, 5 }, { 0, 2, 3, 7 }, { 0, 5, 7, 4 },
07464                        { 2, 7, 5, 6 }, { 0, 5, 2, 7 } };
07465   double temp_vol;
07466 
07467   *volume = 0.0;
07468   for (i = 0; i < 5; i++) {
07469     // get coords for tet i
07470     for (j = 0; j < 4; j++)
07471       for (k = 0; k < numDim; k++) 
07472         coords[j][k] = vertices[lookup[i][j]][k];
07473     // add volume for tet i
07474     _fc_calcTetVolume(coords, &temp_vol);
07475     *volume += temp_vol;
07476   }
07477 
07478   return;
07479 }

07481 //@}
07482 
07483 
07484 /**
07485  * \ingroup GeometricRelations
07486  * \brief Deteremine where a ray intersects with a triangle
07487  *
07488  * \description
07489  * 
07490  *   Given a ray (ie, point and direction) and a triangle, determine if and where
07491  *   the ray intersects the triangle. This implementation is taken from the
07492  *   well-known algorithm from Moller and Trumbore's 1997 "Fast, Minimum Storage
07493  *   Ray-Triangle Intersection" paper. 
07494  *
07495  *    returns 1 if an intersection occurred, or 0 if they do not intersect
07496  *
07497  * \modifications
07498  *    - 03/20/2008 CDU Initial version
07499  *
07500  */
07501 int fc_getIntersectionBetweenRayAndTriangle(
07502      double ray_origin[3],    /**< input - coordinate for where the ray originates */
07503      double ray_direction[3], /**< input - normalized direction of the ray */
07504      double tri_vert0[3],     /**< input - Triangle vertex coordinate 1 */ 
07505      double tri_vert1[3],     /**< input - Triangle vertex coordinate 2 */ 
07506      double tri_vert2[3],     /**< input - Triangle vertex coordinate 3 */ 
07507      double *t,               /**< output - Distance from origin to the point of intersection (can be negative if opposite direction of ray) */
07508      double *u,               /**< output - Intersection coordinate within triangle */
07509      double *v){              /**< output - Intersecrion coordinate within triangle */
07510   
07511 #define RTI_DEBUG (0)
07512 #define RTI_DBG(a,b) { if(RTI_DEBUG) printf(" (%.3lf) %s\n", b, (a)?"hit":"miss"); }
07513 
07514   double edge1[3], edge2[3], tvec[3], pvec[3], qvec[3];
07515   double det,inv_det;
07516   double tt,uu,vv;
07517   const double RTI_EPSILON =  0.000001;
07518 
07519   #define CROSS(dest,v1,v2) \
07520     dest[0]=v1[1]*v2[2]-v1[2]*v2[1];       \
07521     dest[1]=v1[2]*v2[0]-v1[0]*v2[2];       \
07522     dest[2]=v1[0]*v2[1]-v1[1]*v2[0];
07523   #define DOT(v1,v2) (v1[0]*v2[0]+v1[1]*v2[1]+v1[2]*v2[2])
07524   #define SUB(dest,v1,v2)            \
07525     dest[0]=v1[0]-v2[0];        \
07526     dest[1]=v1[1]-v2[1];        \
07527     dest[2]=v1[2]-v2[2]; 
07528 
07529 #if RTI_DEBUG
07530   { //Debug code for comparing intersections
07531     int i;
07532     printf("Origin:");
07533     for(i=0; i<3;i++) printf(" %.3lf", ray_origin[i]);
07534     printf("  direction:");
07535     for(i=0; i<3;i++) printf(" %.3lf", ray_direction[i]);
07536     printf("  p0:");
07537     for(i=0; i<3;i++) printf(" %.3lf", tri_vert0[i]);
07538     printf("  p1:");
07539     for(i=0; i<3;i++) printf(" %.3lf", tri_vert1[i]);
07540     printf("  p2:");
07541     for(i=0; i<3;i++) printf(" %.3lf", tri_vert2[i]);
07542   }
07543 #endif
07544 
07545   //find vectors for two edges sharing vert0 
07546   SUB(edge1, tri_vert1, tri_vert0);
07547   SUB(edge2, tri_vert2, tri_vert0);
07548 
07549   //begin calculating determinant - also used to calculate U parameter
07550   CROSS(pvec, ray_direction, edge2);
07551 
07552   //if determinant is near zero, ray lies in plane of triangle 
07553   det = DOT(edge1, pvec);
07554 
07555   //the non-culling branch
07556   if (det > -RTI_EPSILON && det < RTI_EPSILON){
07557     RTI_DBG(0,0.0);
07558     return 0;
07559   }
07560   inv_det = 1.0 / det;
07561 
07562   //calculate distance from vert0 to ray origin */
07563   SUB(tvec, ray_origin, tri_vert0);
07564 
07565   //calculate U parameter and test bounds
07566   uu = DOT(tvec, pvec) * inv_det;
07567   if (uu < 0.0 || uu > 1.0){
07568     RTI_DBG(0,0.0);
07569     return 0;
07570   }
07571 
07572   //prepare to test V parameter
07573   CROSS(qvec, tvec, edge1);
07574 
07575   //calculate V parameter and test bounds
07576   vv = DOT(ray_direction, qvec) * inv_det;
07577   if (vv < 0.0 || uu + vv > 1.0){
07578     RTI_DBG(0,0.0);
07579     return 0;
07580   }
07581 
07582   //calculate t, ray intersects triangle
07583   tt = DOT(edge2, qvec) * inv_det;
07584 
07585   if(t) *t=tt;
07586   if(u) *u=uu;
07587   if(v) *v=vv;
07588 
07589   RTI_DBG(1,tt);
07590   return 1;
07591 
07592   #undef RTI_DEBUG
07593   #undef RTI_DBG
07594   #undef CROSS
07595   #undef DOT
07596   #undef SUB
07597 }
07598 
07599 
07600 
07601 
07602 /**
07603  * \ingroup PrivateGeometricRelations
07604  * \brief Internal function for determining whether a point is located within an element
07605  *
07606  * \description
07607  * 
07608  *   This internal function determines whether a point resides inside of an element
07609  *   or not. The function requires a number of inputs, including information about
07610  *   the mesh's faces and vertex coordinates (which can be obtained with
07611  *   fc_getMeshCoordsPtr() and fc_getMeshFaceConnsPtr()).
07612  *
07613  *   This function obtains all of the element's faces and then breaks each face into
07614  *   a collection of triangles. A ray-triangle intersection computation is performed
07615  *   with each triangle. If the point is inside the element, there will only be
07616  *   one intersection with a triangle. This function tries to detect when an
07617  *   intersection point happens to fall on the edge between two triangles (by verifying
07618  *   the distance is the same). In the case where the input point is lies in one
07619  *   of the element's faces, it is counted as being contained within the element.
07620  *
07621  *   note: it is possible for multiple elements to contain an element if 
07622  *         (a) the elements overlap, or (b) the
07623  *         point lies on a vertex or face the two elements have in common.
07624  *
07625  * \modifications
07626  *    - 03/20/2008 CDU Initial version
07627  *
07628  */
07629 FC_ReturnCode  _fc_doesElementContainPoint(
07630    FC_Mesh mesh,    /**< input - The mesh this element belong to */
07631    int element_id,  /**< input - The id of the mesh element being examined */
07632    double point[3], /**< input - The xyz coordinate being evaluated */
07633    int dim,         /**< input - The dimension of the coordinates (must be 3) */
07634    int max_num_vert_per_face, /**< input - maximum number of vertices a face can have */
07635    int *num_vert_per_face,    /**< input - number of vertices each face has */
07636    int *face_conns,           /**< input - face connectivity list */
07637    double *vert_coords,       /**< input - coordinates for each vertex */
07638    int *hit_type              /**< output - Result (0=does not contain, 1=containts, 2=contains, but point is on a face) */
07639 ){
07640 
07641   int i,j;
07642   int num_faces;
07643   int *face_ids;
07644 
07645 
07646   int found_positive_hit, found_negative_hit;
07647   double t_val_positive, t_val_negative;
07648   int face_offset;
07649   double t;
07650   int hit;
07651 
07652   //In theory, we should do the test multiple times with randomly
07653   //generated directions. This helps weed out corner cases where
07654   //an edge/vertex happens to be in just the wrong spot. However, if we
07655   //compare the distance of all he intersections, and consider t=0.0 to
07656   //be a special case, I believe we can live with a single direction.
07657   double ray_direction[3] = {1.0, 0.0, 0.0};
07658 
07659 
07660   FC_ReturnCode rc;
07661 
07662   //Check inputs. Note: Mesh is checked in following step
07663   if(  (element_id<0) || (!point) || (!ray_direction) || 
07664        (max_num_vert_per_face<=0) || (!num_vert_per_face) ||
07665        (!vert_coords) || (!hit_type) ) {
07666     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
07667     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
07668   }
07669 
07670   if(dim!=3){
07671     fc_printfErrorMessage("Containment functions only work with 3-Dimensional data");
07672     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
07673   }
07674 
07675   *hit_type = 0; //clear the output
07676 
07677  
07678   //Need to get all the faces for this element
07679   rc = fc_getMeshEntityChildren(mesh, 
07680                     FC_AT_ELEMENT, element_id, //Parent: element 
07681                     FC_AT_FACE,                //Children: faces
07682                     &num_faces, &face_ids);
07683   if(rc!=FC_SUCCESS) return rc;
07684 
07685   found_positive_hit = found_negative_hit = 0;
07686 
07687   //Scan through all faces of element
07688   for(i=0; (i<num_faces); i++){
07689 
07690     if(num_vert_per_face[ face_ids[i] ] < 3){
07691       fc_printfErrorMessage("Element face must have at least 3 vertices for hit test");
07692       free(face_ids);
07693       return FC_ERROR;
07694     }
07695 
07696     face_offset = max_num_vert_per_face * face_ids[i]; //Shorthand
07697 
07698     //Break each face into a set of 1 or more triangles
07699     for(j=0; (j<num_vert_per_face[ face_ids[i] ] - 2); j++){
07700       hit =  fc_getIntersectionBetweenRayAndTriangle(
07701                point, //Point is ray's origin
07702                ray_direction,
07703                      &vert_coords[ dim * face_conns[ face_offset + 0   ] ], //triangle point 0
07704                &vert_coords[ dim * face_conns[ face_offset + j+1 ] ], //triangle point 1
07705                &vert_coords[ dim * face_conns[ face_offset + j+2 ] ], //triangle point 2
07706                &t,NULL,NULL); //Only care about t, the distance to triangle
07707 
07708       if(hit){
07709 
07710      if((fc_eqd(t,0.0)) || (fc_eqd(t,-0.0)) ){
07711        *hit_type = 2; //point is on a face
07712        free(face_ids);
07713        return FC_SUCCESS;
07714 
07715      } else if (fc_gtd(t,0.0)){
07716 
07717        if(found_positive_hit){
07718 
07719          if(t!=t_val_positive){
07720            //Hit more than one place. Bail out.
07721            free(face_ids);
07722            return FC_SUCCESS;
07723          }
07724          //Otherwise, this must have been a common edge/vertex, keep going
07725        } else {
07726          //First unique hit, record distance so we can count intersections
07727          t_val_positive = t;
07728          found_positive_hit = 1;
07729        }
07730      } else { //negative hit
07731        
07732        if(found_negative_hit){
07733          if(t!=t_val_negative){
07734            //Hit more than one place. Bail out.
07735            free(face_ids);
07736            return FC_SUCCESS;
07737          }
07738          //Otherwise, this must have been a common edge/vertex, keep going
07739        } else {
07740          //First unique hit, record distance so we can count intersecrions
07741          t_val_negative = t;
07742          found_negative_hit = 1;
07743        }
07744      }
07745       }
07746     }
07747   }
07748   *hit_type = found_positive_hit && found_negative_hit;
07749   free(face_ids);
07750   return FC_SUCCESS;
07751 
07752 }
07753 
07754 /**
07755  * \ingroup GeometricRelations
07756  * \brief Determines whether a point is located within an element or not
07757  *
07758  * \description
07759  * 
07760  *   This function determines whether a point resides inside, outside, or exactly
07761  *   on the boundary of an element. Internally this function breaks an element's
07762  *   faces into a set of triangles and does ray-triangle intersections to
07763  *   determine whether the element contains the point.
07764  *
07765  *   If multiple elements are being analyzed for a single point, it is 
07766  *   more efficient to utilize the fc_getElementsThatContainPoint() or
07767  *   fc_getElementsFromSubsetThatContainPoint() functions.
07768  *   
07769  *
07770  * \modifications
07771  *    - 03/20/2008 CDU Initial version
07772  *
07773  */
07774 FC_ReturnCode fc_doesElementContainPoint(
07775   FC_Mesh m,        /**< input - The mesh that the element belongs to */
07776   int element_id,   /**< input - The id of the element in this mesh that is to be examined */ 
07777   double *point,    /**< input - The xyz coordinate being evaluated */
07778   int *contain_type /**< output - Result (0=does not contain, 1=contains, 2=contains, but point is on surface) */
07779 ){
07780 
07781   FC_ReturnCode rc;
07782   FC_ElementType elem_type;
07783   int     dim, num_element, vert_per_elem;
07784   int    *num_vert_per_face; //ro
07785   int     max_num_vert_per_face;
07786   int    *face_conns;  //ro
07787   double *vert_coords; //ro
07788 
07789   if((!point) || (!contain_type)){
07790     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
07791     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
07792   }
07793 
07794   rc = fc_getMeshInfo(m, NULL, &dim, NULL, &num_element, &elem_type); 
07795   if(rc!=FC_SUCCESS) return rc;
07796 
07797   if((dim!=3) || (elem_type<FC_ET_TET)){
07798     fc_printfErrorMessage("Containment functions only work with 3D coordinates and elements>FC_ET_TRIANGLE");
07799     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
07800     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
07801   }
07802 
07803   if((element_id<0)||(element_id>=num_element)){
07804     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s: Element id %d is out of bounds for this mesh, which has %d elements", 
07805                  fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR), element_id, num_element);
07806     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
07807   }
07808 
07809   vert_per_elem = fc_getElementTypeNumVertex(elem_type);
07810 
07811   rc = fc_getMeshCoordsPtr(m, &vert_coords);
07812   if(rc!=FC_SUCCESS) return rc;
07813 
07814   rc = fc_getMeshFaceConnsPtr(m, &num_vert_per_face, &max_num_vert_per_face, &face_conns);
07815   if(rc!=FC_SUCCESS) return rc;
07816 
07817 
07818   //Test an element
07819   rc = _fc_doesElementContainPoint(m, element_id, point, dim, 
07820                 max_num_vert_per_face, num_vert_per_face, 
07821                 face_conns, vert_coords, contain_type);
07822 
07823   return rc;
07824  
07825 
07826 }
07827 
07828 
07829 
07830 /**
07831  * \ingroup GeometricRelations
07832  * \brief Determines which elements (individually) enclose a point
07833  *
07834  * \description
07835  * 
07836  *   This function determines if a point resides inside or exactly
07837  *   on the boundary of each of the input elements. 
07838  *
07839  *   note: Geometry must be 3-dimensional
07840  *   note: Elements must be tets or higher
07841  *
07842  *   If only a single element is being examined, it may be easier to use
07843  *   the fc_doesElementContainPoint() function.
07844  *
07845  *   If a subset of the elements of interest is available, it may be more 
07846  *   convenient to use fc_getElementsFromSubsetThatContainPoint().
07847  *
07848  * \modifications
07849  *    - 03/20/2008 CDU Initial version
07850  *
07851  */
07852 FC_ReturnCode fc_getElementsThatContainPoint(
07853   FC_Mesh m,          /**< input - The mesh that the element belongs to */
07854   int *element_mask,  /**< input - A mask for the mesh that specifiy which elements to consider (NULL=all) */
07855   double point[3],    /**< input - The xyz coordinate being evaluated */
07856   int *num_elem_ids,  /**< output - The number of elements that were found to contain the point */
07857   int **elem_ids      /**< output - The IDs of the elements that were found to contain the point */
07858 ){
07859  
07860   int i;
07861   FC_ReturnCode rc;
07862   FC_ElementType elem_type;
07863   int     dim, num_element, vert_per_elem;
07864   int    *num_vert_per_face; //ro
07865   int     max_num_vert_per_face;
07866   int    *face_conns;  //ro
07867   double *vert_coords; //ro
07868 
07869   int hit_type;
07870 
07871   int  res_num_elem_ids;
07872   int *res_elem_ids;
07873 
07874   if(!point || !num_elem_ids){
07875     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
07876     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
07877   }
07878 
07879   rc = fc_getMeshInfo(m, NULL, &dim, NULL, &num_element, &elem_type); 
07880   if(rc!=FC_SUCCESS) return rc;
07881 
07882   if((dim!=3) || (elem_type<FC_ET_TET)){
07883     fc_printfErrorMessage("Containment functions only work with 3D coordinates and elements>FC_ET_TRIANGLE");
07884     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
07885     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
07886   }
07887 
07888   vert_per_elem = fc_getElementTypeNumVertex(elem_type);
07889 
07890   rc = fc_getMeshCoordsPtr(m, &vert_coords);
07891   if(rc!=FC_SUCCESS) return rc;
07892 
07893   rc = fc_getMeshFaceConnsPtr(m, &num_vert_per_face, &max_num_vert_per_face, &face_conns);
07894   if(rc!=FC_SUCCESS) return rc;
07895 
07896 
07897   //Allocate space for largest possible result
07898   res_num_elem_ids=0;
07899   res_elem_ids=(int *)malloc(num_element*sizeof(int));
07900 
07901 
07902   //Scan all elements and see which ones we fit in
07903   for(i=0; i<num_element; i++){
07904 
07905     if(element_mask && (!element_mask[i])) continue; //Bail out if 
07906 
07907     //Test an element
07908     rc = _fc_doesElementContainPoint(m, i, point, dim, 
07909                max_num_vert_per_face, num_vert_per_face, 
07910                face_conns, vert_coords, &hit_type);
07911              
07912     if(rc!=FC_SUCCESS){      
07913       free(res_elem_ids);
07914       return rc;
07915     }
07916 
07917     //Add this element to the list if it contains point
07918     if(hit_type>0){
07919       res_elem_ids[res_num_elem_ids++] = i;
07920     }
07921   }
07922 
07923   //Pass the results back to the user
07924   if(res_num_elem_ids){
07925     if(elem_ids) //Only pass back if user asks
07926       *elem_ids = realloc(res_elem_ids, res_num_elem_ids*sizeof(int));
07927   } else {
07928     //No results, free by hand
07929     if(elem_ids)
07930       *elem_ids = NULL;
07931     free(res_elem_ids); 
07932   }
07933   *num_elem_ids = res_num_elem_ids;
07934 
07935   return FC_SUCCESS;
07936 }
07937 
07938 /**
07939  * \ingroup GeometricRelations
07940  * \brief Determines which elements (individually) enclose a point
07941  *
07942  * \description
07943  * 
07944  *   This function determines if a point resides inside or exactly
07945  *   ont the boundary of each input element listed in a subset.
07946  *
07947  *   note: Geometry must be 3-dimensional
07948  *   note: Elements must be tets or higher
07949  *
07950  *   If only a single element is being examined, it may be easier to use
07951  *   the fc_doesElementContainPoint() function.
07952  *
07953  *
07954  * \modifications
07955  *    - 03/20/2008 CDU Initial version
07956  *
07957  */
07958 FC_ReturnCode fc_getElementsThatContainPointFromSubset(
07959   FC_Subset subset,  /**< input - The subset of elements that need to be inspected */
07960   double point[3],   /**< input - The xyz coordinate being evaluated */
07961   int *num_elem_ids, /**< output - The number of elements that were found to contain the point */ 
07962   int **elem_ids     /**< output - The IDs of the elements that were found to contain the point */
07963 ){
07964 
07965   FC_ReturnCode rc;
07966   FC_Mesh m;
07967   FC_AssociationType assoc;
07968   int  num_subset_members;
07969   int  mask_length;
07970   int *mask;
07971   int  tmp_num_elem_ids;
07972   int *tmp_elem_ids;
07973 
07974   if((!point)||(!num_elem_ids)){
07975     fc_printfErrorMessage("%s", fc_getReturnCodeText(FC_INPUT_ERROR));
07976     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
07977   }
07978 
07979   rc = fc_getSubsetInfo(subset, &num_subset_members, NULL, &assoc);
07980   if(rc!=FC_SUCCESS) return rc;
07981 
07982 
07983   //Set default return values
07984   *num_elem_ids = 0;
07985   if(elem_ids) *elem_ids=NULL;
07986 
07987   if(assoc!=FC_AT_ELEMENT){
07988     fc_printfErrorMessage("Association type must be FC_AT_ELEMENT");
07989     return FC_INPUT_ERROR;
07990   }
07991 
07992   if(!num_subset_members){
07993     //No items in subset, result will be empty
07994     return FC_SUCCESS;
07995   }    
07996 
07997   rc = fc_getMeshFromSubset(subset, &m);
07998   if(rc!=FC_SUCCESS) return rc;
07999 
08000   rc = fc_getSubsetMembersAsMask(subset, &mask_length, &mask);
08001   if(rc!=FC_SUCCESS) return rc;
08002   
08003 
08004   rc = fc_getElementsThatContainPoint(m, mask, point, &tmp_num_elem_ids, &tmp_elem_ids);
08005   free(mask);
08006   if(rc!=FC_SUCCESS) return rc;
08007   
08008   //Pass back to user
08009   *num_elem_ids = tmp_num_elem_ids;
08010   if(elem_ids) *elem_ids = tmp_elem_ids;
08011 
08012   return FC_SUCCESS;
08013 }
